VB_SawMindflayer.speaker: Player
VB_SawMindflayer.text: There! A mind flayer - and it's hurt.

VB_SawMindflayer.speaker: Player
VB_SawMindflayer.text: Even injured, it's dangerous. Be careful.

VB_OtherSurvivors.speaker: Player
VB_OtherSurvivors.text: Footprints. There may be even more that survived the crash.

AD_KilledMindflayer.speaker: Player
AD_KilledMindflayer.text: Monster. Death is too good for it.

session_synopses.VB_SawMindflayer: The party remarks when seeing people trying to dig somebody out of the wreckage in the chaos of the nautiloid crash site
session_synopses.VB_OtherSurvivors: The party remarks on seeing footprints.
session_synopses.AD_KilledMindflayer: The party comments after killing the mind flayer that lay dying in the wreckage.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your skull throbs, your muscles ache. Memories of the last day swim through your head before taking form.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'Zel solo scene, custom cameras may be required.

node_data.speaker: Lae'zel
node_data.text: Brush off the pain - there is no time to waste.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The pain deepens as you take in the world around you.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Whatever this place, you know Vlaakith's protocol: you must locate a githyanki crèche.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *It is only a matter of days before tentacles split your lips, and your skin turns to gore.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *At a crèche, you will find your kin. The tadpole will be removed, and you will be purified.*

session_synopses: Laezel wakes up and reflects on what she needs to do after the crash. Vlaakith'ka sivim hrath krash'ht: VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het.

node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Nautiloid arrives in Faerun

AD.speaker: Shadowheart
AD.text: Ngh... no...
AD.context: NodeContext: Unconscious groans of pain and shock

session_synopses.AD: Shadowheart groans and moans while unconscious. This occurs immediately after the nautiloid crash, with the player finding her lying on the ground amongst the debris.

PAD_Approach.speaker: Player
PAD_Approach.text: What's going on with that rune? Looks unstable somehow.
PAD_Approach.context:
NodeContext: 
Karlach: Fascinated, curious
Wary/a little curious

session_synopses.PAD_Approach: Player notices a strange magical emission coming from a waypoint rune - different from how they usually look.

ScaredBoar.speaker: Player
ScaredBoar.text: Raise your palms to calm the boar.

ScaredBoar.speaker: Narrator
ScaredBoar.text: *The boar grunts and eyes you warily with its beady eyes.*

ScaredBoar.speaker: Player
ScaredBoar.text: Don't worry. I won't harm you.

ScaredBoar.speaker: Narrator
ScaredBoar.text: *The boar shuffles its trotters, unsure. Then it dashes away into the wilderness.*

session_synopses.AD_Rock: A player passes by a hidden Harper cache. If they pass a Perception check, they discover the rock hiding the cache. Otherwise, they just comment on the nearby ocean view.
session_synopses.ScaredBoar: The player comes across a boar who's been panicked by the noise and confusion of nearby flying vessel crash. A speak with animals dialogue where the player can speak directly, or an animal handling moment where the player gains insight into the animal's temperament.

session_synopses.Recruitment_AD: As you walk down the road, Astarion calls out to you. He's got something dangerous trapped and needs your help to finish it off.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you wake, the tadpole squirms in your skull.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Check yourself for injuries.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Other than the infection, you're more or less intact. A miracle, given everything you've been through.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player glances over themselves

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *But it'll all be for nothing if you don't find help soon.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The tadpole is a death sentence, and the clock is ticking. You need a cure.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Concerned expression

session_synopses: This is the dialogue each avatar gets when they wake up on the beach in WLD_Main_A Crash site.It's a call to action to find a solution for the tadpole before you turn into a mindflayer.

Crevice.speaker: Narrator
Crevice.text: *At the back of the crevice lies a bag, enfolded in the chitinous squabbling of spiders. A shiny gold coin pokes from its mouth.*
Crevice.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks into the crevice. We see a bag at the bottom with a coin sticking out.

Crevice.speaker: Narrator
Crevice.text: *The creatures clutch the pouch possessively. You have no doubt: a spider egg is nestled within.*

Crevice.speaker: Player
Crevice.text: Speak softly to the spiders in hopes of calming them.

session_synopses.Crevice: The player peeks into a crevice to see a coin pouch covered in small spiders.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.speaker: Damays
AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.text: Eyes on the toad-freak. We can't risk it escaping.

AD_TieflingsLeaving.speaker: Damays
AD_TieflingsLeaving.text: Observe - and listen. You'll hear goblins before you see them.

AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.text: They must have carried something useful.

AD_OpenCage1.speaker: Nymessa
AD_OpenCage1.text: Shoot it down. Let's kill this thing.

AD_LaeZelDead.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelDead.text: Hold it together. We've got to finish what we started.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: And when the goblins ally with it?

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Nymessa
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: We'll be on the road to Baldur's Gate.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: When this thing strikes, there will be no soldiers to protect you. This isn't Elturel.

AD_LeavingAnyCombat2.speaker: Damays
AD_LeavingAnyCombat2.text: I can't remain here. It's too dangerous.

TieflingsSceneFallback.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsSceneFallback.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the prisoner's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*
TieflingsSceneFallback.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows Lae'zel staring at you, Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

TieflingsSceneFallback.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsSceneFallback.text: *Your skull briefly aches - and you are her. You feel her irritation and indignity.*

TieflingsSceneFallback.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsSceneFallback.text: *And you feel answers. She knows more about your condition.*

TieflingsSceneFallback.speaker: Lae'zel
TieflingsSceneFallback.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.InternalNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.

PickASide.speaker: Lae'zel
PickASide.text: Prove you're not a craven. Join me, or die.
PickASide.context: InternalNodeContext: The player took their leave in the dialog, or perhaps they failed all the persuasions, so the tieflings are acting on their own and wants to bring Lae'zel to camp

PickASide.speaker: Lae'zel
PickASide.text: You've but one chance. Join me, or die.
PickASide.context: InternalNodeContext: The player persuaded the tieflings that they should kill the creature

TieflingsScene.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene.text: Zorru was right. Yellow as a toad, and twice as ugly.
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Nymessa
TieflingsScene.text: The thing's dangerous. Leave it for the goblins to kill.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene.text: And if it escapes? How will you - Oh! A guest.
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tieflings notice you in the middle of their conversation.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsScene.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the prisoner's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows Lae'zel staring at you.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Lae'zel
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.InternalNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsScene.text: *Your skull aches before you can take a step - and you are the creature. You feel her irritation and indignity.*

TieflingsScene.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsScene.text: *And you feel answers. She knows more about your condition.*

TieflingsScene.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene.text: This creature is dangerous. Get out of here - leave it to me!

TieflingsScene.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene.text: They're right. No one's safe if that thing goes loose.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene.text: A blast? I could use more specifics.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene.text: You didn't hear it? Shook our camp good, so we came for a look.

LaezelDead.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead.text: Th-thank you. I couldn't have done it without you.

LaezelDead.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead.text: But I've got to go. I need to check out that blast.

session_synopses.AD_LaezelReactsToAttack: Lae'zel is in the cage. The player attacked her.
session_synopses.AD_ReturnAnyCombat2: Damays (and Nymessa) got dragged into a combat from another situation (ex.: the brains at the crash site, the bandits at the chapel). Damays plays this AD when the combat ends, while he returns to the cage.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingsLeaving: Two tieflings discussing goblins, who might be nearby.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses: Damays and Nymessa are dead. Lae'zel says this once, then will inspect the corpses.
session_synopses.AD_OpenCage1: A tiefling encourages you to shoot down a cage containing a strange creaturfe (Lae'zel).
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelDead: Two tieflings that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comment that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro: Two tieflings argue about what to do with Lae'zel. Nymessa thinks to leave her alone. Damays wants to take her back to camp.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelDeadSolo2: A tiefling that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comments that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_OtherDied1: Nymessa reacts to the death of Damayhs at Teifling scene
session_synopses.AD_LeavingAnyCombat2: |Tieflings joined a random combat and were dragged far from Lae'zel Recruitment. They will leave out of stage while saying this instead of going back to the scene.|
session_synopses.TieflingsSceneFallback: Edge-case: the normal dialog failed to start. Someone is silenced or wild shaped... Let's just do the midmeld and start combatYou come upon Lae'zel, an alien-looking githyanki trapped in a cage, with two tieflings deciding her fate. Damays thinks its best to take it back to camp to keep an eye on. Nymessa wants to just leave it alone. If Shadowheart is present, she'll warn the player to not trust Lae'zel (she doesn't trust gith due to previous experiences while on a secret mission against them, but doesn't elaborate).
session_synopses.PickASide: Occurs if the player tells the tieflings to lower Lae'zel and kill her, or if player lets the tieflings try to take her away. One last chance to choose a side.
session_synopses.TieflingsScene: You come upon Lae'zel, an alien-looking githyanki trapped in a cage, with two tieflings deciding her fate. Damays thinks its best to take it back to camp to keep an eye on. Nymessa wants to just leave it alone. If Shadowheart is present, she'll warn the player to not trust Lae'zel (she doesn't trust gith due to previous experiences while on a secret mission against them, but doesn't elaborate).
session_synopses.LaezelDead: You helped two tieflings kill a strange creature. (Lae'zel.) You talk to them, and they tell you about a blast they heard. (The ship crash.)

VB_LowerFloor_1.speaker: Player
VB_LowerFloor_1.text: This place wasn't built for the living.
VB_LowerFloor_1.context: NodeContext: Karlach: She's enjoying exploring here.

PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.speaker: Player
PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.text: They didn't want to surrender their valuables, even after death.

VB_SideChamber_1.speaker: Player
VB_SideChamber_1.text: Looks like someone wanted to bury their secrets.

AD_BanditGuardWarning.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardWarning.context: NodeContext: He's in an abandoned chapel, looting, and has just spotted the players. He calls to his friends for help and enters combat

AD_JergalInsideTomb.speaker: Richly Adorned Sarcophagus
AD_JergalInsideTomb.text: Dost thou think to rush fate? See to the dead first.

AD_BanditSanctumSearching.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.text: Rotten food, dusty altars... where's the bloody treasure?
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.context: NodeContext: Referring to his surroundings in an abandoned chapel. He's searching for a way to open the crypt, or some treasure. Muttering to himself

AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.context: NodeContext: spotted the player - shouting to alert her companions as she becomes hostile

PAD_GasPit.speaker: Player
PAD_GasPit.text: I can't see any way to disarm it.

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in an adjacent room just collapsed, startling them

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditCrashBanter.text: The roof caved in - this place is a deathtrap!
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound, this guy is trying to take control of the situation and calm his companions

VB_Skeleton_1.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_1.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.context: NodeContext: alarmed - he's a tomb-robber in an abandoned chapel, and the players just surprised him. He's calling his friends to help as combat begins

AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.text: How'd you get past Andorn? Back off!
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.context: NodeContext: She was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel and is surprised to see the players who have either killed or sneaked past her friend 'Andorn'. She's entering combat.

AD_BanditGuardSurprised.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardSurprised.context: NodeContext: he's part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - the player just entered, surprising him. He calls for help as he backs away, in combat

VB_Artefact_1.speaker: Player
VB_Artefact_1.text: A lot of effort to hide one sarcophagus.
VB_Artefact_1.context: NodeContext: Said with reverence and a touch of fear.

VB_Sanctum_1.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_1.text: No more prayers... only silence and dust.
VB_Sanctum_1.context: NodeContext: player reflects on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel. Possibly quietly reverential; it's a holy place

AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.speaker: Player
AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.text: No lock, no handle. How does it open?
AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.context: NodeContext: found a door without a lock or handle

PAD_FoundCoins.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundCoins.text: A strange coin. I wonder what it's worth.

AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.text: Not even sure this is a door.
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.context: NodeContext: Confused - trying to unlock a door in an abandoned chapel that doesn't actually have a lock. She's struggling and muttering to herself

VB_Skeleton_2.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_2.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

VB_Skeleton_2.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_2.text: I wonder what was so subversive about their words that they commanded protection.
VB_Skeleton_2.context: NodeContext: player reacts to companion commenting that skeletons in an abandoned chapel appear to have died without a fight. Slightly unnerved

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: This place is falling apart - could've happened by itself.

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Haseid
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: No such thing as coincidences when there's loot to be had.

Jergal.text: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player
Jergal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: So he has spoken, and so thou standest before me. Right as always.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: What a curious way to awaken.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Now I have a question for thee: what is the worth of a single mortal's life?

Jergal.speaker: Player
Jergal.text: A peaceful undead. Interesting. Why aren't you attacking me?

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Dull your weapons as you wish.

AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.text: It's... open? Could've sworn I hadn't cracked it.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.speaker: Player
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.text: Oh, hells. Something just woke up...
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.context: NodeContext: just picked up an artefact and heard something awakening in response down in a dungeon - afraid, but with resolve

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.text: I know when I've got a lock beaten and I didn't beat this one.

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.text: Maybe it just broke by itself. This place is ancient.
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.context: NodeContext: Further weak effort at explaining the unexplainable.

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.text: Maybe. But keep on your guard.
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.context: NodeContext: Cautious. Something doesn't add up.

AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.text: Hells! Something's coming out of the crypt!
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.context: NodeContext: Terrified - we just emerged from a seemingly abandoned crypt she was trying to break into

PAD_JergalStatueReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_JergalStatueReaction.text: That statue. It seems they worshipped some kind of... scholar?

AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.text: Barton? Oh gods, somebody killed Barton!
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.context: NodeContext: just found a dead friend - Barton - and is furious as she starts to hunt for the killer

VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.text: No more prayers... only dust and silence.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.text: Who were those prayers for? Normally the patron god is obvious - not here.

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: We have nothing more to discuss. Continue on thy way, as if I were not here.

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: I must attend this place, after so many years away. We will see each other again soon.

JergalWandering.speaker: Player
JergalWandering.text: You seem very certain of that. How?

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: The mechanics of fate would be difficult to explain to one such as thyself.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_2_WithShadowheart.speaker: Player
VB_TakingTheArtefact_2_WithShadowheart.text: Hells... something just woke up down here.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_2_WithShadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_TakingTheArtefact_2_WithShadowheart.text: Let them come. The darkness can be to our advantage.

session_synopses.VB_LowerFloor_1: This triggers has the player unlocks a door and enters a secret and, until now, hidden crypt.
session_synopses.PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing: Voicebark dialog after robbing the amulet from Jergal chapel, about whether it was right to loot the place. Its guardians might have been killed by the player. Or the guardians might have engaged the player, but they found a way to get out without killing them all, by fleeing or distracting them. Or the player might have sneakily escape the guardians.This is played on the party after they leave an area, so Speakers are roughly interchangeable here, the undertaking is assumed to be a party effort.
session_synopses.VB_SideChamber_1: VB upon noticing the book chained and padlocked to the table in the side room.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardWarning: A bandit who is part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - at this point, he's seen the players entering the chapel - 'the uninvited guests' - and thinks they're after the same loot as his crew. He's calling his friends to help.
session_synopses.AD_JergalInsideTomb: Jergal reacts to a player touching his sarcophagus when his servants (the skeletal clerics) have not yet been killed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumSearching: A bandit in an abandoned chapel who is searching around an altar for a way to open a passage into the crypt, which is in the corridor outside. He's frustrated, twitchy and nervous. This place is creepy.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked: A bandit in an abandoned chapel calls to her companions for help upon spotting the player
session_synopses.PAD_GasPit: Player characters comment when the player interacts with a trap that has been spotted but not yet triggered
session_synopses.AD_BanditCrashBanter: A group of bandits in an abandoned chapel - they're hoping to loot the place and are a little on edge. Abandoned chapels often have traps or undead guardians. they're startled by a loud noise from one of the side-chambers. The roof just caved in, and the bandit are trying to figure out a plan of action. What they don't know is that the roof collapse was caused by the players who just broke in.
session_synopses.VB_Skeleton_1: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardCallHelp: One of a group of bandits looting an abandoned chapel. He's just been surprised by the players who have infiltrated the same chapel. He's twitchy and on edge, and now he's in a fight and needs his friends.
session_synopses.PAD_ButtonBlocked: The player has pressed a button only to find it won't move - because it deactivates a trap they haven't triggered yet.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting: A bandit who was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel - at this point, she's seen the players intruding on her position and tries to alert her friends as she enters combat
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardSurprised: A bandit guarding the door to an abandoned chapel that his crew are looting. The player just surprised him and he calls for help as he enters combat
session_synopses.VB_Artefact_1: Players notice the tomb containing the Selune artefact.
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_1: players reflect on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel
session_synopses.AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation: player finds a door that has no lock or handle
session_synopses.PAD_FoundCoins: Player finds a soul coin inside Jergal's chapel.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking: A bandit in an abandoned chapel - she's trying and failing to open a door to the lower level of the chapel, searching for loot. Talking to herself as she struggles - confused by the fact the door doesn't have a lock.
session_synopses.VB_Skeleton_2: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert: Three bandits - Barton, Mari and Haseid - are on alert in a crypt they're attempting to rob. They heard a commotion (falling masonry) and are braced for threats.
session_synopses.Jergal: After the party has slain a group of undead scholars, the judge of death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor: Mari realises that the door she was trying to unlock is suddenly opened, but she has not unlocked it.
session_synopses.VB_TakingTheArtefact_1: The player just stole a relic from a crypt in an abandoned chapel, and all candles around it sputtered out. Sounds of movement come from another room...
session_synopses.AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter: Mari has found the door to lower level open but she did not unlock it. She talks to her comrade, Barton about it.They debate what must have happened.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised: Players emerge from a seemingly abandoned crypt, startling a bandit on the other side of the door. Afterward, the bandit attacks.
session_synopses.PAD_JergalStatueReaction: Player succeeds/fails passive check to recognise statue of Jergal.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit: A bandit in an abandoned chapel finds one of her companions dead
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart: Players have entered an abandoned chapel dedicated to an unknown god. Shadowheart is puzzled as to why she can't figure out who was the patron of this place.
session_synopses.JergalWandering: death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.
session_synopses.VB_TakingTheArtefact_2_WithShadowheart: The player just stole a relic from a crypt in an abandoned chapel, and all candles around it sputtered out. Sounds of movement come from another room... Shadowheart is with the party
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumAlert: Barton is alerted and tells the other bandits inside the room to get ready in their positions.

AD_OutsideStatue.speaker: Player
AD_OutsideStatue.text: Text is too faded. Doesn't tell me who was worshipped here.
AD_OutsideStatue.context: NodeContext: Players with religious classes comment on the plaque.

PAD_RichSarcophagus.speaker: Narrator
PAD_RichSarcophagus.text: *Here lies the Guardian of Tombs. Through knowledge comes atonement.*
PAD_RichSarcophagus.context: NodeContext: Reading the inscription on a sarcophagus.

AD_SqueletonRoom.speaker: Player
AD_SqueletonRoom.text: I've never seen this language before. Who was worshipped here?
AD_SqueletonRoom.context: NodeContext: Selûne pronounced seh-LOON-eh. Reading a plaque in a slightly mocking tone before adding some displeased commentary.

session_synopses.AD_OutsideStatue: The player tries to read a bronze plaque at the foot of an unidentified statue.
session_synopses.PAD_RichSarcophagus: Player reads the inscription on a plaque in an abandoned chapel dedicated to the god Jergal.
session_synopses.AD_SqueletonRoom: The player reads a bronze plaque at the feet of a mysterious statue

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: You'll die a bloody pauper unless you take a few risks.

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Taman
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: Why don't we just wait a while? Make sure it's safe.

VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.text: There! Not so impregnable after all.
VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.context: NodeContext: Satisfied. She's just successfully lockpicked a large, heavy set of doors.

AD_Boulder.speaker: Player
AD_Boulder.text: Wouldn't take much to send that stone crashing downwards...
AD_Boulder.context: NodeContext: Investigating a large piece of masonry suspended from a wooden crane.

BanditInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction.text: ...You're both twice as tall as me but have half the bloody backbone!
BanditInteraction.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom scene setupNodeContext: bandit leader speaking to his crew - annoyed with them. He's a gnome, braver than the taller characters

BanditInteraction.speaker: Taman
BanditInteraction.text: But we don't know what that thing even is! And what about the crypt?
BanditInteraction.context: NodeContext: Arguing for caution - they've never seen the likes of the ship that crashed before. It could be dangerous.

BanditInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction.text: I'm telling you - it's a ship.
BanditInteraction.context: NodeContext: the 'crypt' is inside the chapel they're standing outside. 'Thing' refers back to that. 'STOP!" is him interrupting himself because he's just seen the players approaching

BanditInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction.text: And the crypt can wait! Mari and Barton have been trying to break in for days. Now we - Stop!

BanditInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction.text: Got ourselves competition already! That's our ship!
BanditInteraction.context: NodeContext: 'competition' refers to the players. He's seen them coming

AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.speaker: Quelenna
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.text: Well, that's one less greedy bastard to share the loot with.
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: with a shrug - found a dead companion and sees the bright side

session_synopses.AD_BanditsDiscussion: Discussion between Gimbleboc and Taman before the scene against them triggers. They're arguing about whether to investigate the crash (this segues into the beginning of their intertactive dialogue when you get near enough)
session_synopses.VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe: Shadowheart lockpicked the crypt door that she usually try to bash.
session_synopses.AD_BanditReaction: A bandit exclaims in alarm/indignity upon spotting the player 'trespassing' near a tomb they intended to loot.
session_synopses.AD_Boulder: Players are investigating a loose boulder outside a chapel that can be shifted to smash through into the crypts below
session_synopses.VB_Fissure_1: The player notices a gap in the flooring of an ancient chapel. There's faint signs of something else below.
session_synopses.BanditInteraction: The bandits are encountered near an abandoned chapel and are in the middle of an argument among themselves about whether or not to investigate (and loot) the crashed nautoloid (a spaceship) when the player approaches them. The player can convince them to clear off via lies or threats, or else is forced to fight them. A gnome named Gimblebock is in charge of this group, with his underlings, Quelanna and/or Taman, chiming in at points with their concerns.
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction: A bandit reacts to finding one of her companions dead in an apparent accident. She looks on the bright side.

VB.speaker: Shadowheart
VB.text: Some sort of chapel or sepulchre... but dedicated to whom?

PAD_Return.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Return.text: Dead goblins over there. Worth checking for supplies maybe.

session_synopses.VB: Shadowheart reacts to discovering a mysterious, half-ruined chapel. It's not immediately clear what deity it was built for.
session_synopses.PAD_Return: Arriving at a juncture in a path, companion Shadowheart points out an opportunity to look for supplies.

session_synopses.VB_TrapReuse: You click on a broken trap on the ground and find it useless.

FrescoAlliance.speaker: Narrator
FrescoAlliance.text:
*'In darkest hour, a concord made,
'Twixt harp and wild against the shade.'*

FrescoAlliance.speaker: Narrator
FrescoAlliance.text: *'Harp and wild'? You recall stories of an alliance between druids and the Harpers, but the details are vague.*

VB_LockedLibrary.speaker: Player
VB_LockedLibrary.text: I can't even see a lock to pick.

session_synopses.FrescoAlliance: In a well-lit cave. Player looks at a fresco depicting two sides agreeing an alliance. Pass a test to realise that one side are the druids of the wild, and the other the Harpers - a secret organisation.
session_synopses.VB_LockedLibrary: Player tries to open a stone door, but it's just a blank slab. There's no place for a key.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: And we'll have a dog, right?
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: They don't allow 'em in Baldur's Gate. Cats, though...
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: A little orange cat! And a house with a little door so it can come and go as it pleases.
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: ... and a high fence to keep eavesdroppers out.
2.context:
NodeContext: Just now noticing the player. Following Bex's line: 'And a house with a little door so it can come and go as it pleases.' A little wary but not too bad
-- who is this perosn who's approached them?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Don't mind me. I was just passing through.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: No bother. We're just daydreaming, anyhow.
2.context: NodeContext: Friendly again-- player doesn't mean harm.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: What about you? Big plans for when you get to the city?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I'll be keeping to myself. People tend to stare at me.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: But... I've heard there's all sorts in the city. It might not be like it was in Elturel. I mean - in Baldur's Gate, they give you a chance.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: Good luck to you. Wish us a little too. I think we'll all need it.

session_synopses.2: This pair are a young couple dreaming about their future plans in Baldur's Gate. They're optimistic-- as long as they have each other, they'll make things work. Early/ mid-20s, youthful enthusiasm.

AD.speaker: Ormn
AD.text: *Grunt.*

session_synopses.AD: AD of very lazy bear in the water.

RobbedAdventurerAtCorpses.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurerAtCorpses.text: You better not linger for too long. Those goblins just aren't normal.

VB_AtCorpses.speaker: Player
VB_AtCorpses.text: I wonder where they were going.

session_synopses.RobbedAdventurerAtCorpses: The adventurer is standing next to the corpses of her comrades he left behind while running for the goblins.
session_synopses.VB_AtCorpses: Remarking on corpses on the road.
session_synopses.AD_DrunkenTalk: Aradin mutters to himself while drinking after returning to the Druid Grove.

AD_TieflingKid004.speaker: Zaki
AD_TieflingKid004.text: You're one of those toad-people Zorru saw!

PAD_AfterKid.speaker: Lae'zel
PAD_AfterKid.text: This Zorru has encountered githyanki. I must find and question him.

session_synopses.AD_TieflingKid004: Tiefling kid recognises Lae'zel as a githyanki via AD
session_synopses.PAD_AfterKid: Lae'zel avatar remarks on the kid who recognised her as a githyanki

session_synopses.AD_2: This is Bex's AD if Danis is dead or occupied. She should be slightly uneasy as a result.

DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolStolen.text: The idol is gone. Round up the intruders - we've been patient enough.

session_synopses.DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolStolen: AD when the druids realise their sacred idol has been stolen. This is the straw that breaks the camel's back, and they start attacking the tieflings and the players.

PAD_TunnelTurret.speaker: Player
PAD_TunnelTurret.text: Glowing eyes are rarely a good sign. Best be careful.

session_synopses.PAD_TunnelTurret: Played when discovering one of the druid turret totems.

Captain_AD_TakingTurn_Combat.speaker: Za'krug
Captain_AD_TakingTurn_Combat.text: I'll bleed every last one of you!

AD_GreetingPlayer.speaker: Asharak
AD_GreetingPlayer.context: NodeContext: Introducing the player to his students.

session_synopses.AD_GreetingPlayer: Trainer introducing the player to the class. The player has just walked up.

002.speaker: Marcoryl
002.text: You may have won over Kagha, but I'm not so easily swayed.

AD_ChaseAwayBoar.speaker: Apikusis
AD_ChaseAwayBoar.context: NodeContext: She's trying to be kind, but she's annoyed

session_synopses.002: A very condescending and somewhat objectionable druid servant. He believes the tiefling refugees hiding in the grove have brought chaos and would gladly be rid of them, even if turning them away would doom them.
session_synopses.AD_ChaseAwayBoar: |This AD plays when Tusk, a boar, interrupts a druid while she's participating in a long, intense ritual. Tusk is getting in the way.|

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: Hells, we can't just leave. They're kin.
Group.context: NodeContext: This is the start of the dialog but clearly an ongoing argument. You think it's your responsibility, as a tiefling, to stay and help your kin. You're angry, voice is level but will soon grow louder, and utterly convinced that staying at the camp is the right thing to do.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: I'll not gamble our lives, our futures, on people who are as good as dead. We must leave for Baldur's Gate - at once.
Group.context: NodeContext: You're angry but your voice is level. You think staying at the camp is essentially suicide. You cannot believe it was even suggested. You and your friends have brand new lives waiting for you in Baldur's Gate - to stay at the camp is reckless and pointless to you.

Group.speaker: Cal
Group.text: Can we all just take a moment? Please?
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking for one to the other. Stuck in between them, pleading. Hands out as he tries to calm the situation. NodeContext: Your friend and sister are screaming at each other in front of you. Light and easygoing tone as you try to calm the argument.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: What's the point in blades and spells if we don't bloody use them? We should stay.
Group.context: NodeContext: Your voice is getting louder. You're very angry now. It's your civic duty to use the skills you have to help people. You cannot believe how selfish Rolan is being.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: These people aren't fighters. We can help.

Group.speaker: Cal
Group.text: Or yell louder. That's fine too.
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sighing as he shrugs. He knows neither is listening to him. NodeContext: Your friend and sister have ignored your plea. You know once they've started they'll just keep arguing until one of them gives in. This is almost said with a shrug and in a light, jokey tone.

Group.speaker: Player
Group.text: You should all stay. A single blade could make a difference.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: No. This place is a death trap. Let us leave - immediately!
Group.context: NodeContext: Player has disagreed with you. You're frustrated and angry. You think it's ludicrous that anyone would disagree with you.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: Or would you deny your brother here his chance at fortune in Baldur's Gate?
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at Lia but gesturing to Cal. NodeContext: You know the argument is likely going your way and you're being a little bit of a dick here. You know mentioning Lia's brother is a guarantee that she'll give in to your side and leave with you. It's a bit of an underhanded move.

Group.speaker: Player
Group.text: You want fortune? There's coin in it if you stay.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: You know, that money could go towards a spiffy new outfit for your apprenticeship...?
Group.context: NodeContext: Smile, knowing rolan will give in

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Generic 'taking' animation. Taking coin from the player.NodeContext: 'ZUR-gan.' Frustrated but giving in to the promise of going.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: If we survive, it'll make for a good story I suppose...
Group.context: NodeContext: Kinda sulky but accepting that you'll stay in the grove.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: Thank you, Rolan. And thank you, friend.
Group.context: NodeContext: Warm and sincere. Directed at rolan and then player.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.text: We should add the Elfsong Tavern to the list.
AD.context: NodeContext: Talking about things to do in Baldur's Gate - excited.

AD.speaker: Lia
AD.text: So long as you're paying.
AD.context: NodeContext: A wry smile, you're happy to see your Rolan so excited.

AD.speaker: Cal
AD.text: Drinks on Rolan? Count me in.
AD.context: NodeContext: Your sister has conned Rolan into paying - you're teasing him.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.text: I swear, I've never met such a pair of cheapskates.
AD.context: NodeContext: A wry smile even as you pretend to be grumpy - Lia and Rolan are teasing you and you're pretending to hate it.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: Those goblins will rue the day they chose to tangle with this grove.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: You and I will do some good here - I can feel it.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: Lia and Rolan would never admit it, but they'd take an arrow for the other. Also stab each other. Not sure what'll come first.
Brother.context: NodeContext: You have broken up a fight between Lia and Rolan more times than you can count. You're tone is light and friendly as you joke with the player.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: Thanks for cutting in - there might have been more than words if you hadn't.
Brother.context: NodeContext: A big friendly smile - you are the most genuine of the group

session_synopses.Group:
Three people are having an argument. Rolan, Lia and Cal. Lia and Cal are brother and sister, but the three of them have grown up together. They're young, talented tieflings who are heading to Baldur's Gate to start their lives and careers. Rolan argues that they should leave now and get to the city while they still can. Lia argues that it is irresponsible to leave their kin behind. Cal is stuck in the middle.
This is a passionate and fiery argument, both sides are convinced that they are correct.
session_synopses.AD: This occurs betwen Lia, Cal and Ronan. There are mixed ADs which occur - when they're arguing about when to stay and go, when they've decided to stay and when they've decided to go.
session_synopses.Sister: This occurs after the argument betwen Lia and Rolan. Lia is still stewing after the fight. Opportunity to get to know her better and understand the group dynamics.
session_synopses.Brother: This dialog occurs after the argument between Lia and Rolan that Cal attempted to mediate. It's light and friendly, and mainly a chance for the player to get to know Cal.

AD_Grumpy.speaker: Zurga
AD_Grumpy.text: Where do druids keep their liquor?
AD_Grumpy.context: NodeContext: irritated - just raided a grove and there's not a lot of good loot

AD_ChefAndSon.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSon.text: We'll make it last. We always do.

AD_ChefAndSon.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSon.text: I can't thin the broth much more than this.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.text: Looking well, folks - keep it up.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.text: I'm not 'sir'. I was a doorjack in Elturel.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.speaker: Pandirna
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.context: NodeContext: Repeating what her companion was saying mockingly.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.speaker: Guex
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.text: Shut it, you - and help me with these barrels.

AD_LoversWithoutGuard.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.text: We did it. Come on, give me a kiss.

AD_LoversWithoutGuard.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.text: Hold still! I'll kiss you when you've stopped bleeding, you lummox.
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.context: NodeContext: Concentrating on seeing to his wounds. Gentle admonishment

AD_LoversWithoutGuard.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.text: Yes, you are. Now stop squirming!
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.context: NodeContext: 'I love you and share in your happiness but you're being pain in the arse right now'

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel.text: Would you be careful? We're going to spill if you don't stop shaking.
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: Irritated, trying to pour oil into a container

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Pandirna
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: Annoyed, she's afraid and he's pointed it out so she's defensive. She cuts herself off before finishing the outburst.

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: lecturing, not picking up on Pandirna's mood

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Pandirna
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: Bitten off, quietly insistent. She's close to snapping.

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: Backing off, as if she's being unreasonable but he's being the bigger person.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio.text: Look at this place. Like a pen of hogs waiting for the butcher's knife. We need to act!

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio.text: Quiet! Some of the children might hear you.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio.text: Oh, perish the thought they overhear a little honesty once in their short lives -

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio.text: Another word and it won't be the goblins you have to worry about!

AD_LookingForDoni.speaker: Rikka
AD_LookingForDoni.text: Doni! I don't want to lock you outside, please.
AD_LookingForDoni.context: NodeContext: More quietly than her other shouts, as much to herself.

AD_WarchiefBraveVictory.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefBraveVictory.text: Good work - the True Souls are proper pleased.
AD_WarchiefBraveVictory.context: NodeContext: calling out to other goblins after a victory

Tiefling004.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004.text: Admiring my beautiful barricades? Might not be pretty, but they'll stop a charging worg.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.text: You can leave your valuables with me if you like.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.text: Goblins strip the dead down to the last stitch, so I hear.
RobberKid.context: NodeContext: Knowingly, trying to freak player out

RobberKid.speaker: Player
RobberKid.text: Best pray they don't kill me, then - they'll get you next.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.text: So you say - survived Avernus, though. More than you've done.
RobberKid.context: NodeContext: Dismissive. Some insane goblins don't scare him.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.text: Can you two help? Anything you don't pack is getting left behind.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.speaker: Meli
AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.text: We can always get more stuff later.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.text: You won't get there if we starve on the way. Gonna rob your friends when you're hungry?

ParentB.speaker: Komira
ParentB.text: I pray next time I square up to a goblin, you're there again.

RaiderMurderous.speaker: Warrior Rua
RaiderMurderous.text: Goblin kids would 'ave put up a better fight.
RaiderMurderous.context: NodeContext: malicious - describing a child who tried to fight back during an attack

RaiderMurderous.speaker: Warrior Rua
RaiderMurderous.text: Killed my first human when I was five years old. Tieflings are soft.
RaiderMurderous.context: NodeContext: malicious glee - talking about killing a tiefling child

Refugee002.speaker: Danis
Refugee002.text: I wish I could help on the walls, but... I wasn't a soldier, really. Just a trumped-up guard.

Refugee002.speaker: Danis
Refugee002.context: NodeContext: He gives up on trying to come up with an excuse - frightened and apologetic.

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: ... and over the horizon they saw a ship, like some great beast bursting from the waves.

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: The Wandering Eye, the jewel of Balduran's fleet! So named because -
AD_KidStory.context: NodeContext: Moment of a story where hero returns

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: - well... because Balduran travelled far and... saw much.
AD_KidStory.context: NodeContext: Catching herself, realizing children might not understand concept of Wandering Eyes

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: But he had finally come home to save the city he loved!

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: He drove the raiders away and raised a wall to protect his people.
AD_KidStory.context: NodeContext: Happy ending, reassuring them that evil was defeated

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: And so they named the city to honour him. Balduran's - Baldur's Gate.

BackupLeader.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader.text: Ah - there you are. No, we haven't met - but I know your work.
BackupLeader.context: NodeContext: Wry, distant - she wants to speak with you but also resents you a little (Though she knows it's unfair)

BackupLeader.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader.text: Came back to report some lunatic had cleared out the goblin leaders - only to find Zevlor'd gone the same way.
BackupLeader.context: NodeContext: Amused at the irony, but really just covering sadness with grim pragmatism

BackupLeader.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader.text: He was supposed to play chaperone with this lot, not me. But - moaning won't make the road ahead shorter, I suppose.
BackupLeader.context: NodeContext: Wry, vaguely bitter - as if Zevlor shirked left her with a task she'd rather not have to do.

BackupLeader.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader.text: Here. It's faint thanks compared to what you've done for us, but it's all we have.
BackupLeader.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.NodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.

AD_HideoutLeaderSighing.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderSighing.text: Some dumb fairy tale is all we have left...

Sapper_004.speaker: Sapper Gald
Sapper_004.context: NodeContext: smug - just massacred some tieflings

RitualDruid005.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid005.text: I'm not singing your praises. You and the tieflings brought violence to this place.
RitualDruid005.context: NodeContext: Coolly. She blames both players and the tieflings in the grove for causing trouble.

RitualDruid005.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid005.text: It wasn't our fight. You dragged us into it.
RitualDruid005.context: NodeContext: She's accusing the player, pointing at them. She blames both players and the tieflings in the grove for causing trouble.

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend.text: 'Lathander to light, Selûne to guide, Kelemvor to show mercy -'

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Narrator
GrieflingFriend.text: *You realise he prays to Kelemvor, Lord of Death.*

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend.text: What is it? I'm... I'm busy.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: You took it upon yourself to undertake the Rite of Thorns? To spill blood in this sacred place?
HalsinAndDruidLeader.context: NodeContext: Reading the riot act to Kagha

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: It would have been easier if you just died, Kagha. Now I have to hear your excuses instead.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: I owe you nothing. Goblins swarmed us like roaches while you stumbled after the past.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: You chose to abandon us. I chose to protect us!

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: Silence. The rite has been ended.
HalsinAndDruidLeader.context: NodeContext: Forceful. He's heard enough from her.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: I will allow you to stay. But consider yourself a novice anew. You have forgotten the ways of the druids - our place in the natural order.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: You shall learn it all once again, right here. Backslide, and nature's fury will crush you.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader.context: CinematicNodeContext: She gives a reluctant bow and retreats from HalsinNodeContext: Not happy. Said through clenched teeth. She gives a reluctant bow and retreats from Halsin

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: No need to be so harsh. Kagha acted out of concern.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: Misplaced, self-important concern. She must learn to respect the balance of all things. But the grove still needs her.
HalsinAndDruidLeader.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: You will soon see why. But enough of that for now - I owe you my thanks.
HalsinAndDruidLeader.context: NodeContext: There's a little foreboding hidden in these phrases. A lot hinges on what he'll tell us tomorrow.

Pickpocket.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket.text: Mattis says we should say thank you.
Pickpocket.context: NodeContext: Shy, not understanding that they almost died

AD_WarehouseLooters.speaker: Brawler Gurd
AD_WarehouseLooters.text: Yeah. It's all... green. Why do druids store tree muck inside?

AD_WarehouseLooters.speaker: Warrior Clack
AD_WarehouseLooters.text: Dunno. But some of it's gotta be valuable, right?
AD_WarehouseLooters.context: NodeContext: Eager, hoping to make a profit

AD_WarehouseLooters.speaker: Warrior Clack
AD_WarehouseLooters.text: Maybe. Can't tell if it's for eating or smoking though.
AD_WarehouseLooters.context: NodeContext: A bit put out. Not sure if this raid is worth his time.

AD_WarehouseLooters.speaker: Brawler Gurd
AD_WarehouseLooters.text: *Ah-choo!* Ugh... smells funny whatever it's for. Grab as much as you can.

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.speaker: Zurga
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.text: We should have raided another tavern.

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.text: We should have raided a town.
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.context: NodeContext: escalating from 'tavern' to town, half-joking

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.speaker: Zurga
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.context: NodeContext: escalating from town to 'city' as potential target for next raid - mostly joking

AD_WarchiefAndLooters.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.text: What's taking you two so long? Get the goods and get moving!
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.context: NodeContext: Preemptively annoyed with his subordinates - they're not very smart.

AD_WarchiefAndLooters.speaker: Warrior Clack
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.text: Gurd keeps sneezing and dropping stuff.
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.context: NodeContext: Respectfully talking to his boss - and getting his friend in trouble

AD_WarchiefAndLooters.speaker: Brawler Gurd
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.text: Shut your mouth! I... *Ah-choo!* Feckin' leaves.
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.context: NodeContext: Gurd is allergic to the herbs in the storehouse he looted and keeps sneezing

AD_WarchiefAndLooters.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.text: You serious? Stuff something in yer nose and hurry up.

Refugee003.speaker: Bex
Refugee003.text: Someone decided we were the best suited to see to any wounded.
Refugee003.context: NodeContext: Bemused, out of her depth.

Refugee003.speaker: Bex
Refugee003.text: Better all 'round if you keep everyone in one piece up there. Trust me.
Refugee003.context: NodeContext: Making a joke of it, but an edge of really urging to you protect everyone

LairDoor.speaker: Doni
LairDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera pans down to show Doni, Player and the DoorNodeContext: Worried grunt as he greets the player - trying to communicate a hopeless situation

LairDoor.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor.text: Go away! There's nothing in here for you - for any of you.
LairDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSInternalNodeContext: This voice is supposed to be the same as Marcoryl, one of the druid servants.NodeContext: Urgent, a little frightened even. This voice is supposed to be the same as Marcoryl, one of the druid servants.

LairDoor.speaker: Doni
LairDoor.context: NodeContext: resigned grunt - has been asking for help from the druids and feels abandoned

AD_CoweringRefugee004.speaker: Toron
AD_CoweringRefugee004.context: NodeContext: Terrified, begging for his life as goblins close in.

Tiefling005.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005.text: The goblins... do they fight well?

Tiefling005.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005.text: You... mean that to be comforting, I'm sure.

RaidersArriveAfterFight.speaker: Narrator
RaidersArriveAfterFight.text: *A splinter of ice works its way into your mind, drowning out the goblins' battle cries.*
RaidersArriveAfterFight.context: CinematicNodeContext: The sound of goblins can be heard from the forest. The drow-led raiding party emerges from the forest and arrive outside the gatesNodeContext: describing an uncomfortable feeling as a drow prepares to speak with us telepathically

RaidersArriveAfterFight.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RaidersArriveAfterFight.context: NodeContext: speaking telepathically (we do not see her, only hear her); a command

RaidersArriveAfterFight.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RaidersArriveAfterFight.text: The way is clear. Now we can cleanse this place completely. Kill everyone.
RaidersArriveAfterFight.context: NodeContext: speaking telepathically (we do not see her, only hear her); a command

RaiderArrogant.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
RaiderArrogant.text: They'll be worg meat soon enough!

Pet004.speaker: Tusk
Pet004.text: Don't you smell it? The monsters are gone, and the air is fresh with new beginnings.
Pet004.context: NodeContext: Pleased and full of hope for the future.

DruidGuard003.speaker: Mino
DruidGuard003.text: Some normalcy can return to the Grove. At last.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: Yes...? I'm pretty certain if I stop for too long they will actually eat me.
Bard.context: NodeContext: A whispered aside - she's worried about losing the childrens' already fading attention

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: What are you doing hiding down here?

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: Hardly going to be much use in a battle, am I?
Bard.context: NodeContext: Admitting, knows her own strengths

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: But making enough noise to keep this little mob distracted? That I can help with.

BirdSender.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender.text: We're free of the goblins, but the grove is changed. Wounded.

BirdSender.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender.text: The days ahead won't be easy, but we'll manage. We have to.

AD_BickeringTrainees.speaker: Ide
AD_BickeringTrainees.text: You can't even count to a hundred.

AD_BickeringTrainees.speaker: Gan
AD_BickeringTrainees.text: I don't have to count. I just have to hit 'em.

AD_GrieflingFriendAtGrave.speaker: Memnos
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGrave.text: Rest well, Arka. I'm sure Kanon's waiting for you.

Refugee004.speaker: Toron
Refugee004.text: Thought you'd left us to our fate, running off like you did. Glad I was wrong.

ZenBear.speaker: Ormn
ZenBear.text: He's back! You brought Halsin back!

AD_Refugees.speaker: Ikaron
AD_Refugees.text: Look on the bright side, mother - should be fewer mouths to feed after today.
AD_Refugees.context: NodeContext: Surly, afraid - trying to hurt his mother's feelings.

AD_Refugees.speaker: Okta
AD_Refugees.context: NodeContext: Weary, upset - her son has been in a mood all day

AD_Refugees.speaker: Bex
AD_Refugees.text: Danis can hunt! Sharp as an elf with that bow, aren't you love?
AD_Refugees.context: NodeContext: Cutting in, trying to be helpful and pre-empt an argument

AD_Refugees.speaker: Ikaron
AD_Refugees.text: Then why aren't you on the wall?

AD_Refugees.speaker: Danis
AD_Refugees.text: Rabbits don't shoot back, do they?
AD_Refugees.context: NodeContext: Caught off-guard, trying to keep it light

Stargazer.speaker: Nadira
Stargazer.text: First druids, now goblins. Lady Doom really has it out for us, doesn't she?

Trainee002.speaker: Ide
Trainee002.text: I can't wait to go. This place is boring.

Sapper_002.speaker: 769c8964-7b9f-4040-a742-9ebcecc07ce1
Sapper_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: he's carrying an explosive barrelNodeContext: with a cruel smile

Sapper_002.speaker: 769c8964-7b9f-4040-a742-9ebcecc07ce1
Sapper_002.text: ... when I hit 'em with this stuff, it'll barely leave a stain.
Sapper_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: he's carrying an explosive barrelNodeContext: referring to the explosives he's carrying

Adventurer2.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2.text: You. Liam said you sprung him from the goblin camp.
Adventurer2.context: NodeContext: She's waiting for Zevlor to open the gates since goblisn are coming.

Adventurer2.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2.text: And now you're back to stand with this lot. A right soft heart you've got, don't you?

Adventurer2.speaker: Player
Adventurer2.text: I could say the same for you.

Adventurer2.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2.text: Soft head, more like. If I were smart, I'd be back in Baldur's Gate with my feet up.

Adventurer2.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2.text: But this crowd patched Liam up when they had plenty reason not to. Might be I misjudged 'em.

Adventurer2.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2.text: Still a lost cause, mind - but if you can't live smart, you may as well die right.

RitualDruid003.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid003.text: I'm tempted to leave with the rest of you... but I can't abandon my home.
RitualDruid003.context: NodeContext: Players are going on a quest that takes them from the grove. Inwe is tempted to leave the drama in the grove behind.

AD_CheckingBarricade.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_CheckingBarricade.text: You think it'll make any difference?
AD_CheckingBarricade.context: NodeContext: Quietly, allowing worry to seep through. Looking for reassurance.

AD_CheckingBarricade.speaker: Kaldani
AD_CheckingBarricade.context: NodeContext: Quietly in response - doesn't know what her friend is referring to.

AD_CheckingBarricade.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_CheckingBarricade.context: NodeContext: Gesturing at the work they're carrying out on a barricade.

AD_CheckingBarricade.speaker: Kaldani
AD_CheckingBarricade.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, acknowledging that she doesn't have the confidence she pretends to.

AD_StupidAndDummy.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
AD_StupidAndDummy.context: NodeContext: shouting at a wooden training dummy that he's attacking

AD_StupidAndDummy.speaker: Tracker Azak
AD_StupidAndDummy.text: It ain't got eyes, you muck-skull. It ain't even alive!
AD_StupidAndDummy.context: NodeContext: exasperated - talking to a friend who is attacking a wooden training dummy

AD_StupidAndDummy.speaker: Tracker Azak
AD_StupidAndDummy.text: Stop messin' about and get back to work!

AD_PackingTraders.speaker: Meli
AD_PackingTraders.text: Hands off, Mattis! I earned this!

AD_PackingTraders.speaker: Meli
AD_PackingTraders.text: Well, I'm stealin' on my own when we get to Baldur's Gate.

AD_PackingTraders.speaker: Mattis
AD_PackingTraders.text: Fine by me. I bet there's plenty of adults with loose pockets there.

Servant005.speaker: Arron
Servant005.text: By the trees! I don't know what I dreaded more - the goblins, or being stuck here with Kagha for the rest of my days.
Servant005.context: NodeContext: 'By the trees' is an exclamation mark, not him saying literally 'by the trees over there.'

Servant005.speaker: Arron
Servant005.text: But you've solved both those problems in one go.

Servant005.speaker: Player
Servant005.text: Any excuse to gut some goblins.

HarpyKid.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid.text: The Harpy Killer! Are you here to save us? Like Baldy Ron saved the city?

HarpyKid.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid.text: Are you here to save us? Like Baldy Ron saved the city?

HarpyKid.speaker: Player
HarpyKid.text: You're not worth the trouble, kid. You're on your own.

HarpyKid.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid.text: But... didn't you kill those goblins at the gate? You can win. I know you can!

SnakeKid.speaker: Arabella
SnakeKid.text: Even if goblins get in, they can't find us here. Mum said.
SnakeKid.context: NodeContext: Player is interrupting a story, child is impatient.

Pet003.speaker: Topaz
Pet003.text: Ahh, my nest is still whole! Those monsters didn't touch it.
Pet003.context: NodeContext: Relieved - there was a big fight, and he thought the nest he worked so hard on got destroyed.

MindMeldAfterCombat.speaker: Narrator
MindMeldAfterCombat.text: *A splinter of ice works its way into your mind.*
MindMeldAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: describing the sensation of a drow telepathically communicating with us

MindMeldAfterCombat.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
MindMeldAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: speaking telepathically (we do not see her, only hear her); a command

MindMeldAfterCombat.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
MindMeldAfterCombat.text: The way is clear. Now we can cleanse this place completely. Kill everyone.
MindMeldAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: speaking telepathically (we do not see her, only hear her); a command

PrisonGuard.speaker: Tilses
PrisonGuard.text: Glad you're here with us. A bunch of ratty goblins aren't gonna send us running. We've been surviving long enough. Time to start living.

Prodigy.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy.text: I nearly dispatched those goblins myself, but it seems you managed well enough.
Prodigy.context: NodeContext: Idle arrogance, as if he could have taken out an entire camp of enemies if it weren't beneath him

Prodigy.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy.text: And why wield a masterwork where a butcher's blade will do? My thanks, truly.
Prodigy.context: NodeContext: Airy condescension - you saved him a menial task, but it was perfecly suited to you.

Mule2.speaker: Hungry Ox
Mule2.text: If you are afraid, hide beneath my legs - like a good calf. I will stop them.
Mule2.context: NodeContext: Determined - ready for a fight.

AD_CoweringRefugee003.speaker: Bex
AD_CoweringRefugee003.context: NodeContext: Shouting to her lover to run as goblins close in around them.

AD_CoweringRefugee002.speaker: Danis
AD_CoweringRefugee002.text: Oh gods, oh gods, oh gods -
AD_CoweringRefugee002.context: NodeContext: Repeated over and over in panic - equivalent of 'ohshitohshitohshit'

Tiefling003.speaker: Okta
Tiefling003.text: Back to worrying about road rations it is. So many mouths to feed, but...

Tiefling003.speaker: Okta
Tiefling003.text: ... well, that's not a bad problem to have. Thank you, truly.

Kid004.speaker: Zaki
Kid004.text: It smells bad out here. I want to go home.

ScoutCaptive.speaker: Findal
ScoutCaptive.text: You're starting to feel like my personal bodyguard. I wish you were.
ScoutCaptive.context: NodeContext: with a smile of genuine gratitude

SonOfChef.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef.text: Stay safe out there, you hear?

AD_BetrayedGrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
AD_BetrayedGrieflingFriend.text: You backstabbing birna mrag! We trusted you!
AD_BetrayedGrieflingFriend.context: NodeContext: Angry and accusatory, pre-combat. Birna mrag meaning 'piece of shit' in the infernal language. Pronounced 'BIRna mRAG'

WarchiefGrumpy.speaker: Zurga
WarchiefGrumpy.text: Oi. Have you lot really got black, boilin' blood? Freaks.
WarchiefGrumpy.context: NodeContext: excited, practically rubbing his hands. on tiefling variant, ending with 'freaks', dismissive and insulting to player

AD_GrieflingOnGate.speaker: Arka
AD_GrieflingOnGate.text: All this bloody waiting. I'll go find those goblins myself if they don't appear soon.
AD_GrieflingOnGate.context: NodeContext: Keyed up, ready to fight

Pet002.speaker: Silver
Pet002.text: I must protect him. I must.

AD_HalsinJoinsFight.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinJoinsFight.text: You will not desecrate this grove! Not while I draw breath!
AD_HalsinJoinsFight.context: NodeContext: Outraged. Joining combat to defend his home.

Servant004.speaker: Elwyn
Servant004.text: I didn't think we'd survive the goblins. I kept imagining the screams, the blood...
Servant004.context: NodeContext: She let fear get the better of her, and she's ashamed.

AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions.text: What's this? Mattis, this is junk! Waste of effort hauling it with us.

AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions.speaker: Mattis
AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions.text: No, there's collectors in the city! They'll pay good coin for it, I swear!

AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions.text: Fine, but you're carrying it yourself.

TorturedAdventurer.speaker: Narrator
TorturedAdventurer.text: *Despite the chaos in the camp, the adventurer sleeps soundly, wounds expertly bandaged.*

RitualDruid002.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid002.text: After everything that's happened, you still fought beside us.
RitualDruid002.context: NodeContext: Players were antagonised initially by the druids, yet still fought alongside them against a horde of attacking goblins.

RitualDruid002.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid002.text: I don't know if we deserved your help, but I'm glad we got it.
RitualDruid002.context: NodeContext: Players were antagonised initially by the druids, yet still fought alongside them against a horde of attacking goblins.

AD_Prodigies.speaker: Rolan
AD_Prodigies.text: My powers are being wasted back here! I could repel any attack in the blink of an eye.

AD_Prodigies.speaker: Lia
AD_Prodigies.text: Or wipe us out in the blink of an eye. Best you stay right here.

AD_Prodigies.speaker: Rolan
AD_Prodigies.text: Ridiculous. Someone of my skill should choose their own vantage point.

AD_Prodigies.speaker: Cal
AD_Prodigies.text: She just means you're our last hope, Rolan. We, eh, may need you to save the day.

Sapper_003.speaker: Sapper Dextor
Sapper_003.text: Don't be nickin' the best loot for yerself.
Sapper_003.context: NodeContext: they just massacred their enemies - he's being cheeky rather than hostile

AD_TrainerAtBarricade.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtBarricade.text: I suppose it's a pity to tear down trees for this.
AD_TrainerAtBarricade.context: NodeContext: Surveying a barricade she's made to protect against goblins.

AD_TrainerAtBarricade.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TrainerAtBarricade.text: Seems a good use of them, to me.

AD_TrainerAtBarricade.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtBarricade.text: Don't think Halsin'd fancy us pulling up his grove.
AD_TrainerAtBarricade.context: NodeContext: Vague guilt, concern - Halsin sheltered them and they're destroying his home to survive

AD_TrainerAtBarricade.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TrainerAtBarricade.text: Ah. Hadn't actually thought of that.
AD_TrainerAtBarricade.context: NodeContext: Caught by surprise, realising the implications.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: Watching gods, but you're a prettier sight than any I expected to see today.
Trainer.context: NodeContext: He's relieved to see you, but warning of the impending attack - player might just have jumped out of the frying pan and into the fire.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: I'd given you up for dead at the goblin camp - and our hopes along with you.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: What happened?! We've spotted goblins massing in the woods.

Trainer.speaker: Player
Trainer.text: Their drow commander found the grove - and she means to take it.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: ...A drow. Right - I'd say I'm surprised, but Beshaba's had her mark on us since Elturel.
Trainer.context: NodeContext: You've just told him he's facing insurmountable odds, and he's reacting with fear but resigned pragmatism. His outlook tends to be of the 'Murphy's Law' variety

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: You don't owe us any apologies - but I'll take your help, if you're offering.

Trainer.speaker: Player
Trainer.text: No, you don't get it. I'm with them.

Trainer.speaker: Wyll
Trainer.text: No - you can't! I trusted you!
Trainer.context: NodeContext: Upset, the player has given up the entire tiefling grove for slaughter.

Trainee003.speaker: Gan
Trainee003.text: Just shout if you need help up there.
Trainee003.context: NodeContext: Confident, takes self very seriously

RaiderBossy.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
RaiderBossy.text: I see a lot o' red blades around; the Absolute'll be chuffed.

DruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader.text: This is only the beginning. An army soon crosses the coast.
DruidLeader.context: NodeContext: Kagha still evil or evil-ish.

DruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader.text: Halsin's cancelled the rite. The brood is exposed. And we've you to thank, Silvanus have pity.
DruidLeader.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic "and we've YOU to thank"

PAD_DeadKids.speaker: Player
PAD_DeadKids.text: Butchered. They didn't stand a chance.
PAD_DeadKids.context: NodeContext: Shadowheart - her actions led to these childrens' deaths and her background as a dark priestess would suggest she'd feel triumphant, but her reaction is instead deflated and betays conflicted emotions (while not being entirely despairing). She got what she thought she wanted, but it feels hollow. / Astarion - bitterly. He's a little surprised that he's unhappy about it.

AD_LootingGoblins.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
AD_LootingGoblins.text: Nah. Raggedy bastards ain't got anythin' worth stealin'. 'Cept their horns.
AD_LootingGoblins.context: NodeContext: annoyed at lack of good loot - the 'horns' are the horns of tiefling characters these goblins just murdered

AD_LootingGoblins.speaker: Skrut
AD_LootingGoblins.text: I'll swap you six kiddy horns for that big one you carved off the old fella.
AD_LootingGoblins.context: NodeContext: malicious; talking about the horns of dead tieflings

AD_LootingGoblins.speaker: Skrut
AD_LootingGoblins.text: Nah. Gonna use that for a flagon.
AD_LootingGoblins.context: NodeContext: brushing off his friend's barter - the thing he's talking about is a tiefling horn

EntranceMeeting.speaker: Asharak
EntranceMeeting.context: NodeContext: Shouting drill sergeant style to archers along the wall.

EntranceMeeting.speaker: Asharak
EntranceMeeting.text: Are you bloody mad? We nearly -
EntranceMeeting.context: NodeContext: Shouting down to player, relieved at the near miss but irritated all the same

EntranceMeeting.speaker: Asharak
EntranceMeeting.text: Never mind. Get up here. I want that gate closed when the goblins arrive.

Griefling.speaker: Arka
Griefling.text: I'm ready for this - I'd rather die fighting than with an arrow in my back.
Griefling.context: NodeContext: Deep breath at beginning of line - pysching herself up

RaiderViolent.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
RaiderViolent.text: Geroff. These're my music boxes - find yer own.

RitualDruid001.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid001.text: None of this feels real. Not yet.
RitualDruid001.context: NodeContext: So much has happened in such a short time - infighting among the druids, her first druid disappearing, goblins attacking the grove - it's all a bit surreal.

RaiderHardy.speaker: Brawler Gurd
RaiderHardy.context: NodeContext: charging into combat or actively participating in combat. A warcry.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: She has a very big yawn between finally and quiet. She's still half asleep.NodeContext: She has a very big yawn between finally and quiet. She's still half asleep.

AD_WarchiefAndPotions.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefAndPotions.text: Oi! That stuff ain't for you!
AD_WarchiefAndPotions.context: NodeContext: sees minions drinking potions, annoyed with them

AD_WarchiefAndPotions.speaker: Booyahg Benta
AD_WarchiefAndPotions.text: We only drank one! And it churned up our guts somethin' rotten.
AD_WarchiefAndPotions.context: NodeContext: wincing in pain, trying to make excuses

EntranceMeetingWyll.speaker: Narrator
EntranceMeetingWyll.context: CinematicNodeContext: | *The men turned towards player, hand at their swords.* |

EntranceMeetingWyll.speaker: Wyll
EntranceMeetingWyll.text: Give me one reason why they shouldn't slay you where you stand.

EntranceMeetingWyll.speaker: Player
EntranceMeetingWyll.text: You need all the help you can get. Now stand down before I put you down.

EntranceMeetingWyll.speaker: Wyll
EntranceMeetingWyll.text: Fine - one last chance. See that you don't waste it.

EntranceMeetingWyll.speaker: Wyll
EntranceMeetingWyll.text: Inside, and hurry. I want that gate closed when the goblins get here.

ProdigyBrother.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother.text: Glad to see some goblin blood spilled for a change. I was sick of running from those rats.

RaiderCrafty.speaker: Warrior Trunk
RaiderCrafty.text: All these horns'll make fer good trophies... uh, no offence.
RaiderCrafty.context: NodeContext: The horns referred to are on the heads of recently slaughtered tiefling refugees, killed in a goblin raid. He's standing among the dead, pleased with the victory - his second phrase is an embarrassed acknowledgement of the fact he's talking to a tiefling ally

VoloBear.speaker: Bosk
VoloBear.text: You smell like blood. Like fighting. Be gone.
VoloBear.context: NodeContext: The bear smells the blood from the battlefield on you.

AD_RaidersAtPool.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sneem
AD_RaidersAtPool.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dancing around a bit as he fastens up the pants.

AD_RaidersAtPool.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_RaidersAtPool.text: Cheat! You was sneakin' ale the whole time!
AD_RaidersAtPool.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns and points at his mate accusatorily.

AD_RaidersAtPool.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sneem
AD_RaidersAtPool.context: CinematicNodeContext: Puts his hands on his hips defensively.NodeContext: Sounding rather haughty.

AD_RaidersAtPool.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_RaidersAtPool.text: It don't count. It don't count!
AD_RaidersAtPool.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stomping. He is mad.NodeContext: Frustrated.

LeaderKid.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid.text: What? I've said thank you. Should I write you a poem, too?

LeaderKid.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid.text: You do good work. If you can handle more than goblins, might be I'll have use of you in Baldur's Gate.

LeaderKid.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid.text: Always a deal to be done - even now.
LeaderKid.context: NodeContext: Casually referring to the impending battle.

LeaderKid.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid.text: Try not to die up there.

AD_CaringForOx.speaker: Eramas
AD_CaringForOx.text: Easy now! Not going to let the goblins get you.
AD_CaringForOx.context: NodeContext: Soothing nonsense - to an ox. Calming herself more than it.

AD_CaringForOx.speaker: Eramas
AD_CaringForOx.text: Unless they get me first, I suppose.

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.text: The road to Baldur's Gate will be easy compared to that.

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.text: Thanks - for keeping these people safe. For keeping us safe.

AD_RikkaAndDoni.speaker: Rikka
AD_RikkaAndDoni.text: There you are! Thank the gods. Enjoyed your little adventure, did you?
