PickpocketTrader.text: There goes half my customers. But you'll make up the difference, right?
PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: The druids are all dead. She's miffed to lose her customer base, but is secretly relieved the whole thing is over.

PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader.text: Just have to replenish our stock first.
PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: The druid attack is over - she's planning on looting the druids' belongings.

ServantPlight.speaker: Arron
ServantPlight.text: This is your last chance. Leave.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: Killing goblins is one thing, but this...
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: the attack is over, and she's dealing with the nausea she feels in the aftermath.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: ... I think I'm going to be sick.
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: the attack is over, and she's dealing with the nausea she feels in the aftermath.

AD_DruidGuard1.speaker: Jeorna
AD_DruidGuard1.context: NodeContext: Moving to attack - combat imminent

Tiefling010.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010.text: You stood by us. I thought you might. Glad I was right. You might even hang around and help us deal with goblins, by my reckoning.
Tiefling010.context: NodeContext: She's very warm to you. Playful lilt to this without being too light-hearted given the subject matter.

Trainee003.speaker: Gan
Trainee003.text: Leave one for me next time! A little one.
Trainee003.context: NodeContext: Acting tough. The druids are dealt with.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Sorry, no gruel on the pot today.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Now that this druid mess is over, I'm having to store up all the rations I can.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Which... isn't much. But we'll make do.

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

Stargazer.speaker: Nadira
Stargazer.text: Don't look at me! Those druids are out for blood.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAfterAttack.text: Think she'll be all right with the other kids?

AD_ParentsAfterAttack.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAfterAttack.text: Mol will keep an eye on her.

Griefling.speaker: Arka
Griefling.text: Backstabbing filth. Good riddance to the lot of them.
Griefling.context: NodeContext: Lingering anger, She survived an attack by the druids, who'd originally offer her and her people shelter.

ServantIntolerant.speaker: Marcoryl
ServantIntolerant.context: NodeContext: Vicious and cruel - you are eager to spill tiefling blood

AD_HideoutLeader.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutLeader.context: NodeContext: quiet, terrified, they're hiding from an attack

AD_HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeader.text: No, Zaki. It'll be over soon.

Tiefling011.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling011.text: We're stronger than we thought. And the druid fight is proof.

Trainee002.speaker: Ide
Trainee002.text: You fought them all, didn't you? Whoa.
Trainee002.context: NodeContext: Impressed. The druids are dealt with.

DruidGuard003.speaker: Mino
DruidGuard003.text: You outsiders had your chance to leave. Now blood's going to be spilled.
DruidGuard003.context: NodeContext: Combative. A fight's about to break out.

AD_FleeAfter.speaker: Zorru
AD_FleeAfter.text: Vicious gith. Murderous druids. I've had enough!

AD_DruidOpposed.speaker: Rath
AD_DruidOpposed.text: Silvanus forgive me for what I must do.

SonOfChef.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef.text: We should be used to the knives in our backs by now.
SonOfChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arms crossed.NodeContext: His people have been betrayed - yet again - through no fault of their own. The druids have been dealt with.

SonOfChef.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef.text: Good thing you were with us.
SonOfChef.context: NodeContext: Sighing a bit, trying to find a positive in the situation. The druids have been dealt with.

DruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader.text: The brood is restless. The mother strikes!

ScoutCaptive.speaker: Findal
ScoutCaptive.text: You should have left while you could.

TieflingLeader.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader.text: I knew Kagha had twisted them, but for so many to turn on us...

TieflingLeader.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader.text: Thank you for standing with us. I need to check on my people, but come see me when you have a chance.

ParentA.speaker: Locke
ParentA.text: Never thought the druids would attack. Thank you. We were lucky to have you.

session_synopses.GrieflingFriend: Memnos reacts to the druids turning on the tieflings. If the tieflings prevail, he reacts to this also.
session_synopses.ZenBear: This bear is still struck with grief because his master hasn't returned, but he's also incredibly angry because the player has committed a crime.
session_synopses.AD_RangerTraderLootingAfterAttack: Eramas is looking around the adventurers' spot in the Grove for useful stuff for the incoming goblin fight.
session_synopses.Prodigy: Rolan is being Rolan here - full of pride and arrogance, even as he begrudingly admits that the player played a large part in defending them from the druids.
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: Elegis is the gatekeeper for the grove. She is grim but determined to keep her kin safe as the druids attack.
session_synopses.AD_Refugee004: Toron, a tiefling, reacts to the druids attacking him and the other refugees sheltering in the grove.
session_synopses.RitualDruid3: Inwe has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She's calm and serious - she doesn't want to fight, but she will.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeader: Zevlor is a leader who hears commotion between his followers and a rival faction. These lines trigger from when he first hears the noise, investigates, sees a confrontation brewing to when fighting actually starts.
session_synopses.Tiefling004: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Trainee001: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Umi is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. He's frightened while they are attacking, and clearly shaken afterward.
session_synopses.AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack: Lovers go back to packing after attack on Den.
session_synopses.HideoutLeader: During and after the druid attack, Mol is frustrated and a little anxious rather than scared. If she made a deal with the player, tough and resilient when discussing it.
session_synopses.Bard: Alfira is scared but trying to hold it together during the attack. She is with the children in the hideout. She isn't a fighter but is prepared to lay down her life to protect them. She stays in the hideout with the children afterwards.After the attack, if the player has stolen or broken her instrument she is thankful but wary of the player. Otherwise she is grateful that someone has finally stuck by the tieflings.
session_synopses.Tiefling005: Pandirna is guard who is either 1) sprawled on the ground, unable to move. 2) healed due to the player's help. If she's healed, she is ready for a fight and eager to prove herself and protect those she loved. If she paralyzed, she just wants the player to protect the other tieflings - she's convinced she'll die. If she survives, she thanks the player - knowing it is directly because of them that she survived.
session_synopses.AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack: Okta is preparing meals for the road and Ikaron is snooping around the hag's corner, against his mother's pleas.
session_synopses.RitualDruid2: Kerrick has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. He's ready to do what needs to be done.
session_synopses.Weaponsmith_PostEA: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Dammon fights against the druids. He's provided the tieflings with their weapons, and he hopes they're up to the task. Afterward, he's back at his forge, repairing the weapons that were damaged in the skirmish.
session_synopses.AD_Trainer: Asharak is training kids when he hears commotion breaking out - he investigates to find the druid faction are attacking his people.
session_synopses.AD_YoungLover01: Danis reacts to the tiefling refugees (himself included) being attacked by the druids.
session_synopses.AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack: Tone: People trying to act somewhast normal under grave circumstances. Intreactions are intoned with gravity.The Bard is inside the kid hideout with the rest of the kids, supposedly keeping an eye on them as they are not to go outside the hideout anymore with the incoming goblin attack. Zaki is trying to act older and not scared and Alfira is playing along with it.
session_synopses.DruidGuard001: Jeorna, speaking just before the druids turn hostile against the tielfling refugees.
session_synopses.Kid004: Kid responses related to druid attack.
session_synopses.RitualDruid5: Tahani has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She's anxious to fight - she sees the tieflings as foreign invaders that need to be driven out.
session_synopses.PetWolf: This wolf is about to attack the other druids. He's full of energy and anticipation.
session_synopses.Protester3: A tiefling refugee reacts to the druids turning hostile against all the tieflings (both during and after battle).
session_synopses.ProdigyBrother: Cal is fighting the people who once hosted them in the grove. He'll do it to protect the tieflings but he hates it - he would much prefer a peaceful resolution.
session_synopses.AD_DruidLeader: Kagha shouts her ADs during the attack phase.
session_synopses.PrisonGuard: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.ProdigySister: Lia will defend her fellow tieflings to the death. She does not shy away from violence and is prepared to fight ever druid in the grove if it means saving her people.
session_synopses.ParentB: Marrick is hidden alongside the other tieflings during the attack but is unafraid. She is no fighter but if the druids reach her she will fight to her last breath. In her post attack dialogues, if her daughter has died her anger is waning even as she strives to hold onto it - the grief settling in as she realises all the dead druids in the world won't bring her daughter back.If her daughter in the post attack she is full of righteous anger - let anyone in the world take on the tieflings. They won't back down from anything.
session_synopses.ExcitedBoar: This boar was friendly to the player before. Now the player has committed a crime, and the boar feels betrayed. He's about to attack.
session_synopses.AD_ServantPlight: A battle is breaking out between the tieflings and the druids. This druid has previously tried to help the tieflings, and he is more surprised and sad than angry. He prays to his god that what they are doing is right.
session_synopses.AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack: Dammon is working to supply weapons and armour for the raid while Lakrissa and Rikka bother him during his work.
session_synopses.SnakeKid: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: This bear is about to attack, but she just woke up, and she's still sleepy.
session_synopses.AD_IrritatedTieflingTrainingAfterAttack: Guex is training on his own for the incoming goblin attack. Swinging his sword.
session_synopses.Protester2: A tiefling refugee reacts to the druids turning on him and his companions (both during and post-combat)
session_synopses.RitualDruid4: Elwyn has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She regrets that this has to happen, but will do what needs to be done.
session_synopses.RangerTrader: This dialogue has two states: getting ready for battle and after the battle.
session_synopses.IrritatedTiefling: Guex reacts to the druids turning on the tieflings in the grove, and  if the tieflings defeat their attackers.
session_synopses.DruidOpposed: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Protester1: A tiefling refugee reacts to the conflict with the druids (during and after)
session_synopses.Scammer: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.AD_TraineesAfterAttack: Trainees are bickering over who would be better to deal with the druids and the bears, after the attack has resolved and the player has taken down the druids.
session_synopses.Pickpocket: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Silfy is hidden away with the other tiefling children. She's terrified and thinks a theft may have triggered the attack. Afterward, she's back to her shy self.
session_synopses.AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack: Asharak and Zevlor are at the entrance and walking around together as they envision what sort of defense they can mount on the walls.
session_synopses.AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack: Kaldani wants to cut down some trees after the druid attack
session_synopses.RobberKid: Child pickpocket reacts ot the druid attack, and player's success in that attack.
session_synopses.AD_Tiefling001: ADs when the character is fighting a bunch of druids - she's angry, scared and full of adrenaline.
session_synopses.AD_SonOfChef: These lines play when the druids launch an attack against the tieflings in the druid grove. Ikaron's been on edge for a while, afraid something like this would happen. He doesn't hesitate to fight back - he's had enough of his people getting pushed around.
session_synopses.AD_ParentA: The druid attack has begun. Lock yells for everyone to hide and then quietly reassures the other tieflings around him to keep quiet and stay calm. He is a voice of reason and assurance.
session_synopses.PickpocketTrader: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Lim is hidden away with the other tiefling children. She's fairly calm, given the situation - she's used to getting out of binds. Afterward, she's already plotting how she might get out ahead, though she's a bit irked at the player for getting rid of a source of income.
session_synopses.ServantPlight: The player committed a crime, and this druid is extremely disappointed, but doesn't want to attack, so implores the player to leave. He knows a fight will break out in mere minutes.
session_synopses.VoloBear: The bear is about to attack us, because we comitted a crime. Imagine him very angry, his hackles raised and growling.
session_synopses.AD_FoodTrader: Okta is hidden with the other tieflings. She is determined to sacrifice herself to save the others if needs be. The druid attack is on going.
session_synopses.Tiefling001: This dialogue has two states: one where the character is getting attacked and is panicked, and one for after the attack, where she is trying to calm down, but killing other people is making her feel sick.
session_synopses.AD_DruidGuard1: Jeorna, a druid, shouts orders and battle cries after she and her fellow druids turn on the tielfings. Fanatical and aggressive.
session_synopses.YoungLover02: Bex reacts to the druids attacking the tieflings.
session_synopses.Wyll: Wyll's dialogue before and after Druid attack state. This is secondary recruitment state, if you trigger druid attack before he is recruited.
session_synopses.DruidGuard002: Maggran (the bear-druid guard, now in human form again) shouts aggresively before he and the other druids turn hostile on the players and the tiefling refugees.
session_synopses.AD_Tiefling011: Zorru calls out his reactions in ADs during different states of the druid attack.
session_synopses.GruntingKid: Tiefling kid who communicates by grunting during and after druid attack
session_synopses.Tiefling010: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Trainee003: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Gan is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. She's full of bravado - she's had training with a wooden sword, and she's eager to show off. She doesn't quite grasp the seriousness of the situation.
session_synopses.Chef: This dialogues occurs after the druid attack. Okta is relieved that they survived and drained from being tierrified (not that she would admit it). She's trying to be tough and no nonsense about the entire event.
session_synopses.ServantGnome: Loic has lost all his patience in this dialogue - you commited a crime, and he's really angry and disgusted. This happens right before he starts to attack the player.
session_synopses.RitualDruid1: Aelar has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. He's ready to do what needs to be done.
session_synopses.Stargazer: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsAfterAttack: Parents are mourning the death of their child after the druid attack. They hang around the grove and wonder what will follow.
session_synopses.Griefling: Arka reacts to the druids attacking the tieflings in the grove.
session_synopses.ServantIntolerant: Marcoryl is only too delighted to fight the tieflings. This is during the druid attack and he is eager to put down these 'hellspawn.'
session_synopses.AD_HideoutLeader: Two scared young tieflings: Mol protects Zavi during the druid attack
session_synopses.Tiefling011: Zorru one-liner reacting to druid attack state. Zorru has a proven dislike of githyanki, so those reactions are a bit different.
session_synopses.Trainee002: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Ide is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. She's frightened while they are attacking, but shakes it off quickly afterward. She's just impressed that the player could take on so many druids.
session_synopses.DruidGuard003: Spoken just before the Druids turn hostile against the tiefling refugees.
session_synopses.AD_FleeAfter: AD when Zorru flees attack on grove. He's fearful and running for his life.
session_synopses.CharmedKid: Two states: one where the child is about to get attacked by the druids and is panicking, and one where the player has saved him and he's grateful.
session_synopses.AD_DruidOpposed: Rath is defending the tieflings as Sagha and the other druids attempt to drive them out.
session_synopses.SonOfChef: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Ikaron is entirely focused on saving his people from the druids. Afterward, he's introspective, hurt that he and his people have had another safe harbour turn against him. Still, he is glad the players were there to help win the day.
session_synopses.DruidLeader: NPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile. In case player clicks on druid before hostility is fully set.
session_synopses.ScoutCaptive: A druid we saved from some goblins earlier - regretfully telling us it's too late to leave - his people are going to kill us.lNPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile.
session_synopses.TieflingLeader: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.ParentA: Locke is hidden alongside multiple other tieflings as the druids attack the grove. In his post attack lines he is grim and depressed if his daughter is dead (even as he thanks the player.) If his daughter is alive, he is saddened that violence occured but thankful the player was there to help.

node_data.speaker: Tilses
node_data.text: You're the one who helped at the gate? Glad to have another sword - we might need it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sizing you up

session_synopses: A guard outside the prison who can greet the player on their way in/ out.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Wyvern poison. Let's hope it doesn't come to that.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better a quick draught than ceremorphosis, nonetheless.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better to have on hand than not.

AD_Busy.speaker: Nettie
AD_Busy.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hand raised in a sign to wait and then turns back to what she was doing .NodeContext: Terse, impatient. She's dealing with serious matters right now.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: First you save us from goblins, then you bring Kagha back from the brink. You're making your mark.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.NodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Give me a moment. I'll be right with you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the playerNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Wait patiently.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Vis medicatrix...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Casts spell (healing word) on the bird.NodeContext: A quietly murmured spell

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: There. It's up to her now. Life or death.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still looking at the birdNodeContext: Still looking at the bird

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Now, what was it you needed?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to the playerNodeContext: Turns to player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Are you good enough to treat people, or just pets?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Good enough to tell there's nothing obviously wrong with you.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: A bit tired, maybe. But we're all a bit tired.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: You seem healthy enough. A bit tired 'round the eyes, maybe.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examines the player, carefully looking them up and and down.NodeContext: Examines the player, carefully looking them up and and down.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: More than tired. Something crawled into my eye.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Crawled in? Some sort of bug or - wait...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking closely at the player's eyesNodeContext: Looking closely at the player's eyes. Starts jovial, then realises something horrible

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Did it look like a tadpole? But from your worst nightmare? All slime, teeth, and tentacles?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Steps back, NodeContext: Steps back. You realise the player might be very dangerous, but don't want to spook them.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You know of them? Can you help me?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: I - I'll do what I can.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sadly. She's realising she'll have to kill the player.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Come, follow me. I might be able to help.
node_data.context: NodeContext: In command, but grave. She's decided she has to kill the player.

AD.speaker: Nettie
AD.text: Halsin would have known what to do. Damn it all.

Bird.speaker: Tingmiaq
Bird.text: To find Halsin. There's not a moment to lose!

AD_TadpoledStart.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledStart.text: We need to be quick. This way.
AD_TadpoledStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing for the player to follower her as she escorts them to the storage room, where they will be quarantined. NodeContext: Concerned

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I wonder what happened to that drow.

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: Is there a dead tadpole in that jar?

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I can't tell if this is a temple or a library.

AD_TadpoledCombat.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledCombat.text: I don't want to hurt you - but I have to protect the others.

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Something took a chunk out of you. What happened?

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *The bird says nothing, trying to rest.*

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Something took a chunk out of you. What happened?

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *The bird says nothing, trying to rest.*

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Something took a chunk out of you. What happened?

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *The bird says nothing, trying to rest.*

WoundedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
WoundedBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player prods the bird's injured wing

WoundedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
WoundedBird.text: Big dog - gnoll... I got too close...

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Where did you see these gnolls?

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *The bird lapses into silence, her head lolling to the side.*

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *She lies limply on the table, completely still.*
WoundedBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player prods the bird. No response.

PAD_FeelingSick.speaker: Player
PAD_FeelingSick.text: I don't feel too good. What did that druid scratch me with?
PAD_FeelingSick.context: NodeContext: Poison is slowly taking effect. You don't feel great, but it's nothing serious yet.

PAD_LockedUp.speaker: Player
PAD_LockedUp.text: So much for honesty. Our healer turned into a jailor pretty quickly once she heard about the tadpole.

PAD_LockedUp.speaker: Player
PAD_LockedUp.text: Can't blame anyone for reacting with fear - but it might do to keep our condition on a need-to-know basis.

PAD_Relieved.speaker: Player
PAD_Relieved.text: I can feel the poison clearing - I'm cured!

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: Looks like Halsin's our best bet for a cure.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: We need to find him, before it's too late.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: What if something happened to him?

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: All the more reason to hurry.

AD_Studying.speaker: Nettie
AD_Studying.text: I'll see if there's anything in Master Halsin's notes.

AD_Studying.speaker: Nettie
AD_Studying.text: He didn't find a cure, but maybe we can make you comfortable.

session_synopses.PAD_Cyanide: Context: Nettie has given the player a vial of poison to take if they start turning into mind flayers. Players reflect on whether they should actually take it if the time comes.Speaker 1 has just promised Nettie they will take the poison if they begin to turn. (SPEAK TO JORDI, The Speaker 1 nodes may need to be changed. )Speaker 2 reacts to Speaker 1 acquiring the poison after swearing to Nettie they'll use it if they start to turn.Gale - Shadowheart: We'll resort to poison if necessary.Lae'zel - Astarion - Wyll - Karlach: It won't come to that - don't entertain the option.
session_synopses.AD_Busy: Nettie is dealing with a player and has been interrupted by another player.
session_synopses: Nettie is the apprentice of Halsin, the missing druid. We can tell her about the parasite in our heads. She listens with compassion but decides the player is too dangerous and must be quarantined. If she knows about the parasite, she'll invite the player to come with her deeper into her rooms for "treatement."
session_synopses.AD: This triggers as Nettie is at her desk in Halsin's lab, researching and organising. The bird she was treating may have died at this point.
session_synopses.Bird: This bird has been told to go and find Halsin and you're interupting him just as he's getting ready to take flight. He's tense and in a hurry to be gone, so he'll only answer one question before taking to the skies and carrying out his mission.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledStart: Nettie's comments as she walks with the 'infected' player to the storage room, where they will be quarantined.
session_synopses.PAD_SeeDrow: The player broke inside the room without Nettie. Normally they follow her inside and they get the info from her. The VB stops playing when the tadpoled scene with Nettie starts or when Halsin is found in the goblin camp.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledCombat: The player triggered combat during the tadpoled scene
session_synopses.WoundedBird: Wounded bird is resting on the table after being treated by Nettie. It's probably going to die. If you poke it repeatedly, it will die.
session_synopses.PAD_FeelingSick: |The player has the status DEN_APPRENTICE_THORN on them. This status has 3 stages leading to death. The player is slowly dying.The first stage is right after being stung by Nettie in the situation Halsin's Apprentice (the reaction of the player is covered in the dialog DEN_Apprentice_Cyanide).This PAD plays after a long rest: the player rested but the status is worsening. The status is getting to stage 2 and then to stage 3, each time having worse gameplay effects.After stage 3, the status kills the player; the PAD DEN_Apprentice_PAD_Dying plays in that case.|
session_synopses.PAD_LockedUp: This is the VB that plays after Nettie locks the players up in her study once the players refuse to take the poison. She doesn't fight them, but the party reflects on her actions as a result of confessing the existence of the tadpoles.Speaker 1 is the player who disclosed the information and may show regret or indifference towards the current state.Speaker 2 comments on speaker 1 telling the truth to Nettie.
session_synopses.PAD_Relieved: The player is cured from poison ( the status DEN_APPRENTICE_THORN). This status has 3 stages leading to death. Each time the player make a long rest, they get closer to death.This PAD of relief plays only if the status reached the stages 2 or 3. The status was getting worse and worse, which must have been worrying, but now they've been cured.
session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleResearch: Player read Halsin's research on the mind flayer tadpole. The VB plays only if they didn't find Halsin already and didn't go through the tadpoled scene with Nettie (otherwise they got all that information from her so it's not a surprise).
session_synopses.AD_ToStorage: Nettie has arrived with the 'infected' player and is  gesturing for them go into the storage unit.
session_synopses.AD_Studying: After poisoning the tadpoled player, Nettie settles down at her old Master's desk to see if she can uncover any secrets about the tadpole in his research.

AD.speaker: Dammon
AD.text: *Sigh.* I miss my forge.

session_synopses.AD: Idle ADs for the tiefling blacksmith.

004.speaker: Tusk
004.text: Hmph. I thought you were Halsin.

004.speaker: Narrator
004.text: *The boar prances around, haunches clenching and unclenching impatiently.*
004.context: NodeContext: the player is describing the feelings of a tame boar that is hoping we've brought it something it craves - it's quite desperate

004.speaker: Tusk
004.text: Where's Halsin? He promised me a mate!

session_synopses.004: A tame boar in the druid grove who craves the company of his own kind
session_synopses.AD_Birdsong: Ad where the bird sings (when he is persuaded to sing instead of caring about his nest).
session_synopses.AD_002: animal sound AD for druid pet wolf in grove
session_synopses.AD_004: Animal sound AD for pet boar in druid grove

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Barth
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Don't make me hurt you, boy.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Meli
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Too late. Looking at you is painful enough.

Trainee1.speaker: Umi
Trainee1.text: Oh! Uh... right. 'Go for the heart.'
Trainee1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.NodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.

AD_HideoutTrespass.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutTrespass.text: Fine. I'll just go tell the guards you kicked us out of our home.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I don't have money or anything to sell. My p-partner does that.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_002.text: So what's your side of the business?

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I'm the guard? So... don't steal anything! I'm watching you!

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Little slow on the uptake, aren't you?

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Not sure why you're poking your nose in our business, though.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001.text: I don't even know what your business is.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: This is our hideout, but hey, maybe you didn't know.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Because of that, I'll give you a ten-count to leave.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutGuards.text: When do I get to run the ring scam?

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Silfy needs the practice. You'll be out there soon enough.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mirkon
AD_HideoutGuards.text: I bet that scam is going to kill in Baldur's Gate.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Don't get too attached to that con, kids. I got bigger plans for the city.

AD_MerchantLeaves.speaker: Mattis
AD_MerchantLeaves.context: NodeContext: Prompting, building confidence in his little sister.

VB_FoundStolenGoods.speaker: Player
VB_FoundStolenGoods.context: NodeContext: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place

HideoutGuard_002.speaker: Zaki
HideoutGuard_002.text: You don't look so tough. Mol fought off a hobgoblin all by herself.
HideoutGuard_002.context: NodeContext: Tough guy act from a kid. Potentially referring to Lae'zel (toad-lady)

CaughtThief.speaker: Narrator
CaughtThief.text: *You suddenly feel something moving against your back and turn.*
CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying

CaughtThief.speaker: Player
CaughtThief.text: Ignore her theatrics and grab her.

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player tries to grab her, but she escapes their grasp.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Uh, hey. You here to trade or...

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Yeah, I know. I was standing right here, telling her to rob you.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_001.text: You could at least pretend to be sorry.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: I am sorry! Sorry we're still talking about this.
Pickpocket_001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sincere, then mocking. NodeContext: Insistent, then mocking.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Look, you caught her. Good for you, you aren't a chump like everybody else around here.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Now, do me a favour. Make room for the chumps.

AD_CannotFitCrack.speaker: Player
AD_CannotFitCrack.text: I can't fit through here. Wonder if there's another way in.

Trainee3.speaker: Gan
Trainee3.text: This is boring. We should train against real goblins!

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: I saw you at the gates. You fight well.
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: All the trainees are getting added to the dialog on this nodeNodeContext: Teacher voice.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: A few words for the kids? Spare a story or two?
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: The global flag checks if any kid failed to be includedNodeContext: lower, not for the ears of the children

Trainer.speaker: Player
Trainer.text: They're just children - why are you teaching them to fight?

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: It's that or teach them to beg for their lives.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: The goblins will chase us to Baldur's Gate and these kids know it.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: A warrior like you could lift their spirits.

Trainer.speaker: Player
Trainer.text: I'll lift their spirits by wiping out that whole camp of goblins by myself.
Trainer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spoken to trainer (overheard by kids)

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: Thanks. I prefer when they smile.

Trainee2.speaker: Ide
Trainee2.text: Next time the goblins come, I'll be ready.

Trainee2.speaker: Wyll
Trainee2.text: Don't push it, kid. If you see trouble, then run. Only fight if you have to.

AD_Trespassing.speaker: Mattis, Meli, Mirkon, Silfy, Zaki
AD_Trespassing.text: You can't be here! This is our hideout!

AD_PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
AD_PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: Spoken to himself; checking his 'wares'

AD_HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeader.text: We're going to own that town.

session_synopses.AD_AdventurervsKid: Barth is threatening Meli, who has stolen a locket from him. Meli is playing dumb and/or threatening him in return.
session_synopses.Trainee1: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutTrespass: Mol has caught the player in her hideout and advises them to leave, starting to count down. She's threatening and serious.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_002: Not Critpath. A small tiefling girl (7-9 years old), very shy and nervous, is planning on stealing from the player and is surprised that they're talking to her. Though she's a gifted thief, she's not good at lying. There is also a portion of this dialogue where the player can get her to partially admit to having stolen from them.
session_synopses.HideoutKid_001: A young woman in her early teens, crime boss, leader of the thiefling kids in the Den. She reacts to the various ways the player has treated her kids so far, and if necessary, can return items to the player that her kids have stolen.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutGuards: The sneaky kids are talking amongst themselves in their secret hideout.
session_synopses.AD_MerchantLeaves: When the scammer (Lim) and the pickpocket walk away, having stolen from the player.
session_synopses.VB_FoundStolenGoods: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place
session_synopses.HideoutGuard_002: Little kid talkign to the player-- trying to be tough.
session_synopses.CaughtThief: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player catches the small tiefling girl (7-9 years old) is stealing from them. The player can grab and shake her, as per design.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_001: Non-critpath. A tiefling merchant kid who's trying to distract the player while his partner/sister steals the player's belongings. Orphaned street rat, works for Mol (Boss kid in the hideout)
session_synopses.AD_CannotFitCrack: Player found a crack through which they potentially can or cannot enter the kids' hideout.
session_synopses.Trainee3: Tiefling child far too confident they can fight goblins next time, even when scared.
session_synopses.AD_RobberKid: Child pickpocket, bored out of his mind, talking out loud.
session_synopses.Trainer: Non-critpath. Trainer asks the player to inspire the children. Player can give speeches or roar. Trainer, Asharak should sound weary and a little sad. He doesn't want to have to train children to fight.
session_synopses.Trainee2: Tiefling child confident they can fight goblins next time they come.
session_synopses.AD_Trespassing: A crime reaction dialog said by the kids in the Thiefling Hideout.
session_synopses.AD_MagicTrick: Silfy tries to learn Mattis's sleight of hand tricks. Big brother indulging his younger sister.
session_synopses.AD_TrainerLessons: A trainer speaking to children being taught to defend themselves in a makeshift outdoor training arena.
session_synopses.AD_PickpocketTrader: Scammer kid mutters to himself after having swindled someone.

AD.speaker: Volo
AD.text: Would that we could speak freely, my ursine friend!
AD.context: NodeContext: Pleading with theatrical, wistful flair

AD.speaker: Volo
AD.text: Alas, I've never learned to converse with your kind.
AD.context: NodeContext: Pleading with theatrical, wistful flair

AD.speaker: Bosk
AD.text: *Roar!*

AD.speaker: Volo
AD.text: Yes, I'm quite aware.

session_synopses.AD: Volo will have some casual behavior around camp. One of these behaviors is to wander over to a druid's tame bear and try to talk to it.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: Dance upon the stars tonight. Smile and pain will fade away. Words of mine will change - no. Become - ugh.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lightly strumming her lute. Not looking at the player. NodeContext: Softly singing. Sadness in every note. There is a small pause between every line as you softly sing.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: What's that tune you're singing?

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: More like butchering. Don't know why I bother.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at lute - frustratedNodeContext: Speaking of her own music. Embarassed and frustrated with herself. Dejected.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: Are you all right?

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: No. I'm moments away from a grisly death...
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at player. NodeContext: Sarcasm mixed with frustation.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: ...at the hands of this bloody song. I can't... nothing fits, you know?
Bard.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: Why are you songwriting now? Hardly the best time.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: I... we lost people on the way here.
Bard.context: NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: And the dead deserve to be remembered. That's what my teacher always said.
Bard.context: NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: This grove could become a battlefield soon enough. It's not the time for music.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: I know. I should be packing up, but I need to finish this song. It's... it's important.
Bard.context: NodeContext: Player has advised her to leave. But she can't - she has to finish her song. Frustrated, mainly at herself.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: Snatch the lute out of her hands and smash it.
False

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: You horrid, horrid beast. What is wrong with you?
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches out to grab Alfira's lute. Alfira stays seated - twists her body to the side out of the way. While saying first phrase. Stands up after first phrase. Then says 'What is wrong with you?'. Holding own lute close.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: Get the hells away from me.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding own lute close.NodeContext: Angry.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera starts on the bard, then pans to the animals.InternalNodeContext: We should be able to hear the bards song in the background, overshadowed be the animals complaining.NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.

Animals.speaker: Spar
Animals.context: NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.

Animals.speaker: Player
Animals.text: Don't mock her - she's trying her best... I assume.

Animals.speaker: Spar
Animals.text: Oh no! Whatever shall we do?
Animals.context: NodeContext: amused, ironic, making fun of the player.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.context: NodeContext: amused, ironic, making fun of the player.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.text: My head is melting! I'm leaving before the damage is permanent.
Animals.context: CinematicNodeContext: The critters leave.NodeContext: amused, ironic, making fun of the player.

AD_Dejected.speaker: Alfira
AD_Dejected.context: NodeContext: She has 'lost' her instrument (player stole it). You are on the brink of tears, feeling lost and ashamed - you wanted to write a song for your teacher, and now you never will. You feel like a failure.

AD_ComposingSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong.text: When you call the last light...
AD_ComposingSong.context: NodeContext: Hesitantly singing the song, feeling out the words as you compose.

AD_ComposingSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong.context: NodeContext: Hesitant as you try to figure out the song.

AD_ComposingSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong.context: NodeContext: Frustrated - feeling like a failure.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.context: NodeContext: Gently singing. Sad but hopeful.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Smile and pain will fade away.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Words of mine will turn to ash.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: When you call the last light down.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Moon. Sun. All remind me of your grace.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Faith. Care. All the love I can't repay.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Moon reminds me of your grace.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: All the love I can't repay.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Rest and know that I will pray.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Moon. Sun. All remind me of your grace.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Faith. Care. All the love I can't repay.

session_synopses.Bard:
Alfira is a young bard who was apprenticed to a woman called Lihala. On their journey to the camp, they were attacked by gnolls, and Lihala died horribly.
Alfira is trying to compose a song in honour of the teacher she loved so dearly, but is struggling. The player can help her play, talk ther through the lyrics, steal her instrument, or even convince her to give up music.
This is a very soft and touching moment in the grove. Should Alfira finish her song (with the aid of the player) she will stand up and sing it in a cinematic scene.
session_synopses.Animals: This occurs as the bard, Alfira is playing her lute. The animals are NOT impressed and making fun of her and the player. They are very dramatic.
session_synopses.AD_Dejected: Dejected/crying because her instrument was stolen or smashed by a player.
session_synopses.AD_ComposingSong: The bard is struggling to come up with a song to accompany her lute.
session_synopses.AD_FullSong: The bard is playing on her lute and singing the full song the player helped her compose.

AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.speaker: Olodan
AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.text: Nature's ruination! You have spoiled everything!

SnakesCourt.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druids are holding court. The child stands with a snake guarding her, facing judgment. She cries out an apology.

SnakesCourt.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt.text: This is madness, Kagha. She's just a...

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: A what, Rath? A thief? A poison? A threat?

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: I will imprison the devil. And I will cast out every stranger.
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Tsk. That damned nose of yours has gone poking in our business.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Shh-shh. No need. It couldn't be helped.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Kagha! What is the meaning of this?

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You think yourself quite the spy, don't you? Go on - tell him.

Denouncing.speaker: Player
Denouncing.text: Forget it, rat. You can explain it yourself.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You'd decline the honour? Very well.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Halsin's always welcomed untouchables to your midst. Defiled the grove for the sake of 'harmony'.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: We've come from Cloakwood to correct his mistakes.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Cloakwood... Shadow Druids? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

PAD_FoundSecretLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundSecretLocation.text: Odd - someone's cut a notch in the tree there.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *The rat has hardly left Kagha's side. A distant thought claws at your mind...*

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *... but slips away before it comes into focus.*

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Mercy on us, Silvanus - mercy, mercy, mercy.

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: The child is to blame. She shouldn't have stolen in the first place.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Preventable. The sickening result of sickening beliefs.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: We let this happen. We let this snake replace our leader.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: Shadow Druids? There's more to Kagha than meets the eye.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: It's time we had a talk with her, don't you think?

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: A deep elf - in our grove, on this day. A sign. Or rather, a gift.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: Who better to understand a watchful broodmother than a beloved child of Lolth?

Leader.speaker: Player
Leader.text: You protected your own without hesitation - my compliments.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: Then we agree. Preservation is not luxury, it is not zealotry. It is necessity.

PAD_KidDied.speaker: Player
PAD_KidDied.text: The snake killed that girl in front of everyone. Is this grove worth a dead child?

PAD_KidDied.speaker: Player
PAD_KidDied.text: The longer we stay here, the closer we come to reaching the same fate.
PAD_KidDied.context: NodeContext: Karlach just watched some druids accidentally kill a tiefling girl. She's stunned.

AD_OpposedDenounce.speaker: Kagha
AD_OpposedDenounce.text: The first letter from Cloakwood came a season ago.

AD_OpposedDenounce.speaker: Kagha
AD_OpposedDenounce.text: But when Halsin departed... the shadows truly took root.

AD_OpposedDenounce.speaker: Kagha
AD_OpposedDenounce.text: I should have resisted. It should have... been different.

session_synopses.AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba: Leader of the shadow druids ADs in combat.
session_synopses.SnakesCourt: Druids hold court to determine whether or not to lock up a tiefling child for stealing their precious artifact. If you fail to stop them, the child tries to run and is attacked by their guardian snakes.Sagha the druid leader is the main player in this scene. She is machiavellian, and flips to evil should the snakes attack the child.
session_synopses.Denouncing: You have confronted Kagha about being a Shadow Druid. This has initiated the transformation of the rats into shadow druids before your very eyes. The shadow druids welcome the circle into their fold; you have to fight, or convince Kagha to come around, which will be very hard - and even harder if the kid died before. Olodan the shadow druid is their leader; slobbering and sleazy.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundSecretLocation: Player notice the tree that contains Kagha's letter from the Shadow Druids. They might find it by chance or know it was there.The note that sends players here reads like this: [The marks crisscrossing the page don't look scribed so much as slashed.]Kagha.Swamp-docks. Tree. Meet me. Alone.Olodan.
session_synopses.001: Shadow Druid in rat shape. Trying to use speak with animals or animal handling results in nothing.
session_synopses.Opposed: Rath is a human druid opposed to Kagha, who has taken control of the grove in Halsin's absence. He is a kind, determined man, who seeks to keep nature in balance and prevent violence at all costs.
session_synopses.AD_CallWolf: Silver, Rath's wolf companion, is wandering away from him. He calls the wolf back. Patient and affectionate tone.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter: Player found and read the recruitment letter that Kagha got from the Shadow Druids.
session_synopses.Leader: Player speaks with Kagha, the secret Shadow druid. Various paths of conversation reflect whether Kagha's actions led to a child's death or not. She may be neutral/Machiavellian or pure evil, depending.
session_synopses.PAD_KidDied: Reaction after Arabella, a tiefling child, is killed by the druid Kagha's serpent in the grove. Requires two speakers.Speaker 1 is the character who was in the dialog and had opportunity to stop it. (May have tried and failed or simply refrained from acting)Speaker 2 is an accompanying character, they may have an opinionated line regarding the outcome according to their own beliefs.
session_synopses.AD_OpposedDenounce: Player persuaded Kagha to not join the shadow druids after all. Kagha and Rath survived the combat and are talking together now. Kagha is good, repentant.

AD_Guards.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards.text: Don't do this to me, Kanon.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Ain't sure why ya protected me. Don't care, neither.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: It's too late to make friends, worgmeat. My tribe's comin'.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: They're gonna burn this pretty place for the glory of the Absolute and 'ang ya by yer guts.

Caged.speaker: Player
Caged.text: The Absolute? Can't say I know your god.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: We're burnin' Her name across the face o' the world, we are.
Caged.context: NodeContext: speaking of her god - the Absolute - awe.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: The Absolute is gold from the sky, She is. The blessin' in the storm an' the storm itself.
Caged.context: NodeContext: speaking of her god - the Absolute - awe.

Caged.speaker: Player
Caged.text: You've caught my interest. Have any holy literature on you?

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: My tribe can tell you everythin' there is to know. Absolute blessed one of our own - Priestess Gut.
Caged.context: NodeContext: Very arrogant - extremely pleased that a goblin has been chosen to be blessed

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Got a whole lab set up. Cooks up potions that fix our lads no matter how much of a beatin' they take.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Could probably stick yer head back on if someone woz to chop it off. Mighty booyahg.

AD_TieflingLeader.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader.text: Why don't you just set me free, tiefy?

AD_TieflingLeader.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader.text: I'll tell you everything you want to know... I swear.
AD_TieflingLeader.context: NodeContext: she's messing with him. she won't tell him shit and they both know it. she's wheedling him.

AD_TieflingLeader.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader.text: And you ain't a good player.

GuardsAvenge.speaker: Memnos
GuardsAvenge.text: Arka, wait! You can't just shoot her!

GuardsAvenge.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge.text: Why not? That's what her kind did to Kanon.

GuardsAvenge.speaker: Sazza
GuardsAvenge.text: Ya ain't gonna shoot me. Yer hands are shakin'.
GuardsAvenge.context: CinematicNodeContext: CUSTOM SCENE VIEWER: Sazza in cageNodeContext: mocking. Sazza is mocking Arka. Arka's hands ARE shaking and so is the crossbow.

Friend.speaker: Memnos
Friend.text: So much death. So much waste.
Friend.context: NodeContext: Arka is dead. Cold grief - not falling apart, but trying to keep it together.

Dead.speaker: Sazza
Dead.context: NodeContext: cold, emotionless, speaking with her corpse

session_synopses.AD_Guards: Several conditions of conversations between Arka and Memnos here: Sazza escaped, sazza was killed, the pair wait for the goblin attack at the gates, or Arka's brother, Kanon, has been killed by goblins.
session_synopses.Caged: Character is caged for this entire dialogue If the player saves the goblin captive from being killed, the goblin will try to convince the player to free them and then meet the player later in the goblin camp.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeader: Conversation between Zevlor and Sazza that the player can overhear. The idea is that the player will understand there's something weird going on with Zevlor, that he isn't all he seems, without giving away the whole shebang.
session_synopses.Transit: The grieving tiefling pair moves to Sazza. Arka is set on killing Sazza as indirect revenge for the death of Kanon, who was slain by goblins.
session_synopses.GuardsAvenge: The grieving tiefling pair at the gate face off with Sazza. Arka is set on killing Sazza as indirect revenge for the death of Kanon, who was slain by goblins.
session_synopses.Friend: Memnos - the supporting optional tiefling character in the Captive Goblin situation, Friend to Arka.
session_synopses.Dead: A speak with dead dialogue with Sazza, the captured goblin at the grove.

PAD_FirstInsight.speaker: Player
PAD_FirstInsight.text: I'd swear that ox's gaze is following me.

session_synopses.PAD_FirstInsight: The player walks past and, if they notice (pass an insight check), responds to the ox looking at them strangely.
session_synopses.AD_ToronCurious: Toron notices you speaking with the strabge ox, but he's not too concerned, just curious.
session_synopses.AD_OxReaction: This AD plays after you have spoken with the ox with SwA, if you linger or pass by the ox again.

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: You're the one who knocked my jaw out of joint.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Plays if the player didn't talk to Zevlor at the gates after KOing him in the confrontationNodeContext: Player knocked Zevlor out to defuse an earlier confrontation - he's a bit aggrieved

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: And yet you walk in here like it's your domain. Typical drow arrogance.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Looking you up and down, irritated

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: Lucky for you, you seem to have spooked Aradin and his trash into leaving.

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: Raise your hand to one of us again, however, and every tiefling in this encampment will fall on you like a tide.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You had it coming.

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: And so will you, if you ever interfere in my business again. That I promise you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Not interested in the player giving out to him.

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: You helped us fight those goblins. Who are you?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Coming around, getting his bearings, realizing he should find out more about the player.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Just passing through.

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: Right. Best not to stop here.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Matter-of-fact. Playuer isn't being particularly friendly, so neither is zevlor

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: Whatever your business here, I'd see to it quickly - the druids are forcing everyone out.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Serious - knows he's delivering bad news

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: This latest attack will only strengthen their resolve.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Wary, tired - knows the druids will be furious about the goblin attack and blame his people

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Those goblins - have there been many attacks like that?

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: There have been several attacks by different monsters. The druids blame us 'outsiders' for drawing them here. Nobody's welcome anymore.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Explaning a serious situation - the mention of 'outsiders' is bitter - his people always get blamed for everything

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: They've started a ritual to cut the grove off from the world outside.

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Weary, doesn't know what to do

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: Thank you again for your help out there.

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: I understand. I can only thank you for the help you've already given.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Disappointed, trying to be understanding

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: We're raised to fear the drow, but you've earned your place here. I'll make sure everyone here knows that.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Considering us anew - most would run from our race on sight, but he's reassuring us that we're welcome

HeadedToCave.speaker: Zevlor
HeadedToCave.text: Find me in the caves. I need to let people know we're moving.
HeadedToCave.context:
InternalNodeContext: Player clicks on Zevlor while he is getting back to his default position in the cave after the confrontation.
When Zevlor finally reaches the cave, his dialog is switched to DEN_TieflingLeader

AD.speaker: Zevlor
AD.text: The gate needs fortification.
AD.context: NodeContext: Grim. Worried. He's reached his cave and is contemplating the journey ahead.

PAD_ZevlorsMap.speaker: Player
PAD_ZevlorsMap.text: Looks like we're in Elturgard. Some distance from the city of Baldur's Gate.
PAD_ZevlorsMap.context: NodeContext: Karlach, grumbling about being so far from BG

PAD_ZevlorsMap.speaker: Player
PAD_ZevlorsMap.text: Gnolls and goblins marked on the map. Travel won't be easy.

session_synopses: In these dialogues, Zevlor reflects on what's happened (an attack of goblins at the gate, which the player helped with) and his mistrust of and bitterness towards the druids who are reluctantly hosting his people. He is exasperated, furious, but also eager to meet anyone who could help. In the same dialogue, we can also uncover that he is in fact a traitor, concerned only with getting these people through the goblins so he can trade them for his own safety later. In truth he is resentful and contemptuous of them, viewing them as weak.
session_synopses.HeadedToCave: |Zevlor's default dialog need a timeline context, so this dialog here is used as a transition when Zevlor is walking back to his default spot after a big event happened in the Grove. There's 2 cases: after the raiding party and after druid attack.|
session_synopses.AD: Zevlor is at his default spot in the tieflings cave. Normally he has an AD with Tilses, but if she's dead or otherwise unavailable, he uses this solo AD instead.
session_synopses.PAD_ZevlorsMap: |Player clicked on Zevlor's map (a map of Elturgard that shows the road to Baldur's Gate). Zevlor will likely have drawn on it.|

AD_Combat_Sapper_004.speaker: Sapper Gald
AD_Combat_Sapper_004.text: This is where it gets good.

PAD_AbsoluteHuntsBox.speaker: Player
PAD_AbsoluteHuntsBox.text: They're seeking a weapon. I wonder if they mean that odd artefact...

PAD_AbsoluteHuntsBox.speaker: Player
PAD_AbsoluteHuntsBox.text: If that's the case, we've got more problems than just the worms in our heads.

session_synopses.PAD_AbsoluteHuntsBox: The party reflects on learning that they are being hunted by the followers of the Absolute for the 'weapon' they have - in fact the strange artefact that protected them from the mysterious Voice when they first reached the temple.This can occur after meeting with Dror Ragzlin or Minthara.

PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.text: There are many memories I wish I could erase from my mind - the stench of this place is chief among them.

session_synopses.CINE_Statue_01: Cinematic arena dialog to destroy a statue.

PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.text: The druid Halsin is in here somewhere.

PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.text: Let's hope we find him in one piece.

session_synopses.PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp: Thematically, this VB is a conversation about the goblin camp and how difficult it might be to find the druid there. Player will be aware that he's being held captive somewhere in the camp and can see the goblins's strength.This occurs over walking into a trigger, so lines between speaker 1 and speaker 2 can be fairly opinionated.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Blood everywhere. This camp was ambushed.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: No ordinary creature did this. Redcaps ripped the place to pieces.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for HAG. The player comes across a wrecked campsite that is covered in blood and clearly abandoned. Passing a Nature check reveals the culprits to be redcaps.

AD_HagCackles.context: NodeContext: A set of different cackles for Ethel. All evil. All nasty. All mean. At least three different kinds.

AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor.text: 'A thief who tried to steal from Auntie. Now the good little pet guards my home.'

AD_VictimSign_004.text: 'My sweet Calim, whose beloved asked that his beauty never fade.'

PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.speaker: Player
PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.text: They're not attacking. Must think I'm one of them.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: Ungh... what... argh... what in the bloody hells is going on?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: I - I remember that bit. I think. She...  turned me to stone. Because of the Bite! Of course.
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Your memories are coming back. You remember going to the hag for a spell to save you.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: I can't believe you fixed it. How did you cure me?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: . You have an incurable disease and you can't believe they player managed to fix it (spoiler: they didn't)

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: Well - yes. Why d'ya bloody think I'm here?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Player has asked about your disease and was it contagious. You're surprised and confused by the question.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: Oh, no, no. Why - why did you remove the spell if ya couldn't fix me?!
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. You realise the player hasn't cured you of a horrible and contagious disease you have - they've condemned you to death.

AD_VictimSign_005.text: 'This poor dear wished never to lay eyes on her family again.'

VB_BurningCage.speaker: Player
VB_BurningCage.context: NodeContext: You're trying to save a woman. She's trapped in a cage that is one fire.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.text: Hah! Catch me if you can, petal!
AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.context: NodeContext: You've turned invisible and disappeared during the fight. Laughing and joking with amused menace.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *You feel crushing waves of fear as a presence within the door recoils. It can't let people through. Not again!*
TalkingDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Just a shot of the player and the door - no visions yet. Player pressing a hand to their head as waves of fear hit them.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *You see the gallery, its walls lined with the hag's victims - their bodies and minds twisted beyond ruin.*
TalkingDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the gallery - the huddled victim in the mirror, the headless victim, the vacant bleeding eyes sockets

AD_VictimSign_002.text: 'My darling Magron. She wished for the mind of a genius, but the silly head crossed me.'

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.speaker: Mayrina
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.text: Get me out of this hellhole!
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.context: NodeContext: The hag has sent out illusions that look like you. You're horrified and crying out to the player, running towards them for safety. It's in the middle of a fight and you're scared but still being your usual bratty and petulant self.

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead.text: ... but... no more. I am Lorin... only...

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake.context: NodeContext: This is the fake illusion. She has Mayrina's voice and is pretending to be Mayrina. Crying in the fight - begging and pleading for the player to believe that they are the real Mayrina and the other is the fake. It should ring a little false.

AD_SummonVictims.context: NodeContext: You're forcing two people to come help you in battle - it's a spell and they have no free will. Soft alluring voice as you call our to them across the room.

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Player
Victim_005_Dead.text: Why did you go to the hag?

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead.text: My family took her... my baby girl...

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead.text: Told Ethel... never wanted... to see them again... she... took my eyes...

VB_MayrinaInCage.speaker: Player
VB_MayrinaInCage.context: NodeContext: You've spotted the woman you're trying to save.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I was a fool. I wanted to know my fate. I had a choice between two lives, and I was frightened of choosing wrong.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Player has asked how you ended up in the hag lair. Your voice is filled with regret.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I asked the hag to help me see what the future would hold. Got what I wished for, too.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I saw my future self - a corpse, rotten with maggots. And everyone around me dead. Putrid and dead.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Dazed horror as you recall the visions that pushed you to the brink of insanity.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed.text: You mentioned choosing between two lives. What were they?

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: A boring story. Stay or go. Marriage and kids or a life of novelty.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Your voice is filled with regret. You gave up everything because you were too afarid to make a choice.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I lost my best years rather than just... choose.

AD_VictimSign_003.text: 'My gentle Lorin. He wished to know what was to come.'

AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.context: NodeContext: Calling out from a cage. You're scared but determined - yelling for the fighting to stop

Victim_004.speaker: Narrator
Victim_004.text: *The mirror glints in the light - the screams from within now silent.*

VB_MirrorScreams.speaker: Player
VB_MirrorScreams.context: NodeContext: Confused at the sound but you can't tell where it is.

PutOnMask.text: Hello, petal. My, my - the mask suits you. Just relax. See the world with fresh eyes.
And let your dear old Auntie Ethel look after you.

AD_VictimSign_001.text: 'My dearest Efrin. He begged me to halt the deadly disease that ravaged him.'

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1.context: NodeContext: You've summoned illusions of yourself to confuse and taunt the player. You're calling out to them in a mocking and amused tone.

AD_ViciousMockery.text: Think you're a person because you're walking on two feet? Adorable.

AD_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
AD_Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: One the ground - cowering. Curled up - looking in front of you at a mirror and then ducking behind your hands. NodeContext: Panicked and afraid. You're severely traumatised and not really aware of your surroundings.

AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.speaker: Demir, Johl
AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of a fight. The hag has assumed the form of your sister but you can tell it's fake. Calling out a warning to the player - fear in your voice.

EntranceDouble.text: You are as thick as they come, sweetness.
EntranceDouble.context: NodeContext: Threatening smile while taunting player.The old lady act is gone.

HagBegsForMercy.text: Wait! Argh. Wait just a tick.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: You're on the brink of being defeated in the fight and you've stopped it - preparing to beg for your life with a new deal. You're breathless and in pain, fighting to regain control.

HagBegsForMercy.text: Killing me is a waste of time - I'll find a way to return. Always have, always will.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: little breathy from the fight, coldly determined in the second line

HagBegsForMercy.text: But it's... unpleasant. So how about we be civilised about this, hmm? I have something you want.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: wincing at the thought in the first line, turning on the charm in the second, trying to regain control

HagBegsForMercy.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy.text: Indeed. I'll take your head and stick it on a pike.
Now, petal, there's... there's no need for such talk.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: Player has threatened to kill you. You're scared and not used to it - trying not to show it.

VB_EnteredGallery.speaker: Player
VB_EnteredGallery.context:
NodeContext: Creeped out and horrified as you enter a 'gallery' of the hag's victims.
Shadowheart: droll.

Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003.text: No... No. Don't look. Mustn'tlook. Mustn'tsee.

Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003.text: No... No. Don't look. Musn'tlook. Musn'tsee.
Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sitting on the ground, knees up, hands moving from across knees to face as you rocking back and forth, severely traumatised and trying to hide from the worldNodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue. This is quite a disturbing scene - you're clearly traumatised but trying to hold it together initially. Speaking and muttering to yourself (the image you are trying not too look at is your own corpse - rotten and broken), You are not looking at the player.

Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003.text: I see it - what's to come.
Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Shot of mirror.  His reflection stares back.|NodeContext: Quickly muttered - not looking at player.

PAD_AtEntrance.speaker: Player
PAD_AtEntrance.context: NodeContext: Wyll's line: a bit sing-songy but not too much.

PAD_Explore2.speaker: Player
PAD_Explore2.text: The work of the hag. No doubt about it.

session_synopses.AD_HagCackles: A set of different cackles for Ethel to be used in the lair.
session_synopses.PAD_Explore1: Players have wandered into the Hag Lair without Ethel being present and are commenting on the creepy environment. This is the first to fire.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor: This person has been turned into a door and is unable to speak. Sign attached to it.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_004: This person is trapped in a mirror and mute.
session_synopses.PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral: You are wearing the mask and the other masked victims do not attack you.
session_synopses.Victim_001:
The dwarf was turned to stone by the hag to stop the spread of an deadly disease - Laduguer's Bite. Little does he know that the hag was the one who cause the disease in the first place.

Should you remove the petrification spell BEFORE the hag is dead, the disease will kill him.

Should you speak to him after the hag is dead, you can figure out that the hag is the one who made him sick in the first place.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_005: An eyeless woman - dead. One of the hag's victims. You're reading a sign in front of her eyeless body.
session_synopses.VB_BurningCage: This occurs when the hag sets the cage on fire.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2: The hag turns invisible and disappears during the fight.
session_synopses.TalkingDoor: The door guarding the entrance to the hag's lair. It's actually transparent and the player can walk through it. It's a cut scene as the door tries to project images onto the player and communicate to them. Pleading with them to leave. The door was a thief that was taken by Ethel and torn to shreds, with the remainder of his body transformed into a door.Much of this is a 'cut scene' as the door projects visions into the player's mind instead of communicating.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_002: A victim holding their own decapitated head in their hands. This is the sign attached to their corpse.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real: Triggered during the fight with the hag. She has sent out illusions mimicking Mayrina. The real Mayrina is trying running towards the player. Her voice and mannerisms should be a clue to the player that this is the real Mayrina.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Dead: The characters has died and player is using the 'speak with dead' spell. Character is at peace. He lived in fear of his own death. Now that it's happened, he's at peace.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake: These are fired during the fight. It's the hag pretending to be Mayrina.
session_synopses.AD_SummonVictims: Auntie Ethel summons victim_001 and victime_003 to aide her in battle.
session_synopses.Victim_005_Dead: A dialogue with the corpse of a hag victim with her eyes gouged out. She is happy to be dead-- she lived a terrible life and carried family secrets heavily upon her. Her voice should be meek and delicate. She has borne too much in this life already and is ready to be done.
session_synopses.VB_MayrinaInCage: Triggers when the player enters the lair and sees Mayrina trapped in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Freed: This occurs if Lorin survived the fight with the hag. He is dazed and out of it. This is the victim who first say the player as a mind flayer and freaked out. 1) In scenario one, he was never summoned by the hag2) He was summoned and attacked the player and saw the player turn into a mindflayer3) He was summoned and attacked the player but never saw the player as a mind flayer
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_003: This person is alive but severely traumatised and hysterical.
session_synopses.AD_SurrogateMotherInCage: ADs fire by Mayrina when she is trapped in the cage. In the first set it's when combat has started and she is cheering the player on, in the second set she just wants the player to leave her alone. In the third set the cage is on fire, and in the last the fighting is over but she's still locked in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_004: A victim of the hag's. They're trapped inside a mirror.
session_synopses.VB_MirrorScreams: Trigger near mirror - someone is trapped inside.
session_synopses.PutOnMask: Player put on mask and is hearing auntie's voice telepathically booming around them.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_001: This is the plaque that is attached to the petrified body of one of the hag's victims.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1: The fires as Ethel summons illusions of herself to confuse the player.
session_synopses.AD_ViciousMockery: The Hag will cast Vicious Mockery on the party in combat. Whoever she targets will be insulted by origin or race. If a character is targeted multiple times, another insult in the chain will be used.
session_synopses.AD_Victim_003: This is a victim of the hag. He was cursed to see the future - he's severely traumatised. In the first AD he's been summoned to fight by the hag. In the rest, he's curled up ont he ground and talking to himself. Severely traumatised.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion: The hag assumes the form of Mayrina in the boss fight. The brothers are able to tell who is Mayrina and who is the hag.
session_synopses.EntranceDouble: This fires when the player enters the victim gallery, She appears to taunt them and then vanishes.
