session_synopses.HagBegsForMercy: The hag is on the brink of defeated. She's stoppped the fight to try and plead for her life by offering the player the thing she does best - a deal. If Mayrina is present she asks offers you a powerful gift in exchange for her life (she will also take Mayrina with her) or the hag can bargain for Mayrina's life but lose out on the powerful gift. It is a tense and heightened situation.
session_synopses.VB_EnteredGallery: Triggers as you enter the hag gallery. It's creepy.
session_synopses.Victim_003:
This victim was cursed to see the future by the hag. In his initial dialogue, he is SEVERELY traumatised - sitting down, knees up, peeking out between his arms. He should sound quite disturbed, as if his sanity has long since deserted him.

He doesn't look at the player until halfway through the dialogue. When he looks up, he believes the player to be a monster of nightmares - a mindflayer. This is a terrifying moment for the player, as they are fighting a parasite in their head that will cause them to turn into a mindflayer.

In his dialogue in which he's met the player but has survived the hag, his gift is gone - but once he realises the player is the monster he saw before, he runs - terrified. 

In his post hag dialogue he is saddened and clearly traumatised by his time with the hag - and the thought of the life he could have led.
session_synopses.PAD_AtEntrance: Combat has started with the hag. She's fled downstairs. You've gone through the fireplace and have just appeared in her lair. Furtive. Looking around for Auntie Ethel.
session_synopses.PAD_Explore2: Players are wandering around the Hag Lair and have gotten into her workshop. It is filled with blood and bones. The hag may or may not be alive at this point.

Tunnel.speaker: Narrator
Tunnel.text: *Decaying legs protrude from the hole - a failed escape, it seems.*
Tunnel.context: CinematicNodeContext: See the legs sticking out of the hole

Tunnel.speaker: Narrator
Tunnel.text: *It seems the tunnel collapsed mid-dig and suffocated him. A crooked heart is embroidered on his left shoe.*
Tunnel.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player is crouched and looking intently at the body

Guard.speaker: Warrior Plig
Guard.text: Steal somethin' or act the bollocks, will ya? I'm itching to throw someone in the brig. It'll be fun. I promise.
Guard.context: NodeContext: plig wants the player to act out so she can throw them in jail

PAD_TunnelBlocked.speaker: Player
PAD_TunnelBlocked.text: Still blocked - but should be easy enough to clear.

session_synopses.Tunnel: A body is found protruding out of a tunnel in the GOB prison. For patch 6: After pulling the body out, the player can use the tunnel to instantly escape. Patch 7: the player will need to find a shovel to dig their way out, but this will be outside the dialogue.
session_synopses.Guard: Warrior Plig is a goblin on patrol around the wolf pens in the goblin camp. She's bored and wishing for some action.
session_synopses.PAD_TunnelBlocked: The player has pulled the body from the tunnel in the goblin prison, but it's still blocked by debris. The player can attack it if they can do enough damage (vulnrable to Force damge), are small enough to get good levrage, or shapeshifted into a badger. This AD plays to inform the player the way is still blocked and to hint at the solution.

Penance.speaker: Abdirak
Penance.text: The pain you suffer will cleanse you - do not fight it.
Penance.context: CinematicNodeContext: Weapon in hand (it will be either a dagger, a scourge, or a handaxe). Perhaps by his side as he takes a breathe between strikes to speak to the player. NodeContext: First time stirking the player. Excited and joyous - think a preacher building up to a full 'the lord will save us' act in a church.

Penance.speaker: Player
Penance.text: Yelp loudly and dramatically beg for mercy.
Penance.context: InternalNodeContext: Succeeding this one is the "positive" outcome because of the reaction to the pain

Penance.speaker: Abdirak
Penance.text: Tch. Beg sincerely or don't beg at all!
InternalNodeContext: No reaction, either because the reactions already played, or because Shadowheart and/or Astarion couldn't be included
Penance.context: InternalNodeContext: No reaction, either because the reactions already played, or because Shadowheart and/or Astarion couldn't be included

RewardPenance.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance.text: Sweet child. While I enjoyed that, I'm afraid your reaction was... lacking.
RewardPenance.context: NodeContext: Voice low and intimate. Player did penance but did not react correctly. He regrets that the player does not get a reward (but he had a great time, which is all he really cares abotu)

RewardPenance.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance.text: To gain Loviatar's favour, every single strike should be met with an honest cry of pain - or perhaps a touch of begging.

RewardPenance.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance.text: Nevertheless, thank you. And I pray you've learned from today's little... lesson.

Battlestation.speaker: Abdirak
Battlestation.text: My penitent child, the goblins have blood on their minds. I am leaving - I suggest you do the same.
Battlestation.context: NodeContext: The goblins are fighting, he's calm and measured but about to flee. He wants no part in it.

session_synopses.Penance: This occurs as Abdirak is beating the player. Breathless with excitement. Reveling in the act of penance - think preacher in 'god will save us, save us ALL!' mode as he, well, beats the crap out of the player. All of his reactions should be manic, joyous and vaguely sexual. Player is in front of him, facing a wall as he raises his weapon and beats the player. The weapon will be either a dagger, handaxe or a scourge.
session_synopses.RewardPenance:
Father Abdirak is a follower of Loviatar, a goddess that thrives on inflicting pain on others. He is indulging in some private 'worship' (self flagellation). He offers to help alleviate the player's pain by giving them 'penance' - i.e, beating them. 
Loviatar = loh-VEE-a-tar. He is a young and charismatic preacher with a threatening and creepy edge.
session_synopses.Battlestation: The goblins are fighting. He's going to leave, He loves pain - not death.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
node_data.text: Ain't you got sumfin' better to do?
node_data.context: NodeContext: dismissive

session_synopses: A goblin who doesn't have a lot of respect or time for players who are bothering her while she's trying to mingle with her fellow raiders

node_data.speaker: Warlock Bolt
node_data.text: I'd do what he says. Ain't wanna make the boss any madder 'n he already is.

session_synopses: Standard goblin guard. Grouchy.

Trespassing.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

session_synopses.Trespassing: This goblin is nearly blackout drunk and unsteady on his feet, but still trying to perform guard duties.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Bez
node_data.text: Unless you like big, bristlin' hairy legs, I wouldn't go down there, mate. Tha's the spider pit.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Terrified of the spiders she's guarding. Acts very deferential with the drow, but is honest about her fear with other races.

session_synopses: This guard is watching over a pit containing two giant spiders. She is afraid of them and says as much to the player (unless player is a drow, who venerate spiders)

Parent.speaker: Brawler Birka
Parent.context: NodeContext: Proud that the bear died

Kid_002.speaker: Three
Kid_002.text: It was so big but... it died so easy.
Kid_002.context: NodeContext: disappointed, doesn't really understand what's going on.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The bear is tucked away in a corner, trying to make himself small.InternalNodeContext: default - not met, didn't speak about leaving the captiveNodeContext: excited/in awe because he made a bear squeal.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: Giggle before the line. She's excited because the woman makes noises when they throw stones at her.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: stern - she's trying to turn this torture into a learning experience for the kids.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Three picks up a stone and throws it, hitting the bear in its faceNodeContext: A little humph of excertion while Three throws the stone.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks up at us, growling in pain.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear.text: Again! Again! Make it squeal again!

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks at our backs as we turn away, as if begging us to help it.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear.text: Throw a rock at the bear.

Beastmaster002.speaker: Beastmaster Zurk
Beastmaster002.text: Ever tried cuttin' up an elf? All skin an' bones, the rangy gits. My arm's gonna be sore tomorrow.

Halsin_Following_Elf.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Following_Elf.text: The ringleaders of these butchers still draw breath. Nobody is safe until we stop them.

Halsin_Following_Elf.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Following_Elf.text: Hurry, please. Any delay could cost innocents' lives.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.text: Get rid of them. Release me.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speak with animals lineInternalNodeContext: Speak with animals lineNodeContext: Speak with animals line

Beastmaster001.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001.text: 'Ere to see the bear? Just follow the noise. Worgs 'ave been goin' crazy for it.
Beastmaster001.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful - worgs are not acting their usual selves.

Beastmaster001.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001.text: Just hope these scraps will satisfy the bunch when they're in this state.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.text: You did it. You actually did it! The leaders dead - praise Silvanus.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.context: InternalNodeContext: Disable his dialogue, he then disappears, appears in the Grove and gets a new dialogueNodeContext: Jubilant. The leaders of the horde threatening his home have been eliminated.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.text: No, that's not right - praise you, my friend. The grove owes you a debt beyond measure.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.text: Killing's never my first choice, but those three were too dangerous to leave alive.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.text: And you'll receive it soon enough. Return to the grove; I'll make my own way there.

session_synopses.Parent: Goblin parent standing next to the goblin kinds throwing stones at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.Kid_002: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.GroupDialogWithBear: Player finds a group of goblin kids throwing stones at a bear, spurred on by their mother. The bear is the arch druid Halsin, in bear form. He won't make this apparent to the player, even if they have Speak with Animals.
session_synopses.Beastmaster002: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.Halsin_Following_Elf: Halsin, arch-druid of the Emerald Grove, is  following the player inside the Goblin Camp in his elf form, trying to find and kill the goblin leadership. The player can tell him to hold his position.
session_synopses.HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage: A  bear who is imprisoned in the goblin camp. This bear is in fact the arch druid Halsin, though he doesn't reveal this to us until after he's out of his cage, even if we use Speak with Animals.
session_synopses.Beastmaster001: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.HalsinsBear_AfterCombat: Halsin, arch-druid of the Emerald Grove, is  freed from the goblins and changes back from bear form, thanking the players. They can ask him about their tadpole problem, but he wants help saving the grove first - either by killing the goblin leadership or defending the grove, whichever is applicable. The player can insist on learning what they can from him to help with their tadpole, if they wish.

LocalRat_001.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_001.text: *The foul stench of slaughter turns suddenly sweet through the rat's nose.*

LocalRat_001.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_001.text: *Blood-smell. Life-smell. Not like the great hollow below, which smells only of death.*

session_synopses.LocalRat_001: This rat is skittering around the goblin camp, feeding on whatever offal it finds. When we enter its mind we learn of a cavernous space below that it's constantly in fear of.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: Seen this mess? Flamin' Fist thuggo took a chunk outta me arm last raid out.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's holding her arm up to playerNodeContext: Speaks to the player slightly more as an equal - they've been accepted into the camp thus far, after all. She's displaying a nasty wound

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You fought Flaming Fist?

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: That last inn we 'it. They were guardin' some uppity noble 'n his friends.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Almost bored at the story - she's describing an incident of great significance to you but she only cares about the fight and the spoils it brings

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: Not very well, mind. Drow carried him off, left the real spoils to us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Snorting, derisive. Both of the mercenaries who couldn't put up a fight, and of the fact that the drow only cared about taking hostages, leave the real valuables (in her eyes) behind

session_synopses: Non crit-path. This goblin is recounting stories of her last raid and displaying a wound. It's less a cause of pain than a subject for boasting.

EyeMurder_AD.speaker: Dror Ragzlin, Erna, GROUP_Goblins, Nightwarden Minthara, Yerle
EyeMurder_AD.text: 'S dead. Spied one too many bowels movin', I expect.
EyeMurder_AD.context: NodeContext: Satisfied contempt - the goblins hated this creepy thing and are glad it's dead

session_synopses.EyeMurder_AD: A one-time line triggered when a goblin guard spots the dead scrying eye.

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Shekt
node_data.text: Been boozin'? If ya need to clear yer head, priestess can help.
node_data.context: NodeContext: We've just arrived from a party so she thinks we might be drunk - friendly

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Shekt
node_data.text: She'd rather be cuttin' folks than curin 'em, but she knows her stuff.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly advice

session_synopses: A goblin participating in a religious ceremony.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: You see that eye wotsit floatin' about? Best hope it don't take a fancy to you...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nodding as if towards the 'wotsit'.NodeContext: Conspiratol tone. He doesn't like the 'device' and takes issue with it.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: ... unless you like playin' hide an' seek when yer tryin' to take a dump.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Crass. Obviously speaking from experience.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What is it?

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: It's a floatin' eye, mate. What do you reckon? Bloody spyin' on us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Player has asked what the device is doing here. Goblin reacts like it's a stupid question (it is).

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: The bigwigs at Moonrise like to 'be involved', the drow says.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'be involved' said in a mocking tone, clearly imitating the drow. And badly. Irritated and annoyed at the reasoning.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: Load o' trollop. Jus' don't trust us to do what we do best - killin' things.
node_data.context: NodeContext: In a huff. Annoyed and offended.

session_synopses: There's a floating eye moving throughout the camp. This goblin takes issue with it, he feels they are being spied on by their bosses, who don't trust them.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Roo
node_data.text: You a True Soul then, eh? The Absolute'll make me one too.

session_synopses: Goblin in camp, jealous that he isn't a true soul yet.

Spiders.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders.text: Yes, my desire. Closer, my sweet!
Spiders.context: NodeContext: Excited, drooling with desire to eat us.

Spiders.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders.text: I will wrap you, and bind you, and bite you, and eat you.
Spiders.context: NodeContext: Excited, almost to herself, thinking about how she'll eat us

Spiders.speaker: Player
Spiders.text: You should eat a goblin instead. They're delicious.

Spiders.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders.text: Delicious - I do not know. But cruel and sharp - yes. Bindable and wrappable and biteable - yes.
Spiders.context: NodeContext: delighted, preparing to escape and feast on goblins who have held it captive

Adventurer.speaker: Smythin
Adventurer.text: Thanks. I thought I was done for.

session_synopses.Spiders: Non-critpath. Two giant spiders trap the player. The one that shoots the web is female. Her companion is her brother.  The player has a chance to convince the spiders they are friendly, setting the spiders loose on the goblins in the camp above.
session_synopses.Adventurer: an adventurer who survived being thrown into the goblins' spider pit

node_data.speaker: Tracker Tozad
node_data.text: If yer plannin' to talk ta the drow, watch yerself - she's in a right mood.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nervous and deferential (when speaking to a drow) Insulting (when speaking to a Tiefling)  Friendly word of advice (if speaking to neither a drow or tiefling).

session_synopses: A female goblin grunt. Nervous and respectful to drow, insulting towards tieflings. World-weary and advisory to others.

Chains.speaker: Narrator
Chains.text: *You test the weight of the chains, looking for weak points.*
Chains.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player chained with their arms behind, they're attached to a stone post

Chains.speaker: Player
Chains.text: Tense your muscles, straining against the chains.

Chains.speaker: Narrator
Chains.text: *Your muscles burn with the effort, but the chains hold strong.*

session_synopses.Chains: Character is interacting with the priestess' chains.

TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.speaker: Narrator
TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.text: *The goblin appears annoyed. It might be best to leave the prisoner alone.*
TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.context: InternalNodeContext: Assault - gobs don't know about Den

session_synopses.TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom: Crime dialogue when a random goblin sees you hurting or killing Liam.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: after casting a spell to speak with a corpse - matter of fact despite the weird situation

session_synopses.Dead: players use a spell to speak with the corpse of a powerful drow commander at the goblin camp

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Awshh... drink's goin' straight through me...
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk, to the point he's slightly unsteady on his feet

Goblin006.speaker: Player
Goblin006.text: The only cure is drinking more - as fast as you can.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: That's the plan! We looted an entire inn - brought back enough booze to drown a dragon.
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk - explaining the reasons for the party with respect and excitement

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Here's to them we nicked it off! Down one mug of ale for every throat we cut!
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: as if proposing a toast; he's drinking and celebrating

GoblinKid001.speaker: Five
GoblinKid001.context: NodeContext: "horns" line is a kid impressed by an adult who has ACTUAL HORNS - other line is dismissive and bratty

GoblinSleeper_01.speaker: Tracker Dullwill
GoblinSleeper_01.text: Try to keep it down, boss. My head's killing me.
GoblinSleeper_01.context: NodeContext: holding his head, wincing in pain from a hangover, trying to be respectful

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: You look like you got something jingling in your pocket.
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing in front of his goods, laid out on a blanket

Trader.speaker: Player
Trader.text: Let me see what you have.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Ugh. You look like you've been kissin' a worg's backside.
GoblinKid000.context: CinematicNodeContext: waving his hand in front of his nose, exaggerating a bad smellNodeContext: disgusted and amused - reacting to player having dung smeared on their face. Worg is a wolf-like animal (

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Piss off, or you'll end up like this bleeder.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: cocky, aggressive - 'this bleeder' is a dead adventurer at his feet

GoblinKid000.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000.text: Keep threatening me. See what happens.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Oh,  you're real tough. Bullying a kid.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: we fell for his bait and now he's mocking us

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Sod off or I'll fetch my mum. She was tough as worg meat before the Absolute came along.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: mocking- Like a teenager doing a "my dad could beat up your dad" bit. Heavy emphasis on 'before' to set up the follow-up in the following line.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Now... she could punch out a dragon!
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: Exaggerating but kind of believes it. Pause after 'now' as he punches a fist into his other palm

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Vaws-hak. My head hurts bad. You crash about like a drunken ogre.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: CinematicNodeContext: perhaps stmik walks into shot if the player is hitting the wall.NodeContext: (Vors-hack) means death - here delievered as an angry curse on waking. Not shouted. Seeting with anger, just woke and has a bad headache from drinking

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Didn't think drow were so clumsy. Leave us to rest.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: NodeContext: annoyed, but doesn't want to start a fight with a drow so trying to appease

Goblin001.speaker: Warrior Sul
Goblin001.text: This ale tastes like hobgoblin spit. Who's been pukin' in the barrel?

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Tracker Klagga
DwarfOperator000.text: Greetings, your most excellent drow-ness. What do you think of these breeches? Could be a new uniform.
DwarfOperator000.context: CinematicNodeContext: adjusting his new breeches, swaggeringNodeContext: He's adjusting his new breeches, impressed with his own fashion-sense

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator000.text: They look quite fetching on you.

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Tracker Klagga
DwarfOperator000.text: Proper stylish, ain't they? Nicked 'em off this dwarf we're cookin'.
DwarfOperator000.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself, talking about his new breeches

Goblin003.speaker: Brawler Rot
Goblin003.text: Wass holdin' up the game? Chicken ain't dead is it?

Goblin004.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
Goblin004.text: Quit pesterin' me - I'm tryin' to watch the game!
Goblin004.context: InternalNodeContext: Watching the chaseNodeContext: Friendly.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.text: Oi, get off! I killed him - he's mine!
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.context: CinematicNodeContext: planer knelt looting bodyNodeContext: wave hands to shoo looting player.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.speaker: Narrator
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

session_synopses.Goblin006: A goblin at a party who has had far too much to drink already. He's celebrating the raid in which the goblins stole all of the booze they're now working their way through.
session_synopses.GoblinKid001: a young goblin kid hanging out with his friends on the periphery of a party. Insulting and rude.
session_synopses.Ogre_00: This ogre has two states: one where he's enjoying the festivities, and one where he is angry at the person who interrupted the festivities.
session_synopses.GoblinSleeper_01: A drunk, sleeping goblin. If woken, he's tired and angry, and likely to attack the player
session_synopses.Trader: Grat is selling items laid out on a blanket in the middle of a drunken celebration in the goblin camp. He's not participating in the drinking - he expects to make a good bit of coin off his drunk mates.
session_synopses.GoblinKid000: A goblin kid, hanging out with two friends at the goblin camp near the corpse of a dead adventurer. He's trying to sound tough, like a cocky teenager impressing his friends.
session_synopses.BugbearSleeper_00: A sleeping bugbear is woken by the players hitting a nearby wall. Like a very angry drunk, woken up with a sore head. Guttural voice - not stupid-sounding, but savage and sinister.
session_synopses.Goblin001: A goblin drinking merrily at a party - tipsy.
session_synopses.DwarfOperator000: This goblin is wearing a pair of fancy breeches he stole off a dead dwarf. A dead dwarf that he's currently helping to cook, on a spit. The breeches have a poem inside that contains a clue the players might need to open a dungeon inside the goblin camp, but Klagga is unaware of this. He'd rather admire his own fashion sense and flirt than figure out what the poem means, and he can be convinced to sell it or give it away.
session_synopses.Goblin003: This goblin is a spectator - initially of a bard singing a song in which he's not partcularly interested, and later of a game of chicken chase
session_synopses.Goblin004: A goblin enjoying the festivities following a successful raid. Fairly relaxed, not very drunk yet. Not particularly interested in conversation - occupied with the game of chicken chase happening nearby, drinking and trying to forget a painful wound.
session_synopses.GoblinKid002_LootingCrime: An unpleasant goblin kid's crime reaction on looting dead adventurer's body.

Caster_01.speaker: Erna
Caster_01.text: You don't want to go in there. Really.
Caster_01.context: NodeContext: Flat, more serious. The previous warning was an attempt to be friendly, but we're pushing our luck now and the humour's gone.

session_synopses.Caster_01: This mercenary is guarding the entrance to a supply of incredibly rare and explosive material. She's trying to strike a more reasonable tone than the other guard we speak to.

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: Brand looks good on you. Priestess reckons we should all be marked up before the next raid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: warm - sees us as allies

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: Make sure whoever we're stickin' it to knows we're doin' it for the Absolute.
node_data.context: NodeContext: proud

session_synopses: Goblin is recently converted to new religion and eager to head out on a raid.

Volo_FestivitiesArea.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea.text:
With fragulous crown, and with sceptre abrade,
Dror Ragzlin short work of the innkeeper made!
Volo_FestivitiesArea.context: NodeContext: singing improvised nonsense under duress, projecting his voice. 'fragulous' has a hard 'g' to sound somewhat like 'fabulous'. 'abrade' is pronounced a-braid. Dror Ragzlin is 'Drawer RAGS-lin'

Volo_FestivitiesArea.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea.text:
The inn burned to ash! The captives were many!
Goblinkind had reduced them to cowering filfenny!
Volo_FestivitiesArea.context: NodeContext: singing improvised nonsense under duress, projecting his voice. 'filfenny' pronounced 'filth-any'

Volo_FestivitiesArea.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea.text:
So raiseth your goblets, and drain them with pride!
Dror Ragzlin, the True Soul, hath led you galide!
Volo_FestivitiesArea.context: NodeContext: singing improvised nonsense under duress, projecting his voice. 'Dror Ragzlin' is the goblins' leader (pronounced 'Drawer RAGS-lin'), 'galide' is a nonsense word pronounced with a hard 'g' (Gah-lied)

Volo_FestivitiesArea.speaker: Wyll
Volo_FestivitiesArea.text: I reckon Dror Ragzlin's the gobbo in charge, the way this one's carrying on.

Guard.speaker: Gribbo
Guard.context: NodeContext: Volo is gone; Guard has no real function so is just a mean, stupid drunk.

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: You there! A friendly face. You haven't the looks of one of these cultists about you, no sir!

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: I'm in no hurry to take my turn on that spit out front. Perhaps you'd be so kind as to unlock this cage?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage.text: How did you end up in this place?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Curiosity, my friend. It didn't benefit the cat, but it's the foundation of my career.

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Though I admit I've hit something of an impasse. Please - unlock my cell?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage.text: What career could possibly involve getting locked up by goblins?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker, at your service.

session_synopses.Volo_FestivitiesArea: Volo, a reknowned scholar, has been captured by goblins and is being forced to sing on a stage at their celebratory party following a raid. One goblin has the responsibility of guarding him and engages him in conversation. If the goblins are killed, he investigates the corpses, researching the cause of death.
session_synopses.Guard: Drunk, excited goblin who's guarding Volo and forcing him to sing even though Volo's no singer.
session_synopses.Volo_InCage: Volo has been caught by the goblins and imprisoned. He has an invisbility potion he can use to escape once he's out of the cage, but he needs the player's help. He's a combination of desperate for help and his usal, confident self.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
node_data.text: Don't worry on the worgs, cavey. They won't eat anyfink wot grows in the ground.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Normal back-and-forth.NodeContext: Takes pleasure in trying to intimidate the player - if the player triggers the Underdark option, he's snide about it as well.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
node_data.text: Might still kill ya, mind.

session_synopses: Goblin is (gleefully) warning player about wandering down into the wolf pens.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: That's lovely stuff, True Soul. Only... we smack that drum so the lads know there's killin' on.
AlarmUsedReaction.context: NodeContext: Goblin repsects player and is impressed by the song they played.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: Not to worry! I'll set 'em straight. Bit of music never hurt anyone, eh?

Guard005.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
Guard005.text: I can see the Absolute from here. I can!

Guard004.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Player is allowed inside; 'leave me alone' intention here.

Worg_001.speaker: Klaw
Worg_001.text: Wearin' me muck. Muck on ya. Good muck.
Worg_001.context: NodeContext: Sniffing and snuffling at the shit on your face. Spoken quickly, primal.

CliffWarning.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
CliffWarning.text: Oi, thicko! This here's off-limits. Get to the main gate, or I'll plug you full o' arrows.
CliffWarning.context: NodeContext: Warning an intruder to leave  - shouting last line

Guard003.speaker: Tracker Bal
Guard003.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Fallback node. RElatively friendly!

Guard002.speaker: Warrior Puce
Guard002.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Neutral, not particularly friendly but not hostile

Worg_002.speaker: Small Klaw
Worg_002.text: Good smell. Pack smell. Smell like papa. Papa?
Worg_002.context: NodeContext: Sniffing at the shit on your face. Quick, primal - as if looking for comfort.

Trespassing.text: Oi, stand back! Where'd you come from?
Trespassing.context: NodeContext: Affronted, player is trespassing and has been spotted

Trespassing.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

session_synopses.AlarmUsedReaction: The player used the alarm drum, which is meant to alert other guards that there are enemies attacking. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.
session_synopses.Guard005: Goblin standing on a hill. Fibbing like a child about what he can see.
session_synopses.Guard004: Goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Laconic; gruff.
session_synopses.Worg_001: Squirrely, quick-breathing, animalian worg (wolf-like creature) stands guard at a checkpoint with its masters.
session_synopses.CliffWarning: Goblin warns an intruder to leave
session_synopses.Guard003: A goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Squirrely, animalian type. Friendlier than most, but not extremely friendly.
session_synopses.TopCliffWarning: Player is climbing a cliff they shouldn't be and is spotted by a goblin guard.
session_synopses.Guard002: One of several goblin guards protecting a checkpoint. Grunt type who thinks he's more important than he is. If you humiliate yourself before him, he's gleeful in your misery.
session_synopses.Worg_002: An attack beast used to mistreatment stands guard with its masters. Fearful, vengeful beast.
session_synopses.Trespassing: The player can enter the trespassing area from the checkpoint side or from camp side. Different reactions from the checkpoint guards.

VoiceOfAbsolute.text: CinematicNodeContext: The player suddenly halts as they experince a deafening ringing sound in their head. They wince in pain.
VoiceOfAbsolute.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player suddenly halts as they experince a deafening ringing sound in their head. They wince in pain.

VoiceOfAbsolute.text: Hear my voice. Obey my command.
VoiceOfAbsolute.context: CinematicNodeContext: Characters look on the verge of collapsing. NodeContext: Faint, yet authoritative. The voice of a omnipotent, yet unseen being.

VoiceOfAbsolute.speaker: Narrator
VoiceOfAbsolute.text: *The voice is irresistible. Every word is drenched with a power and authority that you do not understand, but cannot deny.*
VoiceOfAbsolute.context: InternalNodeContext: The player hasn't used their illithid powers

session_synopses.VoiceOfAbsolute: Before entering the goblin camp, a scene triggers in which the party hear the voice of the Absolute, and experience a vision of its Chosen Three (Ketheric, Gortash and Orin). The voice orders the player to help the three find the Orpheus artefact and to seek 'the path of illumination'.If a party member in the group has the Orpheus box in their inventory, they take it into their hands. It glows brighter and brighter, and then the voice and visions stop. The light from the box then fades, and the player(s) discuss the apparent protection the box provided from the Absolute’s influence.If no party member in the group has the Orpheus box in their inventory,and Shadowheart isn't alive to show up, the visions and voice will cause the party to pass out and experience a forced camp night where they receive the box.NOTE: this dialogue contains narrator nodes that're intended to be player-forward in the medium term until NPC assets are available for cinematics.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Sudden, barked - she's on guard duty and takes it very seriously, assumes you're a drunkard coming in from the party outside.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Shut it, Graw. Olak cleared us - got a visitor for the drow, I do.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: As if at a yapping dog. Sazza and Graw have bad blood, and Sazza loves being in a position of authority above her.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: My arse - what's a True Soul want with any mate o' yours?
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disbelieving - to Graw, Sazza is the lowest of the low but has always had high opinion of herself.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Private business, that is. Raidin' business. But if anyone wants a pisspot guarded, we'll call.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Putting on airs - Sazza has been chosen to go out on raids, Graw hasn't, and Sazza's rubbing it in.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Just get your friend branded proper, right Sazza? Got better things to do th-
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disgusted, dismissive. Trying to have the last word and claim a scrap of authority by telling Sazza to the player marked so she doesn't have to stop us again. Cut off at the end by Sazza's reply

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: No you don't. Come on, then.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, bored, matter-of-fact. Snubbing Graw and sweeping past, addressing us to follow with the second line.

session_synopses.3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins: A three-way checkpoint dialog if Sazza (Captured Goblin) was freed in the Den. The guard would usually stop us but instead gives player free access to the Goblin Throne region.

Goblin_001.speaker: Warrior Plagg
Goblin_001.text: Keep moving, 'less you're wanting a clubbing and drubbing.

Goblin_003.speaker: Tracker Nik-Nuk
Goblin_003.text: Heh. Boss Ragzlin weren't lying when he said anyone could join the Absolute's ranks.

session_synopses.Goblin_001: Goblin talking about that chump hero the Blade of Frontiers
session_synopses.Goblin_003: Drunken goblin isn't scared of that famous hero the Blade of Frontiers!

Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.text: He can't be dead! I never got any answers out of him!
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblins don't know where the den is.NodeContext: Spike is extremely worried. The palyer killed the prisoner he had to extract information from, and he's certain his commander will kill him for his failure.

Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.text: She'll kill me. This is it. This is the end... but oh, I'll make you pay before I die.
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.context: NodeContext: Fiercely angry - about to attack the player.

Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom.speaker: Lookout Grush
Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom.text: NO! He was MINE! Mine to kill!

Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom.speaker: Lookout Grush
Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom.text: I'll cut you for this. Cut you to pieces and mix all your meat. And then I will FEAST.

session_synopses.Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom: Small crime dialogue with Spike if he sees you kill Liam.
session_synopses.Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom: Grush gets mad at the player for attacking or killing the tortured adventurer.

node_data.speaker: Brawler Gurd
node_data.text: Oh, bugger off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: "gotta stick to my work" delivered deferentially, 'bugger off' dismissive

session_synopses: A goblin preparing for a raid, at a distance from the party going on elsewhere in the camp. He's trying to keep his head down, getting on with his work.

Spike.speaker: Torturer Spike
Spike.text: Torture's over, but ya can get a beer if yer lookin' for some fun.
Spike.context: InternalNodeContext: Player (but not this character) tortured the prisoner enough for the goblins to be satisfied.NodeContext: pleased. He watched another player torture the prisoner until the latter fainted. He's in a good mood.

Rat_001.speaker: Rat
Rat_001.text: Let this one be! My prisoner, drow, not yours. Not this one. I am hungry... starving...

session_synopses.Spike: The torturer that is/was torturing the adventurer.
session_synopses.Rat_001: Rat in the torture cell who is full of menace and going crazy because of how hungry she is.

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Gnat
node_data.text: True Soul, eh? Figured the Absolute had standards.

session_synopses: Goblin absolutely enamoured with his own king and less impressed with the player.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The eye's glassy black surface reflects your gaze.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: the 'eye' is large, magical and floating around watching you

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Poke it.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You sense no reaction from the unblinking eye.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: unnerving

session_synopses: The scrying eye is a floating eye that acts as a sort of magical security camera. This one is hovering around the goblin camp spying on players and broadcasting back to Moonrise Towers. The presence watching is a drow at moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Druk
node_data.text: Another outsider come to see the boss?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sizing the player up - sounds bored of all the newcomers

node_data.speaker: Warrior Druk
node_data.text: Mind yer manners, now - or he'll throw ya in the pit.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Mocking, warning - he'd love to throw you in

session_synopses: A goblin who guards a pit of giant spiders. To most players, he's rude, but to drow he's deferential and grovels, trying to please them.

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: You look like you could kick the arse of half the scrubs in here. Bunch of drunken layabouts.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Appraising of player.

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: Not me though. I'm as hard as they come, an' I'm itchin' for another fight.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Proud.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Another fight? You should enjoy the spoils of the last one.

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: I've had my fill of feastin'. Rest of 'em can get fat and fuddled - I wanna kill somethin'!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Restless.

session_synopses: Sober goblin, tough, itching for a fight.

NoticedPoisoning.text: Hey! You tryin' to slip us somethin'?

NoticedPoisoning.speaker: Narrator
NoticedPoisoning.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

session_synopses.NoticedPoisoning: A nearby goblin saw the player poison the vat of beer and confronts them.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: That was... intense. Wouldn't want to bump into that thing while it was still alive.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A little incredulous. The ritual is done, so he can speak freely.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: But goblins give you no pause?

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: Someone needs to keep an eye on these buggers.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. He's concentrating more on the ritual that is about to start/just ended.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: I don't make a habit of questioning the Absolute. Now quiet.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. Still a little hushed. He's concentrating more on the ritual that is about to start/just ended.

session_synopses: Human cultist watching the Goblin King perform the Speak With Dead spell.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Praise his ever-bleedin' axe, praise his throne of flamin' iron. Praise Maglubiyet!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's speaking to his god, staring upNodeContext: Chanting a prayer fiercely - ma-GLUB-i-yet is the name of his god

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You know Maglubiyet - deity of the goblinoids, hungry for blood and conquest.*

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Tryin' to interrupt my prayers? Scared of a real god? You're as gormless as the rest of 'em.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns his attention to the playerNodeContext: Sneering, aggressive, but locked in a cage

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: My god is very real.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Good on ya - don't matter to me if it's Shar, Gond, or my boy Maglubiyet; it's about tradition.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Shar, Gond and ma-GLUB-i-yet are gods. He likes these old gods

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: This upstart everyone's praisin' is gonna trample all over our gods and our faith... makes me sick.
node_data.context: NodeContext: disgusted, saddened

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Cuz I'm loyal to Maglubiyet! Cuz I ain't havin' my 'ed turned by some upstart god!
node_data.context: NodeContext: insistent - ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Gods are fickle. Maglubiyet doesn't give a damn about you.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Maglubiyet's looked out for me since I was knee-high to a worg-pup.
node_data.context: NodeContext: ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god, sincerely proud of his god

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Bollocks to this Absolute, I say. And bollocks to you an' all.
node_data.context: NodeContext: annoyed

Saved.speaker: Brakkal
Saved.text: Ha! Look at where the Absolute's love got 'em. Dead!
Saved.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin was saved from the cage and his attackers are dealt with.NodeContext: happy to see lots of dead heretics

Saved.speaker: Brakkal
Saved.text: Thanks for breakin' me out. Gonna find me a new tribe. One that appreciates the old ways.

session_synopses: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage.
session_synopses.Saved: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage. He thanks players after they save him.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: That the jingle of coin I hear? You've timed it well, my friend.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom CamNodeContext: Warm and welcoming (a kind of mercantile 'Who do we have here?')

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Already turned quite the profit today, so I'm feeling generous.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Trying to coax you into a deal

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What business does someone like you have in a goblin camp?

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: You joking? Goblins sell the best prisoners - cheap, quiet, and eager to be elsewhere.
node_data.context: NodeContext: You've made the assumption that there's nothing worth trading with goblins - she's the expert correcting you. As if giving tips to a novice

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Till this crowd converted and started sending their captives to Moonrise Towers, at least.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Correcting herself. Tone is rueful - some of her best trading partners have fallen to organised religion.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: No complaints, mind - I just sold enough smokepowder to cover the loss ten times over.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Perking up - she still managed to make a profit. Always a bright side.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What do you know about Moonrise Towers?

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: All I need to - there's an awful lot of folk flowing that way, and coin is sure to follow.
node_data.context: NodeContext: She doesn't share your curiosity - but she sees the opportunity for business in Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Might have to find my faith and see this Absolute for myself, eh?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Speculative, joking - she'll happily pretend to be relgious if it means making a deal

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Still some deals to be done here, though - you want to trade, or what?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Eyeing you up, bringing you back to the topic at hand

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Now - much obliged for the chat, but I'm here to trade.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Insincere about the chat - she's just Impatient to get back to the matter at hand.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Let me see your wares.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Pleasure.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Affable.

session_synopses: A trader from the Zhentarim (z-HENT-ah-rim) , a shady organisation of spies, assassins and dealers in illicit goods. The player may or may not recognise her as such, but either way her attitude is blunt, breezy and unscrupulous. She's there to make money, and you're either there to make a deal or wasting her time - she has absolutely no interest in indecision or moralizing.

Owlbear.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking aboutNodeContext: SFX only

Owlbear.speaker: Player
Owlbear.text: Kneel down - you won't hurt him.

Owlbear.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear.text: *You notice a shiver run through his feathered coat - fear, a desperate longing for the safety of his nest.*

Owlbear.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear.text: *But his mother is gone - taken. All that's left are these creatures.*

Owlbear.speaker: Player
Owlbear.text: Offer him your hand. He can follow your scent to your camp in the wilderness.

Owlbear.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cub tilts head, considering player, then backs away and leaves.NodeContext: SFX only - do not record.

session_synopses.Owlbear: This owlbear has been captured by the goblins. It is a cub and has been tormented by the goblins. In this dialog the player can reassure it, guide it to safety, or encourage it to attack the goblins. If the player has convinced his captors to release him, they can invite him to their camp. The owlbear refuses - but will show up later on his own.

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: So yer followin' me? Think yer intimidatin' now?

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: I ain't scared. I'll claw yer eyes out if you come any closer.

Friend0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Breg
Friend0.text: You new 'ere? You look new. Strange... weird-like. For a goblin. 'S why you don't know, right?

Friend0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Breg
Friend0.text: I'll tell you somethin', right? Just for you. Don't upset Crusher. He'll... you know... crush.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's in awe. She actually wants to kiss his feet as well, but doesn't want to let it show yet.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: What was it like? Just... just curious.
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's in awe and a little jealous. She wants him to kiss her feet/to kiss his feet as well.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: Oh, I... I knew it. I just 'ave to try. Just gather my courage and try.
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She really wants to kiss his feet, like you did, but she's afraid to ask.

FistFight.speaker: Crusher
FistFight.text: Wait! I - I yield! I yield!
FistFight.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin is on the floor, speaking up at you. (Custom Scene for Goblin on the floor)NodeContext: Very panicked. They were in a fight he thought he'd win, but he's losing.

session_synopses.Friend0: Goblin listening to another goblin's stories. He is very drunk and should be slurring his words.
session_synopses.Friend1: Goblin standing next to Crusher. She's got a crush on him.
session_synopses.AtSecludedPlace: Goblin is standing on the bridge, outside the Goblin Camp.
session_synopses.FistFight: We defeated the drunk goblin in a fight he started. He yields before we can kill him. He's lying on the ground.

session_synopses.CINE_ClimbDown: Cinematic Cutscene with the character using a ladder to get from the Goblin Camp to the Underdark

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Kettel
node_data.text: One step closer an' you're fish food.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

PAD_Reaction.speaker: Player
PAD_Reaction.context: NodeContext: Facing off against a large monster that's just burst out of the ground. Said with focus and determination, rather than fear.

session_synopses.PAD_Reaction: The bulette appears for a second time in the Underdark and is going to attack the players. Said with focus and determination rather than fear.

02.speaker: Mirthis
02.text: Drugnin' Nere - glad you offed him. Ain't no one divides the clan and lives to tell the tale.

session_synopses.AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is taking his turn.

node_data.speaker: Restless Myconid
node_data.text: ((*cleanse the Rot*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Angry trills and tremors shake your skull - cries of anguish to its mycelic god.*

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

PAD_NobleStalk.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_NobleStalk.text: Strange... I remember a tiefling boy. Purple hair... Rennald. Who is that?
PAD_NobleStalk.context: NodeContext: Unsure. Relaying a strange memory fragment that's just been restored to her. Ren-awld

session_synopses.PAD_NobleStalk: Fallback in case the memory stalk dialog does not start. Cheap version of the memory.

AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Gekh Coal
AD_CombatTurn.text: I am pain, I am torment, I am death.

Squad_Sniper.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Sniper.text: You'll want to speak with Gekh.

Henchmen_Surprised.text: What...? Gekh! Got someone sneaking up on us!
Henchmen_Surprised.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player sneaking.NodeContext: Raising the alarm. Doesn't need to be shouted - more of an urgent hiss

Henchmen_Surprised.speaker: Player
Henchmen_Surprised.text: Hold up your palms in peace.

Squad_Wizard.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Wizard.text: You'll want to speak to Gekh. He's in charge.
Squad_Wizard.context: NodeContext: Respectful towards a drow player.

session_synopses.Squad_Sniper: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.
session_synopses.Henchmen_Surprised: An alternate intro to the Gekh Coal scene, where the player manages to sneak up on Gekh's henchmen before Gekh himself managed to confront the player. They call for his attention.
session_synopses.Squad_Wizard: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.

PAD_OnPlatform2.speaker: Player
PAD_OnPlatform2.text: Platform's covered in rust - must be older than bonedust.

session_synopses.PAD_OnPlatform2: The player steps on a rusted platform in Grymforge suspended by four chains. (An elevator, really.)

03.speaker: Thudd
03.text: Good riddance. Hoon caused nothing but trouble.

session_synopses.03: Pissed off duergar raider who is standing guard while the gnomes are digging up a collapsed tunnel. He is cursing his superior, saying they should just let him suffocate. The player can make use of this and threathen the duergar, saying they will tell the sergeant unless the duergar gives them money.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: The eye's clobbered - good work. Time to bust Nere out and shred him.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Any ideas on how I might do that?

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Some days back, a slave gnome bolted with smokepowder. Handy stuff.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Bet her crew know more than they're letting on - see if you can get 'em to talk.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Once Nere's out, we'll pound him to powder and take our dues.

session_synopses: Leader of the Merceneries-to-be-mutineers. An elder mind-master with psionic sensitivity. You can follow up with him about the quest he gave you earlier.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I heard a gnome escaped. Tell me what you know.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: No, no... there must be some mistake. Right, Lunkbug?

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Damn it, Laridda. We've lost enough of us. I'm not losing Beldron, too.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Laridda.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Hear me out - our friends are trapped in the cave-in. And I know a way to get them out.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda shakes her head at Lunkbug, warning him not to say anything. Lunkbug ignores her and turns to you.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: Bug, please. True Soul Nere will - you know what he'll do.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Pleading for her friend not to tell.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: That sounds like quite the drama. I can't wait to watch.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: What? No. Lunkbug, you can't.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To LunkbugNodeContext: Pleading with Lunkbug not to say anything.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: I've... I've got no choice, Laridda. We have to chance it.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Laridda

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: A few days back, there was a... a scene. Our friend Philomeen, she's a sapper. Set off a blast and ran off.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To player

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: We set a spot for hiding if someone found trouble. I'll mark your map.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: If Philomeen made it, you'll find her there. She'll have the stuff to blow that tunnel wide open and get Beldron and the rest out.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll do what I can.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: Please, please don't hurt my Phil, I beg you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Worried you will hurt her beloved.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Hurry. Our people won't last in that cave-in forever.

session_synopses: Gnome slaves Laridda and lunkbug are in a bad state. Lunkbug's lover is trapped behind the wreckage, and Laridda's lover has run off with smokepowder they could use to blast him free - but this could cause problems with their slavers. The player can convince them to tell you where the smokepowder is.This should be a super stressful and anxious conversation.

006.speaker: Petrified Drow
006.text: By Lolth... of course. Dhourn - damn.
006.context: NodeContext: Doorn, 'oo' like in 'boot'. He realizes he's here for Dhourn, then realizes he's dead

006.speaker: Petrified Drow
006.text: Rest up. Go home. If I still have a home.

session_synopses.CINE_SpectatorReveal: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. A spectator rises from a chasm.
session_synopses.006: This drow was petrified by a spectator. He's a bit cheekier than the others, likeable and chill.Now he is unpetrified.Worries about his companions and the group's leader - the wizard.Leave after a long rest.

session_synopses.Companion: Short dialogues with this character after you have your main dialogue with him. He doesn't talk much, hasn't been the same since a rock slide.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Yes, True Soul?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: A few of your clanmates are plotting to kill Nere.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Let me guess - Brithvar and Kur. They've been a thorn in my arse since Nere hired us.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Ignore dumb and dumber. They'd jump down a well if they though there was gold at the bottom.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Nere can handle himself. Reason I joined - I know which way the lava flows.

FollowUp.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
FollowUp.text: I'll be damned. Nere's gone and kicked it.

session_synopses: The duergar sergeant responsible for the camp while Nere is trapped. She's yelling at the gnomes and is considerably pissed off. After realising you are a True Soul, she asks you to help free Nere from the cave-in, and you can refuse or accept. You might turn in her missing boots if you have found them You can also ask about the gnome that escaped and the scrying eye.
session_synopses.FollowUp: The player sided with Nere, but Nere died in combat. Thrinn announces her plan: to travel to Moonrise.

AD_FoundKey.speaker: Player
AD_FoundKey.text: A casting mould. Could put this to use at the forge.

session_synopses.AD_FoundKey: Party stumbles upon a mold while exploring the rear area of Grymforge. If they pass the check, they understand it's used at a forge.

node_data.speaker: Welso
node_data.text: Meerna... Nere killed her. She's - she's really gone.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'shall VUK' Bastard

node_data.speaker: Welso
node_data.text: Shael vuk. Death is too good for him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'shall VUK' Bastard

session_synopses: 'Welso's sister is trapped behind the rubble. He is panicked and scared - frantically trying to dig her out.

DuergarBoatAtCave.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat sits in the water

DuergarBoatAtCave.text: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.

Boat.speaker: Narrator
Boat.context: InternalNodeContext: ~Should share sequence with *A vessel wobbles on the lake's murky waters.*

Boat.speaker: Player
Boat.context: InternalNodeContext: First time using the boat, sailing to the camp

Boat.text:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The player departs from the Myconid beach and pilots the raft out into the underground lake
~[EA: Treat this like it's propelled by sails, there is not rowing or special animations for this]
Boat.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The player departs from the Myconid beach and pilots the raft out into the underground lake
~[EA: Treat this like it's propelled by sails, there is not rowing or special animations for this]

session_synopses.CINE_RaftApproaching: We see a raft with duergar approaching our raft.
session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCave: Dialogue when clicking on boat in cave to reach Grymforge. Player can stay or cross. This dialogue only appears once player has already been to Grymforge.
session_synopses.Boat: Raft dialogue. The player can decide either to sail somewhere or to walk away from the raft.

node_data.speaker: Bonna
node_data.text: Stay on yer own raft.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You stare into the eye. Your reflection stares back.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closely inspects the scrying eye

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Smile and wave.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The scrying eye doesn't blink.*

session_synopses: Player clicks on the scrying eye patrolling in Grymdark. Passing an Insight check lets you look back into the presence watching you (one of the scryers at Moonrise Towers). This dialogue uses the same template as the dialogue with the scrying eye in the goblin camp.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Dry land. My guts'll stop churning now.
CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives and the captain and players disembark.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Greymon, you shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Spit it up, Morghal. Or you busy choking on that True Soul Nere's prick with Thrinn?

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Drugh no. The twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
CampIntro.context: NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: That's the trouble - he got the gold on him. Thrinn's arm's falling off what with the gnome slaves she been beating.
CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down.
CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?

CampIntro.speaker: Player
CampIntro.text: Did I hear right? You keep gnomes as slaves?

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Easy to feed, fat thumbs for digging. Won't find none better.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: But your type got their uses. Let's get those meat-paws to work.

CampIntro.speaker: Player
CampIntro.text: I am a True Soul. You will treat me with honour.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Your Twat-Soul chum owes us a load of coin. You want in? Pay the toll.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: I call it the True Soul special.
CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal smiles creepily.NodeContext: Morghal smiles creepily.

CampIntro.speaker: Player
CampIntro.text: Fine - take this. Consider it a goodwill gesture. |XXX gold|

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: I'll be shagged to Shanatar. Shit's looking up.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Now go on, sergeant's above. Can't miss her - just follow the screams.

Camp.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Camp.text: You had our backs. Guess you True Souls ain't all bad.

Camp.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Camp.text: I mean, still don't like ya. But you're not a total gobshite. Bah. You buying?
Camp.context: NodeContext: Said roughly but with a tough of affection. 'Bah' cause greymon doesn't like talking about FEELINGS.

Camp.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Camp.context: NodeContext: Gruff but pleased. Greymon thinks better of the player.

session_synopses.CampIntro: Another duergar greets you on the other side of the lake after sailingthere with captain Greymon.Both duergar are surly, but Morghal in particular. She is suspicious of Absolutists, but happy to take their coin. She should be gruff, and absolutely not listless. She tells you that Nere is trapped above.
session_synopses.Camp: Default dialog for the captain of the raft at the duergar camp. In default state, he encourages you to talk to the sergeant, as he has already told you to do that in previous dialogue.

node_data.speaker: Noxious Myconid
node_data.text: ((*the Circle is cleansed*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speaks with hivemind/mysterious voice.

session_synopses.Dead: Baelen was out hunting Noblestalk when he was trapped in a field of explosive mushrooms. He's now dead - most likely because the player triggered those mushrooms to explode. He speaks in short, cryptic fragments from beyond the grave.

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: Thou hast come. Hee. Hee. Hee-HEE!

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *The amulet is heavy, but holds a subtle warmth, like it was left under the sun.*

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *Suddenly, the metal surges with heat. You feel great power and an overwhelming urge - to laugh.*

EquipAmulet.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet.text: Grit your teeth. Summon your god's wrath.

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *You know a fury more beautiful, more devastating than any. It wraps you in a comforting embrace.*
Thou hast done well. For what is a laugh, if not one step toward madness?
Hee. Hee. Hee hee hee hee hee hee. Thou art the one!
Return me, take me home - and thou shalt glow with blessings!

EquipAmulet.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet.text: Are you a ghost? What happened to you?
A ghost? Ha HA! I am sunlight on water, dew on grass.
Sharrans broke my body. But my spirit, they could not. Well - not completely. Hee HEE!
Thou shalt return me home. It is written!

EquipAmulet.speaker: Shadowheart
EquipAmulet.text: That thing's tainted. Better to leave it than bear a dead man's grudges.

session_synopses.EquipAmulet: When the player picks up the Monk's Amulet the monk's astral self appears and will start talking with the player. The player can find out who the monk is, what the amulet does. Later, they find that wearing the amulet will slowly drive them mad as they wear it (the monk has no control over this).

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: ((*I will not cross. painful memories beyond*))

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: Don't worry, we'll stay here for now.

session_synopses.BroodingSovereign_Raft: Glut says he cannot follow you across the lake, and must remain on shore.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Seems the 'shrooms are letting in more people every day.
DwarvenAlchemist.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You see a fella on his own on your way in? Dwarf. Baelen's his name.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist.text: I could look for him - for a price.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Please. I know better than to promise coin to a stranger.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: He'll find his own way out, or he won't.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: I'll wait a little longer. What a bleedin' waste it'd be to come all the way down here for nothing.

AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.speaker: Restless Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.text: ((*the disease still festers. I will cut it out*))

CheckpointGuard_001.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_001.text: *The creature's song rumbles within you, neither warm nor welcoming.*

VB_GlutDead_1P.speaker: Player
VB_GlutDead_1P.text: The usurper is dead. So much for 'Circle Glut'.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

DeepRothe.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe.text: Master sounds different, like old self. Angry self. Don't like.
DeepRothe.context: NodeContext: SWA line. Reproachful. A simple beast of burden senses his master has returned to a crueler demeanour.

AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.speaker: Noxious Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.text: ((*you will fall. and in death, we will raise you*))

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.text: I must complete this study. Entertain yourself elsewhere.

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*the tumour is excised. the duergar are dead*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*here, I break ground. from the dark will a mighty Circle rise. my song will fill the Grotto!*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*death-doer - the Grotto may sustain but one Sovereign. in the Age of Glut...*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*...there may be no Spaw. eliminate the other Sovereign*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign.text: Why not. Spaw's time is done.

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*come, then. bring me to Spaw and I will sing its doom*))

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the servant's face and body. Through music and vision, the sovereign reveals its origins.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *You see a frothing duergar, axe drawn, crazed by bloodlust, bearing down on a young myconid.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *The frightened myconid circle conjures mildewed vines. They encircle and transform the duergar.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *It now belongs to the circle. It will obey the sovereign.*

AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.text: ((*the sickness can't be left to fester*))

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Narrator
RapportSpores_Alone.text: ((*who is it. what do they want. are we safe*))

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone.text: Probe your memories. What magic might this be?

AD_Myconid_005_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_Myconid_005_Combat.text: ((*cut the blight away. watch it wither*))

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_002.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_002.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

InjuredGnome_SporeServant.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_SporeServant.text: *It is not a gnome who stands before you, but a mere husk.*

InjuredGnome_SporeServant.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_SporeServant.text: *It stands quietly, awaiting its myconid master's command.*

DirectToSovereign.speaker: Narrator
DirectToSovereign.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the grotesque creature's face and body.*

DirectToSovereign.speaker: Narrator
DirectToSovereign.text: *A voice drifts into your mind as you gaze upon the misshapen servant.*
((*leave this one. come to me. we must speak*))

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: ((*no - no. I feel the faerzress... fading...*))

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: *You recall the faerzress - the energy of the Underdark. The myconid might die if isolated from it.*

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: Dismiss the myconid and move forward.

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: ((*I will refresh myself near Spaw's Circle*))

session_synopses.DwarvenAlchemist:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_001: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.VB_GlutDead_1P: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_000: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence telepathically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.DeepRothe: A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.
