session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.ServantHookHorror_01: You interact with a hook horror servant belonging to the myconids.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly.

 The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it.

The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars.

 Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign
. 
Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. 

This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace.

 As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_004: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.ServantDuergar1: Player tries speaking with an enthralled duergar. Duergar players get an option to go hostile afterwards.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.RapportSpores_Alone:
Non has met: Triggers if the player is alone when first hearing the myconid circle's collective voice.

Hasmet: Occurs second time, regardless of how mnay players are in party. Player hears a strange voice, and has a reaction to it. Second time: Tries to respond to it.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_003: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_005_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_002: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence teleapthically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.InjuredGnome_SporeServant: Player speaks with Thulla - the injured gnome, - after she dies from duergar poison and is resurrected by the myconids as a spore servant.
session_synopses.DirectToSovereign: If you speak to a myconid after the guards speak to you but you have not yet spoken to the sovereign, his voice will speak through them.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign_Leave: You try to leave the underdark with your myconid companion, and he's having none of it.

node_data.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
node_data.text: You ain't clan - you got no business here.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks the player up and down with distaste.NodeContext: Looks the player up and down with distaste.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standing guard. He is seated with the duergar elder most of the time.

session_synopses.BottomFairyRingActivationCinematic: Cinematic dialog. Shows the activation process for a Fairy Ring.Before the dialogue: the player approaches an active (has vfx) fariy mushroom ring. The dialogue starts. The camera shows the ring and the player (or only the ring) and then rotats and looks down, at another fairy mushroom ring which is inactive, it has no vfx. The VFX activates for the bottom ring, emphasizing activation. End of the cinematic.
session_synopses.Dead: Dead drow who tried to climb to the secret fairy rings near the Hag's lair. He was using his backpack to check the the ledges (mushrooms) that he was using to climb, but the platforms have a weight limit, which lead to his demise.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome.text: Tell Laridda I'm dead. It's the best way.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: He hid from the Hells' forces - but they still got to him.

session_synopses.HiddenGnome: Philomeen is ready to die for her cause. She has run from the duergar with explosives and when the player arrives, she assumes they are a true soul and would sooner blow herself up than let the player take her to Moonrise.If you reach the end of her dialogue, she'll leave once you get far enough away.
session_synopses.PAD: Players find the journal in the Panic Room after identifying the Merregon Masks. This belonged to a Dark Justiciar who hid from the orthon when it rampaged, and was trapped when rubble fell.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Incredible. Every rock, every jewel tells a story.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The most interesting secrets are alway lurking just under the surface.

session_synopses.PAD: Players can talk to Stonemason Kith to obtain some info on the city. The following VB is a reaction to the knowledge acquired in that dialog. For specifics, see UND_DuergarRebelMason_01.This will be anchored on the character who left the dialog but this is mostly reacting to an info dump, so all characters can be opinionated.

Rothe_001.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001.text: No more. No more pain, no more work. All must die!

Rothe_001.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001.text: No! Too much yelling, too much pain. All must die!

Rothe_001.speaker: Player
Rothe_001.text: Breathe. Focus. If you strike, your masters will destroy the herd.

Rothe_001.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001.text: All right. We will work. We will do as we're told. We will clear the way.

Guard_002.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002.text: Nicely handled. Those rothé old sweethearts of yours or something?
Guard_002.context: NodeContext: The player did well, but duergar are rarely the complimentary types.

Guard_002.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002.text: Pity I got to split you - that forge ain't for sharing.

Guard_002.speaker: Player
Guard_002.text: I calmed the rothé, and now you want me dead?

Guard_002.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002.text: You think we're letting you near that forge? You're as dumb as you are stupid.

Rothe_002.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002.text: Grey ones gone. Good. Will stay here, until it's safe to leave.
Rothe_002.context: NodeContext: Glad captors are gone - good riddance (the duergar could be dead or ordered to go elsewhere)

Rothe_002.speaker: Player
Rothe_002.text: How about breaking through that rubble for me?

Rothe_002.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002.text: For killing grey ones - yes. I will do this.

RotheDeadAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RotheDeadAttack.text: The hell's wrong with you? Drugnin' hoon!
RotheDeadAttack.context: NodeContext: Clan-sen: like it sounds. (Diuergar of another clan) Drugh = fuck. DROOG. (RHymes with hood, not food.)

RotheDeadAttack.speaker: Player
RotheDeadAttack.text: Don't get surly with me. Those beasts were out of control.

RotheDeadAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RotheDeadAttack.text: Shit-for-brains. All that adamantine within reach - and you done screwed me over!

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Well look here - Nere's killer in the flesh. Make yourself useful, grab a cane and whip these drugnin' beasts into shape.
Guard_001.context: NodeContext: Hoon = outsider. Dorn = friend. Urop (YUR-op) - slave.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: That rubble needs clearing, and my patience is hanging on by an arse whisker.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Shouldn't be trouble for a brute like you.

session_synopses.Rothe_001: Animal dialogue - a skittish beast of burden.A deep rothe that's being used by some duergar to clear rubble - only it smells death and is unwilling to work. The player can try to calm the beast (through Speak with Animals or Animal Handling) and encourage it to calm down and return to work, or to turn against the duergar. If the player fails to calm the rothe, it will turn on both them and the duergar.
session_synopses.Guard_002: One of the duergar guards near some deep rothe that're being used as hauling animals. Gruff and grim. Little patience and less empathy.Different reactions if:- animals are panicking;- animals are calm;- animals are dead (doesn't matter how);
session_synopses.Rothe_002: Panicky and bestial. A one-liner deep rothe speak with animals dialogue. It's being used by duergar to clear rocks, only it and another rothe have been unsettled by strange noises and stopped responding to their masters. It can be calmed so it can return to its work (the act of calming occurs when speaking to the othe rothe, whom this one takes its cues from).
session_synopses.RotheDeadAttack: Duergar attack you after you have angered and killed the rothe.
session_synopses.Guard_001: The taskmaster is another cruel duergar. He is whipping several pack animals to clear out some rubble, but his arm is tired and asks you to step in. You might discover they want the rubble cleared because a valuable forge can be found behind it. If you convince the beasts to break through, he attacks you because he doesn't want to share the wealth.

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: Thanks again for offing that drow. Only made it here 'cause of you. But I can't stop thinking about the rest of us...

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: ... stuck in Moonrise with a bunch of sadists. Poor bastards.

session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome foreman on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player. Mentions the other gnomes being kept at moonrise towers.

node_data.speaker: Hurk
node_data.text: Been a long day for all of us, so don't try nothin' funny.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well. You... did it!

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I shouldn't be surprised, considering our history. And yet...

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're free - go on.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Free. Yes.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Wavering.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Nothing good happens in the Underdark.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I don't know if you heard, but some of the Ironhand Gnomes - my friend Wulbren among them - have been taken prisoner in Moonrise Towers.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I know someone of your background would fit right in in that heart of horrors, but for others of us it's quite a frightening prospect.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: And so... to Moonrise Towers I go.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Resolute but actually pretty frightened.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Farewell, Barcus - I wish you luck with your search.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Won't be needing it, thank you!

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Good bye, my misery's favourite companion.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: And, erm, well... thank you.

session_synopses: If you saved Barcus from the windmill, you can meet him again in the underdark. He's been captured once again - this time by a band of duergar (who follow the Absolute, same as the goblins did previously). If you get rid of his captors, you can talk to him some more about his next steps. He's still keen on saving his friend, Wulbren.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Let me be. I've got to get Beldron out of there!

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Get Beldron out of there. Please.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I've got explosive powder. That should open the way.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Incredible news. Drop it near the cave-in and set it alight!

session_synopses: One-liner dialog in Ketheric City for a gnome working on the cave-in.

02.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02.text: If you aren't here to inspect the stonework, then get lost.

02.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02.text: And if you are... well, I doubt you've got anythin' useful to say.

session_synopses.02: Stoneworker who has no time for the player.

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: Be welcome in this house. I wait for your commands.
Automaton.context: NodeContext: The robot talks to a new person he hasn't talked to before while in peace mode. He bows.

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: Command as you see fit, my lord, my liege.

Automaton.speaker: Gale
Automaton.text: Don't get me wrong. I love poetry as much as the next wizard, but using it to command an automaton... seems a bit self-indulgent to me.
Automaton.context: NodeContext: Annoyed he didn't think of it

AD_GaleEntrance.speaker: Gale
AD_GaleEntrance.text: A wizard's tower is his sanctum, a private place for research and respite. But as this wizard's not home - I say we take a peek.
AD_GaleEntrance.context: NodeContext: At first solemn/reverential. Then delighted you're about to snoop around.

AD_GalePowerRestored.speaker: Gale
AD_GalePowerRestored.text: Ingenious use of the magic in the tower's floral core. Though not ingenius enough to outsmart Gale of Waterdeep.
AD_GalePowerRestored.context: NodeContext: His hypothesis proved correct. Respecting the ingenuity, but smug that he/the party was able to disable it

session_synopses.Automaton: This is an old robot guarding the top of a deserting tower. His master programmed him to speak in verse. He talks mostly in iambic pentameter (though sometimes in iambic hexameter) - think shakespearian verse.Translator node: this dialogue is linked to other poems in the game, and uses the same words. For more information, please read the 'Riddles and word puzzles of note' doc!
session_synopses.AD_GaleEntrance: Gale enters the Arcane Tower for the first time
session_synopses.AD_GalePowerRestored: The Arcane Tower has been powered again.
session_synopses.CINE_PowerCutscene: This is a pure cutscene cinematic dialog. After player activates the main generator in Arcane Tower by placing a Sussur Flower in it, there should be a camera flyover showing how all the tower teleport platforms activate, lights turn on, etc.This dialog can be easily triggered from console with    SetGlobalOsirisFlag UND_ArcaneTower_MainPowerOn

AD_NoAnswerFromGod.speaker: Narrator
AD_NoAnswerFromGod.text: *There is no answer from the presence.*

PAD_MagicGone.speaker: Player
PAD_MagicGone.text: Not much of a god after all. Whatever power he had, it died with those creatures.
PAD_MagicGone.context: NodeContext: BOO-al (not pronounced with extra emphasis, its just how the local fish people stylize it)

AD_GodDead.text: BOOOAL! Our Lord has been murdered!
AD_GodDead.context: NodeContext: Dismay, grief - their god has been killed

session_synopses.AD_NoAnswerFromGod: The player has clicked an altar from which a godly presence spoke previously.
session_synopses.PAD_MagicGone: This PAD triggers if/when the player kills all the Kuo-Toa and BOOOAL's magic disappates - the beat is 'he was no true god, his power came from those fish creatures'.
session_synopses.AD_GodDead: The Kuo-toa have found their god dead.

CaveIn.speaker: Skickpit
CaveIn.text: You've done more than I'd have hoped for. I should never have doubted.

session_synopses.CaveIn: Elevator gnome one-liner if you sent him to be with the others after the mutiny.

node_data.speaker: Mossy Myconid
node_data.text: ((*no peace*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speaks with hivemind/mysterious voice.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: 'Less you're here to kick some stiffs lake-side, I suggest you bugger off.
CorpseDisposers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera first pans acros the field of dead, then focuses on the duergar

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spit on the groundNodeContext: He spits on the ground, glowering.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Player
CorpseDisposers.text: Grim work. Did you kill them?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: Nah. Rockfall smashed 'em. Can't have them stinking up the place.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: The half that weren't crushed are digging the True Soul outta the wreckage.

session_synopses.CorpseDisposers: Two grouchy duergar, one a talker and one who somewhat mimics/ repeats what his partner says, are responsible for dumping dead gnome bodies into the lake. You can convince them to let you loot the bodies.

node_data.speaker: Restless Myconid
node_data.text: ((*we will find truth in dream*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A slender drow blade impales the stone before you, keeping a silent vigil.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise your goddess' rite - a warrior's sacrifice. Only blood, freely given, will honour the fallen.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: This feels holy. Consider what the appropriate ritual might be.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *This blade was a warrior's sacrifice to Eilistraee. Blood can only be honoured with blood.*

session_synopses: Player discovers an improvised shrine to a dead drow warrior. There's a helmet resting on a sword that's been rammed into a stone. You can take the helmet, but you'll need to think of another way to get the sword free.

session_synopses.AtPier_02: Gruff duergar guard standing watch ovre the entrance to Ketheric City.

PAD_InteractingWithOrb.speaker: Player
PAD_InteractingWithOrb.text: Something's off. Pure shadow - around me, inside me.

session_synopses.PAD_InteractingWithOrb: The character voicing feeling the presence of Shar when interacting with a Sharran artefact used to gain Darkvision.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: You're going up there? You've either got iron guts - or one of those Moonlanterns.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: One of Nere's magic lamps. You won't last without one.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: The death-dark's clogged the top-land, clear to Moonrise Towers. Only a Moonlantern dispels it.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Shadows - thick as a duerro's skull. Sucks the breath right out of your lungs.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Go on up, if you fancy. Me? I'd sooner take a swim in the Darklake.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Well I'll be ploughed sideways - we got a welcoming party.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives. Greymon on a boat.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: You shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Greymon. Projected from the boat. Morgha is talking to him from the shore.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Spit it out. Sergeant finally choked on True Soul Nere's prick?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Morghal, from the docking boat.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Drugh no. The Twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, his party and Greymon/Orgarth get off the boat.NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: That's the trouble - he's got the gold on him. Sergeant's arm is falling off with all the gnome slaves she's been beating.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down after line is spoken.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Greymon, looking at player

Checkpoint.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Seen her run with a barrel under her arm. Just a small one, but enough to blow the drow out.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Someone should grab it. Slaves are never gonna manage with pickaxes.

Mutineers.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
Mutineers.text: Can't go chasing 'maybes' - the sergeant's our ticket in.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Would you look at that, Kur. Someone's having a listen.
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar turns and notices player. Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Narrator
Mutineers.text: *A shiver runs through you. Your mind is awash in ancient resentments.*
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a mindmeld but a resonance due to duergar's psionic sensitivity.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: True Soul, no less. What do you think, Kur - should we take Nere's debt off them?
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Rothe_03.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_03.text: Grey ones make me work soon. Must sleep.
Rothe_03.context: NodeContext: Sighing. She knows there is little time to sleep before their next shift.

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *The rothé grunt softly at each other. Small lights flash about their heads in quick, erratic patterns.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Small lights flashing above rothe heads

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion.text: Still your body and quietly observe.

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *One beast notices you and dulls his lights, ending the conversation.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Elder Rothe dulls his lights

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: Hold up, jargh. Y-you ain't just walking away.
RebelsExtort.context: NodeContext: Aggressive in their words, but something hesitant. They're afraid of you, they just don't want to show it.

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: You got Brithvar chopped - and I still haven't seen a damned coin for my trouble.

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: You owe - what's the word? Restitution.  ([6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: That, or - or I add your corpse to the heap. Which is it?

RebelsExtort.speaker: Narrator
RebelsExtort.text: *You sense hesitation. The duergar talks tough, but fears you.*

RebelsExtort.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort.text: Don't be ridiculous. I don't have that kind of gold.

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: Then I'll have to see what price your head fetches. Zavagh!
RebelsExtort.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.speaker: Kirgrath
Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.text: Shit. Brithvar's kicked the tankard. Prick was older than dirt.

session_synopses.ElevatorWarningGnome: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby gnome  butts in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment.there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.
session_synopses.Mutineers: Two duergar consider how their fellow duergar have fallen for this new cult that showed up. You can inspire in them a mutiny. If you do, they'll join you when you free Nere (UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny).Brithvar is a Mind Master, a duergar with psionic skills. He wears a strange mask.
session_synopses.Rothe_03: The rothe is trying to sleep while her fellow rothe talk. She is tried from a long day's work and knows there is little time to sleep before her next shift.
session_synopses.RotheDiscussion: This occurs between two Rothe. The first is a younger Rothe who desires  freedom and a life without pain. The other Rothe is older and more stern. He has worked since the times of Ketheric.Player can speak with them or listen in on their conversation with an animal handling check.
session_synopses.RebelsExtort: In this dialogue, you have killed Nere without doing the duergar mutineers quest. As a result, they want you to pay for the trouble you've caused. You can give them money, persuade them to let you live, or attack.
session_synopses.Mutineers_GroupFollowUp: The mutinous duergar is dead, so another takes his place to tells you they are moving on

session_synopses.MyconidDrow_Dead: Xargrim is one of three drow wizards who was looking for the Adamantine Forge. Friends turned rivals, these wizards each compete to find the forge, trying to steal the knowledge of the others as they go. Xargrim ambushed one of his fellows and set a spectator on him, but the strain of the ritual killed him.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: So those mushrooms can raise the dead? That's... interesting.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Handy magic, that. Maybe it'll be of use to us.

session_synopses.PAD: Players can find a few NPCs that have been raised by the myconoid to work as their servants. The party comments on this through a VB.This can fire on any character, and since it is not a result of direct player actions, the replies can be fairly opinionated.Can take one or two speakers.

node_data.speaker: Drar
node_data.text: This ain't a show. Go make yourself useful or get lost.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standign guard, loyal to The Absolute.

FourWay.speaker: Narrator
FourWay.text: *These spiders aren't wild - they've been raised by local duergar and are fiercely loyal to them.*

FourWay.speaker: Player
FourWay.text: Try to discern the nature of their chatter.

FourWay.speaker: Narrator
FourWay.text: *They appear to be in conflict - the larger spider versus the other three.*

FourWay.speaker: Player
FourWay.text: Stand back and see how things play out.

session_synopses.FourWay: In this dialogue, Lur Xanta is trying to convince the other 3 to leave with her to join the cult of Lolth.Player can help her convince them, or fail to do so and they will attack Lur Xanta for being disloyal.This dialogue has 2 outcomes:AGGRO: Lur Jox (or another spider) attacks Lur Xanta, killing her in one shot. (via gameplay - not cine)PEACEFUL: Lur Xanta convinces the other 3 to follow her into the Underdark-- they are leaving to somewhere new.Lur Xanta is fantatical and somewhat learned. The other 3 are a bit more simple.
session_synopses.Spider02: Followup after the spiders have killed their sister Xanta for being disloyal.

node_data.speaker: Jerris
node_data.text: One wrong move, and you're goin' in the lake.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

node_data.speaker: Noxious Myconid
node_data.text: ((*smooth-flesh. you are like them*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Duergar faces appear before you, one by one, each twisted by zealous cruelty.*

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

NereHeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
NereHeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Nere's dead body.

NereHeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
NereHeadLoot.text: *The head breaks off cleanly from the drow's body.*
NereHeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Show player's face as they finish decapitation, stow knife. Raise head to inspect it.

session_synopses.NereHeadLoot: After the drow Nere dies, the players have the option to cut off his head if they are on a Myconid Revenge quest. If they fail the Strength check, the player makes a mess of it and the party gets splattered.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *Alcohol - an odd vice for duergar, prone to triggering ancestral memories of brutal illithid enslavement.*

session_synopses.001: One-liner for duergar thug. He tells you to leave after speaking previously. You get a passive skill check that may relate how alcohol can cause bad memories for duergar, and then ask about it.

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Dunnol
node_data.text: Get yourself set before that powder goes boom.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is shouting at the gnomes.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Looking into the hole, you see only darkness. It's impossible to tell how deep it goes by sight alone.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Hellooo?

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your call echoes as it plunges downward, before gradually fading away.*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: The call echoes down the hole.

node_data.speaker: Voice from the Deep Hole
node_data.text: *Growl.*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: This is the growl of an unseen creature deep down in the Underdark. Exactly what it is will remain a mystery, other than it sounds big, threatening and unappreciative of the player's noise-making.NodeContext: SFX only

session_synopses: A deep hole in the Underdark that you can click on and shout "Helloooooo" into, hearing an echo. Something growls from down below in response; if the player can speak with animals, you may get a disgruntled reply. The creature is unseen, but sounds large, aggressive and very unhappy at being disturbed.First speaker is added for ease of scripting. 2nd speaker is the creature.

PAD_FoundRune.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRune.text: This is a Harper rune. There must be a stockpile nearby.

PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.speaker: Player
PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.text: Must be in one of these chests.

session_synopses.PAD_FoundRune: Party discovers a strange marking. They may or may not recognise it as a Harper symbol.
session_synopses.PAD_RecogniseWatchword: The Sharran Inquisitor's diary documents the Harper Spy's interrogation. The spy is quoted reciting a Harper Watchword during the interrogation. Players that pass a History Check will recognise the watchword, and understand that the Light spell is required to bypass the spy's trap
session_synopses.PAD_KnowStashIsHidden: Note: this PAD follows directly from either RecogniseStashLocation or FoundRune. See Kevin V. with any questions, I know it is a bit weird.--------When the player recognises that the Harper rune in Ketheric City is marking a hidden stash, they make an Investigation check. On success, they realise that the Harpers would be smart enough not to leave their stash in plain sight - the goal of this hint is to deter the player from interacting with the mimics in the area and to instead look around for a hidden stash somewhere

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: *A faint voice echoes in your mind.*
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld: Nere is calling out to player from a distance

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: I sense you, True Soul... come to me, come to Nere... the poison spreads.
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: NodeContext: Voice goes in and out, as if the connection is weak

session_synopses.Mindmeld_LeavingRegion: When trying to leave Grymforge before freeing Nere, you get a mindmeld from Nere, warning that he will die if you leave. Nere is not physically present in scene - only his voice is heard.
session_synopses.Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue for True Soul Nere. He may tell you about the temple he was looking for as well as what is inside it.

Looted_Solo.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo.text: *As you look at the skeletons, you realise they are all clad in the same dark armour.*

Looted_Solo.speaker: Player
Looted_Solo.text: Bow down and inspect the corpses more closely.

Looted_Solo.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo.text: *You see nothing special - just torn and faded velvet tunics.*

session_synopses.Looted_Solo: Players find remains of Dark Justiciars in the Ketheric City and wonder what might have happened to them and what kind of armor are they wearing.

VB_BookDestroyed.speaker: Player
VB_BookDestroyed.text: Well done. The world's better off without it.

session_synopses.VB_BookDestroyed: Companion reaction to the player destroying the DangerousBook ('The Necromancy of Thay'). This book was clearly magical, whispering offers of dark power. You destroyed it by dropping it on the ground and blasting it with radiant damage. When you destroyed it, there were some spooky vfx. Most characters would see this as a good thing. Gale, Astarion wanted the book for themselves, however.

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *The tiefling's corpse stirs with the spell.*

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *You realise the tiefling's body has been torn open by huge hands.*

session_synopses.Corpse_Dead: The player can cast Speak with Dead on a tiefling the ogres tore open to feed on.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: Fezzerk does the talking here. Bother him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are rotating him around for their amusement.The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using the amulet of the Conquering God as a way to convince the goblins,  if they took it from the priests in the wilderness. GnomeGobllin2 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. He doesn't have much to say; either snarling threats or grovelling to those who intimidate him (drow, in this case).

PAD_NoticeShrine.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticeShrine.text: Over there - a shrine to Selûne. By Moonmaiden's grace.
PAD_NoticeShrine.context: NodeContext: Shar worshipper: notices the Selune shrine and makes a disdainful comment. Selune worshippers: notices the shrine and reacts with reverence.

PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.speaker: Player
PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.text: A prayer sheet. What's this symbol on it?

PAD_NoticeStashSeal.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticeStashSeal.text: There's magic keeping this chest sealed; I can feel its aura.

PAD_TriggeredTrap.speaker: Player
PAD_TriggeredTrap.text: Agh! This thing won't yield its contents easily...
PAD_TriggeredTrap.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a moderate jolt of pain.

PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.speaker: Player
PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.text: Chest's unlocked. My prayers are answered.
PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a prayer unlocking a magically sealed chest.

session_synopses.PAD_NoticeShrine: The party comments on a little shrine they've discovered in a cavern - a grotto containing a statue and some prayers and offerings left by worshippers. Players may or may not recognise that the statue is the goddess Selûne. Shadowheart, as well as certain cleric/paladin tags, will recognise the statue always.
session_synopses.PAD_PickupPrayerSheet: The player comments after picking up an old prayer sheet. They may or may not recognise that it could help them unlock a magically sealed chest.
session_synopses.PAD_NoticeStashSeal: Following a passive arcana check, the player comments that a chest discovered at a shrine has a spell cast over it, protecting its contents.
session_synopses.PAD_TriggeredTrap: The player reacts to a magically-locked chest injuring them upon attempting to open it without disabling the protections.
session_synopses.PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer: The player passes comment after they manage to open a magically sealed chest by reciting a prayer they found. If Shadowheart or a worshipper of Shar is speaking, the prayer does nothing.

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: I've got the plans and the sussur bark. Now I need somewhere to craft it all.

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: The forge at the blacksmith's house should do.

VB_TakePlans.speaker: Player
VB_TakePlans.text: Weapon blueprints. They call for sussur bark...

VB_TakeJournal.speaker: Player
VB_TakeJournal.text: Interesting. I wonder if those blueprints survived.

VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.speaker: Player
VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.text: What in the hells was that?

VB_FindWeakWall.speaker: Player
VB_FindWeakWall.text: A wonder this shoddy wall hasn't already collapsed.

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *A candy-sweet scent wafts forth: the sussur bark infuses the weapon from within the flames.*

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *The flames sputter away. The sword is complete.*

PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.speaker: Player
PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.text: If only I knew where to find some.

session_synopses.VB_TakeSussurSap: Voice bark: player takes sussur sap from a tree. SUSS-er. Needed to make a special weapon.
session_synopses.VB_TakePlans: Player reads the blueprints of an incredible weapon.
session_synopses.VB_TakeJournal: The players read a journal from an apprentice smith who wrote about how he'd designed a powerful weapon.
session_synopses.VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear: Player sees a phase spider slip in and out of reality.Probably not clear exactly what it was.
session_synopses.VB_FindWeakWall: Player finds a weak wall. Something's behind it.
session_synopses.ForgeWeapon: The player has all the ingredients and fires up the furnace to make their masterwork.This is all narration; narration needed as most of this scene will likely not be visually communicative.
session_synopses.PAD_NatureCheckOutcome: Player is commenting on a rare ingredient needed for crafting a powerful weapon. Sussur bark can only be found in the Underdark.

session_synopses.PAD_PlayerHeardEttercapWarning: The player has touched a spider web and heard an ettercap scream in response. They realise the ettercap has found out they are there.

AD_Combat_Goblins_Ranger_01.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Combat_Goblins_Ranger_01.text: You'll look good with a few arrows sticking out of your gut!

node_data.speaker: Fank
node_data.text: Chicken?

node_data.speaker: Fank
node_data.text: No. You not chicken.

session_synopses: Ogre in the middle of a meal. Dumb as a box of rocks. Mistakes you momentarily for a chicken.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: What've we got 'ere...? Oh.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lead goblin's face falls mid-sentence when he realises he's being confronted by a drow.NodeContext: The goblin loses his bluster mid sentence upon realising he's facing a feared drow

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Stop this thiiiing!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: A captive deep gnome swings past on the sail of a spinning windmill. Though he's in peril, this is basically being played as a comedic beat.NodeContext: Distressed. The deep gnome is tied to the sail of a windmill and desperately calls for help as he rotates. He's a short-moderate distance away and has to shout to be heard.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The goblin seems unsure whether to bow to you or attack.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: Narration.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: W-what do you want, or, I mean... what do you need?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nervous, fumbling over his words. He's naturally afraid of drows such as the player.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave, immediately. This prisoner is mine now.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Y-you want that little pipsqueak...? But we're supposed to take 'im hostage...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Caught between deferential and wary.The drow player could be his superior, or an outside threat.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: ...but you know that, of course... erm... don't you?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Warily seeking confirmation that the player is a superior of his, and not some random stranger.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: You... you are blessed, ain't ya? A True Soul?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Warily seeking confirmation that the player is a superior of his, and not some random stranger.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Attack the goblins.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: W-wha? Quick, get 'em!

AD_InvestigateMill.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_InvestigateMill.text: Why's the spinnymajigger stopped? Get it moving again!
AD_InvestigateMill.context: NodeContext: Impatient and suspicious.The windmill that the goblins are using to torment their captive has stopped - their leader wants his cronies to investigate and get the windmill working again.

AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.text: Look's like the fun's over. C'mon, let's see who else we can snatch.
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.context: NodeContext: Calling to his assembled goblin cronies - 'c'mon fellas, let's wrap it up here.'

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are watching him spin around. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using a cult symbol of authority as a way to convince the goblins, if they have it. FOR_GnomeGoblin_1 (Fezzerk) is the leader of the goblins and does most of the talking. If the player is a drow, the goblins will be much more nervous and easier to intimidate. At times, the captive goblin pipes up from the windmill, loudly pleading or berating his captors.
session_synopses.AD_InvestigateMill: Some goblins tormenting a gnome tied to a windmill are surprised when it stops rotating.
session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone: The goblins are leaving after witnessing their captive gnome get launched from the blade of a windmill at high speed. Now that their amusement's been catapulted away, they have no reason to linger.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Mm, mm, mm. Fortune favours my belly, for there is no meat more succulent than a stranger's.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Stranger: be you friend or food? The mark is Her measure: show us the brand of the Absolute.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll do you one better - I'm one of her chosen disciples.
True

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Indeed? How regrettable, that your meat must go unsavoured.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Now speak or go, before my cravings conquer me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Should suddenly sound all ogre-ish and stupid. He's talking to his stupid brothers.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I've seen few other ogres in these parts.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: I follow the scents of blood and gold to all lands fertile, friend.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: And this land proves particularly... fruitful.

session_synopses: Loomp is the smart ogre. he checks for your mark since he is working for the goblin boss. You can convince him (and his fellow ogres, if they are there) to join you in battle. He should sound intelligent and HUNGRY.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: Send them to the dirt!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Preparing for battle - and excited for it.

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid). Delivery should be vicious and mean-spirited - they're torturing a helpless gnome for sport.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.text: I feel a breeze - I wonder what's down there.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.context: NodeContext: This person doesn't trust it.

PAD_WebWarning.speaker: Player
PAD_WebWarning.text: Better be careful - those webs carry vibrations.

session_synopses.VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance: The player finds the deep pit leading to the underdark.
session_synopses.PAD_WebWarning: PAD when seeing webs. Either just complaining about the fact that the spiderwebs are everywhere, or realising touching them could be dangerous.

Dinner.speaker: Karlach
Dinner.text: I don't like this at all.
Dinner.context: NodeContext: This place is in the Hells, though Karlach doesn't realize that yet. She's put off but trying to stay cool.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: The House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.
Dinner.context: CinematicNodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.NodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: Go on. Partake. Enjoy your supper. After all...

Dinner.speaker: Player
Dinner.text: Ignore him and fill your plate.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: Not easily rattled, I see. Good. Makes the next part that much more straightforward.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: What's better than a devil you don't know?

Dinner.speaker: Karlach
Dinner.context: NodeContext: Surprise, even fear in her voice. This is early in the game so she's still fresh from the hells. Referring to Raphael's first revelation of who he is.

session_synopses.Dinner: The monitor has teleported you to a mysterious room and offered you dinner - and a deal.

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: Away! Speak to Fezzerk.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presenceNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presence

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog grows more aggressive

session_synopses.Dead: Using Speak with Dead, we are able to talk to the spirit of Gomwick. He was killed by a band of gnolls, but managed to save his dog, Scratch, by forcing him to flee.
session_synopses.Dog:
In SwA, Scratch speaks like a human. He doesn't have any kind of dog-like affectation, nor is he stupid - he's well-spoken, even when he's saying 'dog' things. Throughout the dialogue, he's stoic but heartbroken, deluding himself into believing that his master is not dead.We come across the corpse of a man being protected by his loyal dog, Scratch.The dog refuses to let us near the dead man or his belongings, forcing us to try and win him over (or else just kill him). We can use Speak with Animals to get further insight into the dog's perspective.
 If we cast Speak with Dead upon the courier, we can learn the dog's name and use this as an additional way to win it over.

EmptyMindflayerPod.speaker: Narrator
EmptyMindflayerPod.text: *An empty mind flayer vessel. If its occupant survived, they're nowhere to be seen.*

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_002.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_002.text: The Absolute's got my back - I ain't afraid of nothin'!

session_synopses.EmptyMindflayerPod: Players encountered an empty pod in forest.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: C'mon, blood-breath. Let's find you something to eat.
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a worg companion, urging it to come along.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Worg
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Worgs are vicious beasts but have a little more sentience than most animals, and are capable of rudimentary speech.

session_synopses.AD_Leaving: A band of goblins elect to leave the area where they've been 'playing' with gnome prisoner after the player convinced them to clear off, one way or another. One goblin beckons to a worg - time to head off.

AD_Goblin_00.speaker: Goblin Warrior
AD_Goblin_00.text: Watch what you touch. If'n it smells like wee it's claimed, right?

session_synopses.AD_Goblin_00: Goblin is standing in ruined cottage, fiercely protecting what meagre loot they've found.

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Goblin Warrior
CheckpointGuards.text: 'Allo and welcome to Bogrot! Now, kindly - giz all your stuff.
CheckpointGuards.context: NodeContext: A goblin's closest approximation of courtesty, faintly mocking. He's loudly welcoming you to the town he has dubbed 'Bogrot'

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuards.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

AD_StartedCombat.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_StartedCombat.text: You must got a death wish, sneakin' around in my town.

session_synopses.CheckpointGuards: This goblin is guarding the entrance to a town his squad have occupied. The residents are long-dead, the town abandoned, and so he's taken it upon himself to rechristen the village as 'Bogrot'.
session_synopses.PAD_SpottedAmbush: This PAD plays if players pass a successful Perception check when entering an abandoned village. Goblins are sneaking around in the village, setting up an ambush.

ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.speaker: Narrator
ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.text: *This fight could have been avoided, but now you've made it inevitable.*
ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.context: NodeContext: Hostile. A pre-combat utterance potentially spoken by any goblin or worg at the windmill

session_synopses.ApproachedUnfortunateGnome: Rather than openly approaching the goblins/worgs near the windmill, a player snuck by and then gets spotted once they're near the windmill. Combat starts immediately.

AD_Crack.speaker: c1a1d9d2-d3b5-49fc-ad48-9312552c7caa
AD_Crack.context: InternalNodeContext: SFX only - wood creaking and snapping under strain.NodeContext: SFX only - do not record

session_synopses.AD_Crack: SFX only. A tree trunk bridge across a ravine groans and creaks under the weight of the player as they walk across it. Two seconds after this sound is heard, it'll collapse entirely.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A feast fit for an ogre. You notice a peculiar dagger protruding from the tough, leathery meat.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The dagger still juts from the meat.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Grasp the handle and pull the dagger with all your might.
False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You tug at the dagger until the blade snaps in two. The sharp end is still stuck inside the meat.*

session_synopses: Near a forest village, there are remains of an ogre campfire and meat spit over it. There's a cool dagger stuck in the meat. The player can attempt to retrieve it in a few ways (2 are listed here, but feel free to add another branch).

session_synopses.AD_Mocking: Worg laughing at the unfoiruntae gnome getting tossed around.

AD.speaker: Fank
AD.text: Gnome taste good. Like bear.

AD.speaker: Chock
AD.text: Dwarf better. Dwarf sweet like honey.

AD.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AD.text: Must you? This inane chatter pains me.

AD.speaker: Chock
AD.text: Hm?

AD.speaker: Fank
AD.text: Hm?

AD.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AD.text: Oh, for... shut mouth! Head hurt!
AD.context: NodeContext: He is exasperated. Then he speaks in typical ogre speak.

session_synopses.AD: Three ogres have a meal time discussion. Chock and Fank are stupid. Lump is smart.
session_synopses.AD_Summoned: Ogres speak ADs when summoned into battle.They are hungry and ready to tear their targets apart

session_synopses.Bugbear_Dead: A dialogue with the bugbear's corpse after a player killed him. 'Butters' is Buthir, the ogre he loves.

session_synopses.002: Novice Brynna, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, currently standing guard in the goblin camp. If the player met and won her over previously in the forest, she'll refer to this and speak deferentially.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: A wine bottle? A scholar with good taste, perhaps.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Or maybe a bit of a drinking problem.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for FOR. The player finds a book hiding a secret bottle of wine.

AD_Plead.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_Plead.context: NodeContext: mocking barcus as he (barcus) flies on the windmill pane.

AD_Plead.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_Plead.context: NodeContext: Calling down to a goblin who has him captive on the windmill. Said while spinning on windmill.

SpeedUp.speaker: Narrator
SpeedUp.text: NodeContext: Intentionally blank for cinematic purposes
SpeedUp.context: NodeContext: Intentionally blank for cinematic purposes

SpeedUp.text: CinematicNodeContext: Unfortunate Gnome gets flung off.
SpeedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unfortunate Gnome gets flung off.

session_synopses.AD_Plead: Fezzerk the goblin calls up to his captive, Barcus Wroot, who is being spun on the blade of a windmill, mocking his efforts to attract help.
session_synopses.SpeedUp: Narration - the player senses the windmill's rotation is speeding up after a brake is released.
session_synopses.AD_RotatingFasterReaction: Said while being spun faster on the pane of a windmill. Should be in a panic.
session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomeFreed: After being let off the pane of the windmill.

LastCub.speaker: Narrator
LastCub.text: *The cub looks from you to his dead mother.*
LastCub.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cub looks from dead mother to the player, wailing.NodeContext: Narrator node!

PAD_HealedOwlbear.speaker: Player
PAD_HealedOwlbear.text: Healed - but she doesn't look much happier.
PAD_HealedOwlbear.context: NodeContext: Karlach: 'I healed you, owlbear--> you still look like you're gonna rip my face off.'

session_synopses.LastCub: In SwA, this cub speaks in short bursts - he sounds staccato, vicious.The player has killed an owlbear - a large, predatory wild animal. The owlbear's cub remains however, and lingers by his dead mother. The player can decide whether to put the cub out of its misery, or else leave it. If the player has the speak with animals skill, they get some additional insight into the cub's anxiety. If the player lets the cub live, it will proceed to eat its mother - it's still a wild animal, after all.
session_synopses.PAD_HealedOwlbear: A short VB after player heals the Owlbear in gameplay. Owlbear is still dangerous, though. This can happen either before or after the player has interacted with Owlbear. It's meant to give feedback on the fact that the owlbear is now healed, but not to encourage the player to provoke her.

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: Lapis root? Saffa? Rare to see these so far north.

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: A shame they've wilted, these must have cost a fortune.

VB_ReadLedger.speaker: Player
VB_ReadLedger.text: It says there's a cellar here somewhere.

session_synopses.VB_InspectHerbs: The player examines some long-dead herbs in an abandoned house. They may notice the herbs themselves are unusual and exotic - not what you'd typically expect to be cultivated in a small-town apothecary.
session_synopses.VB_ReadLedger: The player comments that a ledger they just read suggests the existence of a cellar; one they haven't found yet.
session_synopses.MagicMirror: Player finds a talking mirror that seems to be guarding a door to its old master's secret room. It doesn't recognise you as its master, so it challenges you with three questions to see if you're  friend or foe. If you get the questions wrong, it activates a trap to try and kill you. The mirror hasn't been used in a long time - its master died years ago. The mirror speaks in a cracked, broken voice.
session_synopses.AD_QuasitReactsToTrap: The player has triggered a trap because the quasit gave the wrong answer. Quasit is DELIGHTED. Cackling madly as she runs about.

AD_OwlbearDead.speaker: Brynna
AD_OwlbearDead.text: We did it. For Edowin. And the Absolute.
AD_OwlbearDead.context: NodeContext: Amazed and jubilant. She just witnessed her superior slay a dangerous beast.

session_synopses.AD_OwlbearDead: Two cult novices express jubilation as their leader successfully kills a dangerous wild beast that killed their brother.

VB_OwlBearPrints.speaker: Player
VB_OwlBearPrints.text: Looks like a beast came through here - a big one too.
VB_OwlBearPrints.context: NodeContext: Cautious. Spoken in reference to a large set of animal tracks they've spotted.

session_synopses.VB_OwlBearPrints: The player discovers a large set of animal tracks. They may be able to identify them as those of an owlbear.

session_synopses.AD_Occupied: A Flaming Fist searching a burning building for survivors. This AD is triggered when the player tries to interact with them, but they are unavailable for dialogue.

VB_House.speaker: Player
VB_House.text: I hear shouting. Someone needs help.

DeadCiv1_Dead.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead.text: You're a medium! You're going to speak to her.

DeadCiv1_Dead.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead.text: Could you ask her something for me?

DeadCiv1_Dead.speaker: Player
DeadCiv1_Dead.text: Be quiet. I have questions of my own.

session_synopses.VB_DeadDrow1Armor: Party comments on finding the armour of a dead drow in the tavern region.
session_synopses.VB_House: PC approaches tavern where Flaming Fists are trying to break through.
session_synopses.DeadCiv1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - a civilian that was caught in the middle. She stopped in Wakeen's Rest with her husband and daughter in the middle of their journey to Waterdeep for a wedding. She watched her family butchered by goblins before being killed herself.

session_synopses.AD_AlertingYapping: After hyena sees the player, before running and calling other gnolls, it skips it's first turn in combat nervously yapping.
session_synopses.AD_CallingHowl: After hyena sees the player, it runs to the nearby pack of gnolls and howls to get their attention.

Healthy_01.speaker: Hyena
Healthy_01.text: Go away. Or you will become new flesh.

Healthy_01.speaker: Hyena
Healthy_01.text: I will make you new flesh.

Healthy_01.speaker: Hyena
Healthy_01.text: Feed the beast. Feed the Butcher.

Healthy_01.speaker: Hyena
Healthy_01.text: Your flesh will grow inside us. Better flesh, thinking flesh.

VB_PostFight_3P.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_3P.text: I'd prefer not to see it again, that's for sure.

VB_PostFight_3P.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_3P.text: Best to move before the blood draws more of them.

PAD_HyenaRunning.speaker: Player
PAD_HyenaRunning.text: Watch it - that hyena's going for help!

session_synopses.Healthy_01: A hyena in the plains is displeased when the player is close, wanting to devour them to please Yeenoghu.
session_synopses.VB_PostFight_3P: Three players have just finished a fight with gnolls. Before or during the fight, they saw new-born gnolls bursting out of the stomaches of dead or dying hyenas.
session_synopses.04: A second player using Speak With Animals talks to a hyena while the first player speaks to the Dying Hyena. This will always end in combat.
session_synopses.PAD_HyenaRunning: When the party starts the combat with dying hyenas, one of them - healthy hyena - will run away to call the gnolls nearby. This PAD is to ensure the player will understand what hyena is up to.
session_synopses.AD_GnollBorn: A hyena erupts, whining in agony as it dies, and unleashing a new gnoll into the world.

session_synopses.AD_Occupied: A Flaming Fist searching a burning building for survivors. This AD is triggered when the player tries to interact with them, but they are unavailable for dialogue.

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: Stop staring, start helping!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Less angry and more annoyed, actually.

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: Grand Duke Ravengard could be inside! Don't just stand there - push!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Urgent and focused; slightly annoyed with PC.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Push against the wreckage.
True

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: Inside, hurry! We don't have much time!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressing the whole groupNodeContext: Relieved and ready to move move move

PAD_ToldOfZhentDungeon.speaker: Player
PAD_ToldOfZhentDungeon.text: They do seem a bit short-handed.

session_synopses: A group of Flaming Fists are trying to force a way into the burning inn at Waukeen's Rest. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be Grand Duke Ravengard, who they had been sent to protect.
session_synopses.PAD_ToldOfZhentDungeon: The player has just told a Flaming Fist guard that Zhentarim are hiding in a nearby cave. The guard brushes it off because they don't have the numbers to take on a Zhent stronghold.

PAD_OtherWay.speaker: Player
PAD_OtherWay.text: There's got to be another way in.
PAD_OtherWay.context: NodeContext: The burning is on fire. Said with some urgency.

session_synopses.PAD_OtherWay: Player remarks that there must be a way inside the burning building if they weren't able to bust down the front door.

AwayFromCorpse.speaker: Fist Recruit Tristan
AwayFromCorpse.text: We shouldn't stay too long. The goblins might come back.
AwayFromCorpse.context: NodeContext: He's politely telling the player to go away.

AwayFromCorpse.speaker: Player
AwayFromCorpse.text: All these people... how many did you lose?

AwayFromCorpse.speaker: Fist Recruit Tristan
AwayFromCorpse.text: The whole guard. Every last one of them.

AwayFromCorpse.speaker: Fist Recruit Tristan
AwayFromCorpse.text: They were cut down like animals. It's senseless.

session_synopses.AwayFromCorpse: A Flaming Fist soldier standing in the aftermath of a drow raid on an inn. There were many casualties, and it's hitting him hard.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Trying to be authoritative, but completely in over his head.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: I'll feed your innards to the ants before I do that, istik.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Last-ditch effort to enforce authority.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: No, look up. That was your last chance, istik. Now burn!
DragonEvent.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon appears and does an air-to-ground attack, roasting the Flaming Fists. It goes to land somewhere and its rider, Kith'rak Voss, dismounts. He approaches the other githyanki.InternalNodeContext: Dragon destroys bridge, dragon lands, knight starts talking to BarethaNodeContext: 'I'm done with you'.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Stop wasting time, Baretha. You're not here to play with the locals.
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Berating an underling. Baretha pronounced Bar-eh-tha. A gith name.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: Of course, kith'rak. We merely sought to -
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Kith'rak - 'Captain' - a gith commander in charge of ten sarths (100 warriors total). Pronounced Kith-rack

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: No excuses. Question, kill, then move on. Find the weapon.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Our queen watches us. Fail her at your peril.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Hrast, another one! Keep back, flatface - I know how to handle myself!
TieflingScout.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ellyka is immediately defensive, brandishing a dagger at the gith player.NodeContext: Hrast pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Similar to damn/fuck in common language.

TieflingScout.speaker: Player
TieflingScout.text: Take it easy, I'm only disguised as a gith.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: What? Why...? Never mind. I don't want to know.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: So... you not looking to make trouble for me, are you? Whatever you are?

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: ... good. I've enough trouble as it is - look at that lot down there.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Those things you're masquerading as. Armed to the teeth. And they've a dragon.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: I was counting on crossing that bridge and heading to Baldur's Gate. To safety.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Now I've got to find another way around. Take your chances against that lot if you like.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Don't follow me - find your own way.

TieflingScout.speaker: Player
TieflingScout.text: Seems you have good survival instincts - maybe you should join me instead.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: I go my own way. Alone.

PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.speaker: Player
PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.text: Dead - by her own kin's hand.

AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.speaker: Ellyka
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.text: Helm protect me, where'd that beast come from...?
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.context: NodeContext: A tiefling refugee reacts with terror and awe upon seeing a dragon fly overhead.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontationLaezel.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the githyanki's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.text: You. Stay put, and keep your lips sealed.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Rider - my time is short. Lead me to...
ConfrontationLaezel.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel begins to bow as she speaks to the kith'rak

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Were I not merciful, I would slice the skin clean from your meat.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Yet you are not bleeding. For I am nothing if not merciful.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Player
ConfrontationLaezel.text: If you wish to speak, speak to me.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel looks up from bowing at the player in anger

CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.text:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away.
NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.
CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away.
NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: What easy prey you make, walking right within my blade's embrace.

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: These creatures are so simple to ensnare, Baretha. You mewl too much about your task.

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: And as for you, tell me - why shouldn't I run you through this instant?

Confrontation.speaker: Player
Confrontation.text: Try it - let's see who walks away alive.

AD_StandOff.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff.text: Your babbling tires me, istik. Move your carcass!
AD_StandOff.context: CinematicNodeContext: Authoritative demandingNodeContext: Authoritative demanding. 'istik' =  'Stranger' - Catch-all term for non-gith. Pronounced Iss-tick

AD_StandOff.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
AD_StandOff.text: B-by order of the Flaming Fist, halt!
AD_StandOff.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unintelligent confusionNodeContext: Unintelligent confusion

AD_StandOff.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff.text: Or what? Show us what you can do, worm.
AD_StandOff.context: NodeContext: Htak'-a meaning "Die!" in gith language

ReadingMap.speaker: Lae'zel
ReadingMap.context: NodeContext: Tir'su: the githanki alphabet. Pronounced TEAR-soo.

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *Magical energy courses through the slate, then to Lae'zel.*

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *A mystical map glows before Lae'zel, revealing a githyanki refuge beyond the mountain pass.*

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *The slate also reveals the githyanki's purpose: they are combing the Sword Coast in search of a polyhedric relic of great importance to their queen.*

ReadingMap.speaker: Lae'zel
ReadingMap.text: The map is clear - I will soon reach a githyanki crèche. It lies within an ancient temple at the mountain pass.

ReadingMap.speaker: Lae'zel
ReadingMap.text: I must hurry forth. Purification is at hand.

PAD_LaezelReadMap.speaker: Lae'zel
PAD_LaezelReadMap.text: A githyanki crèche lies beyond the mountain pass.

AD_LaezelBetrayed.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelBetrayed.text: Traitors to our queen: I will make you suffer!
AD_LaezelBetrayed.context: NodeContext: Calls out after battle starts.

AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn.text: You are outmatched. An inglorious bloodletting awaits.

PAD_DragonShadow.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow.text: A dragon-rider. My kin are hunting - blood will be spilled.

PAD_DragonShadow.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow.context: NodeContext: Unnerved at the sight of a dragon flying overhead

PartyReaction.speaker: Player
PartyReaction.text: These gith are formidable - but not infallible. We can take them in battle, should it come to that.

PartyReaction.speaker: Player
PartyReaction.text: Let's see if they want to have their blood spilled.

AD_SearchingCorpses.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
AD_SearchingCorpses.text: Get to work, Baretha! Search the dead!
AD_SearchingCorpses.context: NodeContext: Baretha pronounced Bar-eh-tha. A gith name.

AD_SearchingCorpses.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_SearchingCorpses.context: NodeContext: Kith'rak - 'Captain' - a gith commander in charge of ten sarths (100 warriors total). Pronounced Kith-rack

AD_SearchingCorpses.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_SearchingCorpses.text: You heard him - search every corpse!
AD_SearchingCorpses.context: NodeContext: Directed towards the other two gith warriors who are present.

session_synopses.DragonEvent: A Flaming Fist detachment tries to confront a githyanki war band. The Flaming Fists are completely outmatched, however; the githyanki warriors dismiss their demands. Moments later, a githyanki controlled dragon roasts the Flaming Fists in a fly-by. Afterwards, the dragon rider, a senior gith, berates his subordinate for her slow mission progress.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelRunsToKnight: Non-recruited Lae'zel calls out to the gith knight.
session_synopses.TieflingScout: A tiefling scout from the Druid Grove hides and observes as a Githyanki war party massacres some Flaming Fists. The tiefling may warn the player that they are too weak to take on such opponents, before running off.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelKilledByGith: Player returning to the Gith Chokepoint area after leaving Lae'zel behind -- she has been killed by the gith
session_synopses.AD_ScoutReactsToDragon: A tiefling refugee observes a war party of githyanki warriors guarding a bottleneck in the main road leading out of the region. The githyanki are alien and fearsome to the tiefling. She reacts with shock when she sees how they have a dragon circling overhead in support.
session_synopses.ConfrontationLaezel:
Alternate version of the dragon rider scene at chokepoint. Lae'zel is alive and was never recruited. Player can recruit her after this.

Lae'zel approaches the rider to discover where to find the creche. A cure for the tadpole can be found there - or so she believes. However, the knight is under different orders.
session_synopses.CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave: Cinematic: Kith'rak Voss flies away on his dragon.The player interrupted the Gith Chokepoint situation. The most likely interruption is triggering a combat (player attacks any npc there including Voss or the dragon, or drags another hostile npc near them)This interruption happens in gameplay, so normally the Rider (Kith'rak Voss) and the Dragon would also leave in gameplay, but animations don't have the tech support to make the Rider ride the dragon like this, so we play this cutscene instead
session_synopses.Confrontation: Our party encounters a band of githyanki warriors who have taken position at bottleneck in the region - a bridge that provides one of the few paths of progression. The gith confront us and try to see if we know anything about the 'weapon' they seek. (The weapon in question is the strange puzzle box we are carrying.) While reading our thoughts, the githyanki may realise we are tadpoled, resulting in instant combat. If we manage to conceal our tadpoles, they may allow us to pass.
session_synopses.AD_StandOff: A flaming fist solider nervously attempts to challenge a githyanki warrior. The gith is essentially an alien to the lowly soldier; he can't help but feel intimidated.
session_synopses.ZorruFriend_Dead: Yul was Zorru's friend. Player finds him dead already and may have heard about him before if they talked to Zorru with Lae'zel.
session_synopses.ReadingMap: |Item interaction: player clicks on the githyanki map and tries to read it. Githyanki are able to read it.Lae'zel is added in the 3th speaker slot. Any others are in the second slot. If Lae'zel is taking the map from somebody, they are both speakers in the dialog. Otherwise the second or third slot are null.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelReadMap: After reading the Githyanki Map, Lae'zel Avatar urges the rest of the party to go to the crèche.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelBetrayed: |Lae'zel Companion only: the player attacked the gith during 'PLA_GithChokepoint_ConfrontationLaezel', and Voss commanded Baretha to kill them all (the player + Lae'zel) OR, the situation naturally ended in combat. Lae'zel is betrayed, and this AD makes it clear to the player.|
session_synopses.AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn: Small remark that the players don't stand a chance.
session_synopses.PAD_DragonShadow: A dragon flies over the party. They may or may not  recognise it. If they're a gith, they'll always recognise it and suppose that their kin must be operating nearby.
session_synopses.PartyReaction: Companions react to the gith chokepoint (dragon flew by and killed the flaming fists). Lae'zel is handled in a different dialog.
session_synopses.AD_SearchingCorpses: Kith'rak Voss, a high-ranking gith warrior, berates his underling, Sarth Baretha, and orders her and her warriors to search the corpses of some humans they'rve just killed. They are looking for 'the weapon' (in fact a strange puzzle box in the possession of our party).

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: Hey. Hi. You're here. What're you, then?

Hyena_002.speaker: Player
Hyena_002.text: I'm a god, walking in mortal flesh.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: Oh. Holy, good holy. We follow Yeenoghu holy.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: He makes us hungry. Always hungry.

session_synopses.Gnoll_FangOfYeenoghu_01: A Fang of Yeenoghu (magically gifted gnoll) communicates with a barking hyena-like laugh
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_01: An aggressive gnoll lurks outside a cave where prey are hiding
session_synopses.Hyena_002: A hyena with a pack of gnolls is anxious and curious about players who get close enough to speak without being attacked by the rest of the pack
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_02: An aggressive gnoll lurks outside a cave where prey are hiding
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_03: A gnoll in a pack cackles as it waits to attack prey
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_04: A gnoll pack-member lurks outside a cave, gnawing body of a dead Zhentarim agent.
session_synopses.Gnoll_FangOfYeenoghu_01_AD: Gnoll idle sounds that play as this gnolls performs blood ritual over the dead Zhentarim agent's body: bites its teeth into the flesh and rips it apart howling in frenzy.
session_synopses.GnollRanger02_AD: A gnoll standing near a cave entrance with the rest of its pack. Idle SFX as it growls, barks etc
session_synopses.GnollRanger01_AD_Angry: Gnoll howls angrily after being instigated / attacked by Flind.
session_synopses.Flind_AD: Flind gnoll idle sounds that play as part of a pack of the monsters waits near a cave entrance where prey are hiding. It's normal sounds are snarls and growls while it's drawing the Symbol, and "angry" sounds are played after killing zhents or attacking other gnolls.

session_synopses.AD_PerceptionSucceeded: Player line that triggers on encountering the Zhentarim hideout - in case of successful perception roll, failed perception roll, or having been told of the hideout in advance
session_synopses.AD_Backup: Plays when Salazon spots an NPC he can't have a dialogue with (summon, animal, party follower)

Agent_003_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_003_Dead.context: NodeContext: After casting a speak with dead spell

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Hear that? Someone's fighting the gnolls! We should help!
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: Upon hearing a fight break out between players and a gnoll pack - Shouting to his friend who is nearby

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Don't be a fool, lad. Shut your mouth, and keep your head down.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: shushing his friend on first line to avoid getting spotted and involved in a fight

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Leave the heroics to them that don't value their own skin.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: in a hushed voice, to a companion rather than to players as a fight they're avoiding unfolds nearby

Agent_002.speaker: Olly
Agent_002.text: Gods, I thought you were one of them beasts!

Agent_001_CrimeSevere.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_CrimeSevere.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

VB_BloodSymbol.speaker: Player
VB_BloodSymbol.text: That symbol, in the blood... what does it mean?

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: InternalNodeContext: Looting the bodyNodeContext: sad but pragmatic - standing over a dead companion

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: InternalNodeContext: pocketing the moneyNodeContext: said while pocketing the money looted from his dead friend

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime.context: NodeContext: surprised shout as we tamper with his cargo

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime.text: Leave the bloody chest, and concentrate on the monsters!

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.text: How are you holding up, Rugan?
